text: Love the location and vibe here. There is a great space to relax, meet up with friends or just enjoy some healthy food and drinks. I tried the Violet Wave. It was a great smoothie, however the prices are really high at $7.50. I've lived in many juice friendly cities that have organic fresh juices and smoothies and this is by far the most expensive place I've tried. I'm not sure my wallet can handle frequent visits but for a splurge once in awhile, I'll  definitely come back.

It was our first time, and we had NO IDEA that it was a "betta have a reservation" place! But, Deirdre, who we found out later was the manager, found us a table for FOUR! She, Kevin, & ALL the servers were FANTABULOUS!! We had SOO much fun pickin appetizers & drinks & the place was just buzzin with HAPPY! The food was AWESOME, even tho we'd never had many things on the menu, like Crispy Brussel Sprouts, Yellow Beet salad, & Pate'! The stuff we were used to like raw/fried/baked oysters, & crisped french baguette sliced was PERFECT! Oyster ACTUALLY tasted like OYSTERS...even the FRIED ones (they & the raw ones are part of Happy Hour fare, along with half priced cocktails & wine)! I kno this is LONG but it's worth EVERY WORD! I'd recommend this place to EVERYONE, from locals to tourists! THANK U guys for makin us feel SOO at home!

I guess I should be glad Brandon has a decent local bar and grill with decent food but dad gum it guys, could you at least act like you give a shit. Worst customer service ever. I keep going back because of the grouper sandwich but I suspect Shells sells them too so next time I get a craving I think I will give them a try. Stay tuned.

Went in today for simple pedicure. It has got to be the worst paint job.  It was my first time at this place. When the nail tech was done it looked like the lady painted the nails, but just dropped a dollop of gloss on top and you can clearly see the separation between the coats.  She told me it was because my nail beds are darker, I said, "I get pedi all the time, they have never looked like that."  The nail tech did offer to re-do them, but I was fed up and just wanted to go.  Ended up paying $30.00 for crap!

We never expected to take this tour, but one morning we walked past a little alley and saw a poster and HAD to sign up.  It was a long walk, and a cold and dark January night, but the hair on the back of my neck stood up nearly the whole time.  The tour guide was very entertaining and knowledgeable about the stories.  We even stopped off for a cocktail to warm up and take a quick break.  It was the highlight of my trip to NOLA and I was so happy to have stumbled up it.

No, no, no, no.....just no. My friend and I ordered the fried oysters, seafood gumbo, crawfish pasta and the soft-shelled crab to share. We ate as much as we could, left the restaurant full and satisfied, but then spent the rest of the night sick. Very sick. Like stay-in-the-bathroom-for-hours sick. I am afraid that every time I think about fried seafood, I'll remember this experience and then promptly throw up. 

Other than the raging sickness that descended on our trip, the restaurant was just OK. Service was friendly but awkward (why did we have three servers?) and the food was good but nothing special. We certainly had better gumbo and seafood at other points in our trip (this was a pre-food poisoning opinion).

Best coffee in Santa Barbara. They also make a killer matcha. Friendliest staff in Santa Barbara hands down. Also, the baked goods are out of control. The salted banana bread is addicting and gluten free. They also have a ton of other gf options and a decent bagel by NY standards! My favorite spot to meet up with friends or get work done.

I am not sure why I keep giving Panda Express a chance. It may be that I keep thinking that maybe their food will be better than it was on my previous visit. Regardless, my latest visit is my last visit to Panda Express, if I can help it.
I recently went to their newly opened restaurant on 96th St in the Meijer parking lot...I wasted my money, again.

I ordered the spicy chicken pao, and broccoli beef. They both tasted like soap. Honestly, this is the worst chinese food I have ever tasted. I threw most of it away. You only get two entrees and rice for almost $7. I can go to another chinese restaurant and get that along with a side and drink for that price.  In addition, I have determined that Panda Express tastes like plain, make-at-home chinese. In fact, I think I could do better than this. At least I have finally learned my lesson and know for sure that their food will never be improved. I am just really surprised that they get enough business to need to open another location.

We absolutely loved Hollyberry! We got so many compliments on the food! Hollyberry was so easy to work with and they were professional and friendly during the entire planning process and day-of. They were also so attentive and wonderful during the wedding day. We took our time choosing a caterer and we're so happy we chose Hollyberry!

How many check ins do I have here?  I like this store a lot & the main reason is because of the seemingly limitless variety.  I have never walked into this store & spent less than 30 minutes casually wandering through their well stocked shelves & browsing their ever changing selection.  

If you buy the membership card, you can hang out with the rest of the cool kids at the wine sampling station.  It's automated, simply take a glass, insert your card & pick the wine you wish to sample.  I've made some new friends in this part of the store & who doesn't like shopping after a few samples of wine?

It's a great store, check it out & if you see me there - don't be shy, say hello.

On Friday night, I finally got around to trying out Virago in Lansdale for dinner and, more importantly, dessert. Husband and I split the vegan "beef" cheesesteak wrap. Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I'm dying to try the vegan buffalo chicken wrap. Virago offers a choice of whole wheat or gluten free wraps for any of their sandwiches. This place seems to be all about the gluten free options, with a few great vegan options thrown in the mix too.

The vegan cheesesteak was tasty, full of very mild, fried onions and peppers and a good amount of tasty Daiya cheese. If I had been more hungry, it would have been the perfect amount for a filling dinner. But I wasn't starving and I had to save room for an assortment of dessert. Our dessert was 100% vegan, as well; we split two cupcakes and a pastry. The pastry was a nut bar with caramel and chocolate chips, and it was delightful. The usual pecans were on top, but there were also some hazelnuts in there which was a delicious touch. The cupcakes, coconut chai and coffee chocolate chip, were just okay. The cake itself was a little crumbly and the frosting was a little overpowering. I will return because there are very few places in the burbs with vegan options and there are still a number of vegan options on Virago's menu that I have yet to try!

This is my second favorite Japanese restaurant in Edmonton. I really enjoy their "westernized" roll sushis. My favorite is Dynamite rolls. They also serve a monthly special roll, and they are usually great. Their bento lunch box is more than what you pay - really good deal! I like the one on Westside compared to the other two locations (downtown and Southside) because of the cozy atmosphere. I recommend this place!

Best Chinese Delivery uptown.  From the chicken wings to the Mongolian beef to their BBQ pork it is hands down the best.  I was a fan of Red Star just because it was quick and easy but China Wall is all that and the food is spot on every time.

What other reviewers say is true about Two Old Hippies' pricing. Even though I don't have that kind of cash to spend, I really enjoyed the vibe of the store & looking around. It never hurts to look. They have beautiful merchandise. But, I sure wish I would have seen the SALES RACK :(
What I really enjoyed was the LIVE MUSIC.  I noticed it soon as I walked in on a Saturday late afternoon. I headed in the direction of the small performance space which included a stage, table & chairs. The young dude was singing an Adele tune so beautifully & effortlessly. His original tunes were even more incredible. A gifted word smith. I'm still kicking myself I didn't buy his CD. Note that would have been a great find & buy!!!
If you like mac and cheese, you MUST stop here. I dream about heading to Nashville to hit up  The Stillery for some Mac & Cheese and tasty drinks.

Best burger I've ever eaten...

I LOVE me a good burger and a good burger, in my definition, doesn't need to be all dressed up. It's all about the quality of meat and patty to bun ratio... And BBP nails it. From the simple crunch burger or gooey Sante Fe to onion rings and the fries, one can't go wrong!

So good!

Taking my business elsewhere, needed my military uniform dry cleaned and 3 very small patches put on. Brought in on Wednesday needed by Friday at close. Lady said they were to busy for me. Some way to treat the military. Luckily I found a better place said no problem have it to me Friday at 1.

Uncle Classic Barbershop is a great spot for men's grooming. It's not so frou-frou that a guy feels self-conscious, but rather the manly type of place that makes you feel like your Don Draper. They do all sorts of cuts and are incredibly great at them, while still pricing things reasonably. For those going to Great Clips or Sport Clips, price-wise, it won't be much of a increase  while the quality and experience will be far far better.

They also do straight-razor shaves, and have a variety of hair products that are pretty excellent.

In short: Uncle Classic Barbershop is where men go to get their hair cut when they've grown up.

If heaven has sandwiches, Shank's would do the catering.

Roast beef and sharp provolone with broccoli rabe? Amazing. The only way they could improve it is to give you a wristband to catch the grease dripping down your hand as you devour his Hoaginess.

The balsamic chicken is not to be missed.

I'm originally from Atlanta, GA and have eaten at Longhorn Steakhouses for years.  I was very excited when I found out that one was opening in Tucson even though it is 45 minutes from where I live.

So today I decided to try it out.  I went by myself for a late lunch (around 1:30).  Walked in a was immediately greeted but had to wait a few minutes because I didn't want to sit at the bar.  My server, Amanda, came over and asked for my drink order and I ordered water with extra lemon.  She brought it back shortly but with only one lemon slice and quickly disappeared before I could say anything.  A little later she came back for my food order and when I gave that to her I again asked for extra lemons. 

Then I went to the restroom and when I came back by table had been cleared - no water or silverware and wiped down.  Someone who worked there was near by and I told her that my table had been cleared.  She apologized and told me that my water was "right here".  Right here was a large, round table full of dirty glasses and silverware.  I just looked at her and she said "I'll go get you a new water".  While she was gone to get the water a hostess came up and asked me "did someone seat you here?".  I explained what happened and she said she just wanted to be sure since I didn't have a menu. 

When Amanda brought my salad to me I had to remind her (3rd time) that I was still waiting for my extra lemons.  Finally got them. 

While I was waiting for my food 3 people were seated in the booth next to me.  They had to wait for a server and when one finally came over to them they had questions.  The customers wanted to know about a sauce (not sure which one), the waiter starts to tell them what was in a sandwich.  When the customer said he wanted to know what was in the sauce and not the sandwich the waiter gave him a look of disgust and said "I'm telling you all I know",  looked at them again and then said "I'll be back to take your order" and walked off.  Amanda went to them sometime later and said that she would be their server because he became busy.  One of the other diners stated that she thought they might have scared him off and that he was snarly with them.  Amanda looked at them and said "you're not going to run me off, are you?"  I didn't think the either server was very nice to those diners.

Back to me, once my food arrived the fries were limp, very brown and lukewarm.  Flo's filet came out fine.  I ate my food and I think Amanda only checked back with me once.  Someone else (manager maybe, she didn't identify herself) came to clear the table and asked if I wanted a box for the fires that weren't good.  I told her no and that they weren't very good.  She apologized and asked if I'd like another side.  Hello - I'm through with my meal, offer me a desert or something but not another side.  Received the check shortly afterwards, paid and left.  BTW, the table with the dirty glasses and silverware that was next to me was dirty the whole time I was there.  There were two couples waiting to be seated even though there were empty tables.  I may give this Longhorn another try but more likely than not I'll go to Lil' Abners.

I have no idea what these people are talking about. This place is disgusting. I'm from San Antonio Texas, so I know what 
 Mexican food is supposed to taste like. I'm not expecting New Orleans to have outstanding Mexican food, but this place is completely gross. Eat at your own risk.

Began our weekend in town celebrating our engagement at this delightful Lebanese-cuisine hot spot in Fishtown. Attentive staff, great decor, ambiance and the food: amazing. Babaganoosh. Kebabs. Mmmmm. And the pitas? Wow. Puffy and thin as a wafer; so tasty we ate 3 between us. By-the-glass wine a little pricey, but all in all a good value meal. Once they figure out the parking situation in Fishtown, this restaurant (and every other eatery near there) will be heaving with custom, even more than now.

Went in for the first time today and got carryout. Would love to eat in some time, as the atmosphere and decor are terrific. The food was outstanding - the falafel pita was absolutely delicious. Will definitely go again!

First of all, Lather moved next door to a really bright modern building. The new salon is beautiful!

I had decided to cut off my curly hair and since Kristen got such good reviews, I decided to give her a try. She was incredibly patient with me as I tried to describe what I wanted. She really took her time to understand what I wanted and cut my hair so carefully. Besides her professionalism and skills, she's just an awesome person. Rarely enjoyed a haircut more!

Oh, and I LOVE my hair!
Compassionate and competent.  The bet vet around.  I have had pets for over 40 years, and for the first time, none of my crew minds their trips to the vet.  That speaks volumes.

I have been coming to phamous cafe for over a year now and overall I can say they have good food and are pretty consistent. However, the past few experiences have been somewhat disappointing. The quality has not been consistent, the broth has been a bit oily and the last time I went the chicken was slimy and I got the feeling it was at least a few days old. All in all I would still recommend the restaurant to others but I wouldn't give them high expectations. The spring rolls are always great!!

With an entrance off the street and through the Kimpton's Hotel Monaco lobby, it's easy to find your way in.  A seat on the second floor gives a bit of a view towards Independence Hall.  Dark red weathered bricks and exposed rough looking wood beams lend an "old Philadelphia" air to the setting, but the food is purely modern.  

Corn and crab fried fritters get a bite from chipotle dipping sauce, but could use a bit less breaking, as the sweet corn and crab are a bit overpowered.  The BLT features Brie on brioche, with avocado optional for extra creaminess.  House green salad splits well if you're having apps and a lighter lunch.
They quickly identified the problems with our 2009 Jeep. Repaired to our satisfaction.

I must agree with the other reviews here.  If this company isn't a scam, it sure conducts business as if it were a scam.  
I purchased travel insurance from this company when my son was studying in China.  He contracted a stomach virus and needed brief hospitalization. 
We filed the claim and waited... and waited....
I called them up after about 6 to 8 weeks to see what was going on.  I was told that the review was in process and should be done within a week.  So, I am waiting again
After two weeks with no word I call back and then was told that my claim hadn't been looked at yet.  The customer service rep found it and says, "Well, this documentation is in Chinese.  We'll have to get this translated before we can look at it."  And I remind him that he works for an International Travel Insurance company, which means that there's a good chance supporting documentation will be in another language.  (So, if I hadn't called my claim would still be sitting in a pending pile.  This is about 2 and a half months after I submitted it.)
So, the claim is sent to translation and processed and about 4 weeks later I get a letter in the mail denying my claim in total.  The reason given was that it was a "Pre-existing Condition".  This was a one-time stomach virus.
I sent in an appeal to this decision and waited....
Four weeks goes by with no response.  So I called today to see where it's at and am told that no one has even looked at it.  The CSR tells me that she's going to expedite the appeal and will get back to me in a week or so.  I'm not holding my breath.
Gr8. Safe neighborhood, not like I expected.  Bring change, metered parking.  Coming back.

This location has a good selection of equipment, but NO AIR CONDITIONING! 
Big glass windows let in plenty of sunlight...and lots of heat! For 9 out of the last 10 summers, the air conditioning has not worked at all, even when it's 105 degrees outside. 
Local staff has no ability to fix anything, and "Customer Service" at the corporate level is non-existent. You can't even get through to talk to anyone, they refuse to let you contact management, and they are totally unresponsive. This is just a big corporation run by bean counters trying to cut costs at all costs. They don't care about their members at all. Unless you like it really, really HOT when you work out, find another gym.

Went to Culver's to try their burgers, I've heard so many raves about them. Maybe it's just me, but I don't get the smash burger fad. Ours were dry dry dry. Did I mention they were dry? I guess that's great for some but not me. Give me a juicy thick burger and I'll be happy. Not these hockey pucks.

I went in with my boyfriend to get a pedi and a manicure.  My gal was so sweet and really took her time, however, my boyfriends technician rushed and was done with his service about 30 minutes before I was done!  He said he felt incredibly awkward and bored just sitting there for so long.  I spend the extra money (and by extra, I mean a hell of a lot more than other places) because I expect to be pampered.  I got more pampering at the Walmart nail place. Also, it took over 5 minutes after we walked in for anyone to even acknowledge us.  It's unfortunate because it is a nice place and I love the pink drink but we will not be coming back.  I have read some of the reviews and I realize I am not the only client that has had these problems.

Let me start this review by saying that I have been to Spain and I am quite familiar with traditional Spanish cuisine -- when I was in Spain I did nothing but eat regional dishes cooked by locals and traditional restaurants for two weeks. Never EVER, in a million-billion years, did I ever think that I could find Spanish cuisine that came anywhere close here in the States. Chez Garces certainly proved me wrong. 

Garces is Spanish, so these are true Spanish tapas -- very few Latin American twists to the traditional recipes. You'll find tapas and wine from all regions in Spain -- of which I sampled on my last visit to Amada. Tapas from Catalan, Segovia, Toledo, Madrid and wonderful wines from each region to compliment every bite. 

Every detail of your meal is thought out -- right down to the sparkling water... Absolutely check this place out if you haven't -- it is a MUST-go when you're in Philly.

I've driven past this place almost a million times. I even went in once but left because no one seemed to be there. This time I went in with my mom. The place is not impressive when you first walk in. The dining room is poorly lit and decor very outdated. We weren't planning on eating there anyway, so that didn't really bother me. We ordered the oxtail with rice & beans and collards from the soul food menu and the fried fish and dry rice from the African menu and everything was great. The food is seasoned well and portions hearty. One of the best parts was the 2 spicy condiments that came with the rice and fish. They were really spicy and soooo good. I ended up putting it on everything. I will definitely be returning. The food is good, it's priced well and the people are very friendly. A great addition to Northeast eateries.

After a long drive from North Carolina me and my six best friends decided to go to Arnolds for some southern comfort food. Greg didn't want to go but JB made him, because he is the boss of our friends. After a very short wait I tried the roast beef, with two sides. My sides were fried green tomatoes and mac 'n cheese. Every thing was amazing and all my friends were happy except for Greg. I love this place.

My son and I have been seeing Dr. Barry since 2013. He and his staff have been professional, warm, informative and accommodating. I got diagnosed with cancer in 2014 and after receiving chemo my vision deteriorated but Dr. Barry ensured I received the best care and he has helped me adjust to the effects of chemo on my vision. I am extremely thankful. We have only had one billing problem that was quickly handled. Hats of to the team!
Always a quick win.  Good deals on soup/sandwich combos.  Great selection... though my wife always HATES when I sample pretty much all of them.  Hey, they offered! :-)

We've been here a few times, the beer selection is pretty good, but the seating area can get really crowded and loud. The shorter bartender with facial hair (don't know his name) is really rude even when the place is practically empty.  I want to say something to him like, "This is Tucson, not a giant city, get over yourself." Maybe I can understand a rude bartender when it's crowded and stressful, but not on a slow night.

Amazing food, amazing service! Our server Sarah was super helpful in recommending wine to go with the meal and- more importantly-recommending the Delmonico! Definitely the best steak on the menu! It was cooked to perfection- so melt-in-your-mouth delicious! It was my boyfriend's birthday and they accomodated my special request for amazing seating and also brought out a candle and ice cream to add to the "special" feeling. However, this place makes you feel special the second you walk in. Definitely has the old Hollywood atmosphere going on- very fun-fancy, very classy!

I wouldn't have normally eaten here, but was with a family member who wanted to give it a try. I finally decided to go in and see what it was about. First, the prices are crazy expensive. $11 for a 2 piece meal?!? Plus, they won't let you buy additional pieces of chicken a la carte. With that said, the food came out very hot. I personally thought my chicken could have been fried longer AND it was too greasy. The biscuits are amazing though. I doubt I'll ever return because the chicken is soooo much better at Gus's Fried Chicken.
Crazy variety of indoor and outdoor plants, a lot of exotic stuff you don't really get to get ahold of outside of this nursery.. definitely a must check out if you're a plant head

I am a big fan of mac & cheese. I could eat it all day, everyday if I had to. So when I happened to see this place as we were walking, I just knew we had to try it out!

We ended up eating here for dinner the next night, and I was so happy with our decision! They had so many options for toppings on their delicious classic mac recipe. I ended up deciding on the crabby mac, and my husband chose the basil chicken pesto. We didn't have to wait too long for our food to be ready, and we sat down in the restaurant because all of the outdoor seating was taken. We absolutely loved our meal! It was so filling that I had to take some of it back to our hotel with us. Next time we go back to Philadelphia for a visit, coming back to this place is going to be a priority on our list of things to do!

I had high hopes for this spot because I looooove middle eastern food. Unfortunately, it wasn't the outstanding experience I imagined it would be. Went with my work team so started off with a few apps - whipped feta, hummus and bacon wrapped dates. The table loved the whipped feta the best I would say. The hummus had great texture but tasted a little too lemony to be my favorite. The chickpeas however gave it a nice crunch. I also appreciate cucumbers along with the pita. For my personal meal I had the turkey sandwich. I had hoped for a little spice with the banana pepper vinaigrette, but alas the aioli overpowered the boring sandwich. The people who got the lamb sandwich loved it so that may be the way to go. The bahn bee had very hard bread and was greasy. The worst though were the sides. The fries were so hard that they were more like the potato stick snacks I recall as a kid. The vegetable salad side was too sweet with a weird sauce that no one enjoyed. All and all I doubt I would give it another try even though service was great and the atmosphere is cute. The food needs to step up the game!

Whoa! If only I'd know this place was here sooner!! If you're staying near the airport this is the spot for easy but really delicious food! I ordered a harvest bowl, like a salad. Some guac, street corn, poblano queso, and the tres leches. There wasn't a thing I didn't love, SO yummy! I'm picky about fresh guac and this is as good as I make it at home! It was all so fresh and flavorful. Such a better option than driving all over Nashville!

Really, really good food at the deli and the bakery. That's where they seem to make all their money. You can't go wrong with a slice of pizza or any of the cold deli salads. The grocery part of the store is much less populated, and very expensive. But quite clean and organized! The one gripe I have about this place is the check out line. The place is always packed with people trying to buy lunch yet they seem to only have two check out lanes open. There's also no conveyor belt on which to set your groceries which congests the store even further. Lines form and people get agitated. This is enough of a reason for me to dread stopping in here when I have to pick something up quick!

Nails, nails, nails, nails, nails I do adore :) that is what I was singing in my head when I left Oh la la - I felt like a Hollywood celebrity in this nail shop.

My mom and I were greeted by a very friendly receptionist and a fridge full of bottled water - whhhhaaaat!!!?!?!?!? So cool :) I'm a sucker for the little things! While we waited in the oh-so-cute lobby we chose our nail color. It was a nice touch that they had the new hello kitty OPI nail colors... I'm not one to care about hello kitty, however the colors they have in their collection is perf for classy souls!

When we got called back, i chose the basic pedi for $27 because it had a massage and hot towels with it. The quick pedi was $23, for the extra $4 it was worth it! 

Of course I had to go to the bathroom (I always do, just so I can tell the world my bathroom experiences for Yelp purposes) and the bathroom was so cute and clean! That's always a nice touch!

Overall I feel like from the experience alone this place scores 5 stars. I almost want to only go to this location - well worth the trek up to 86th street!

We have been going for years after seeing it featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive In's, and Dash. They do brunch almost all day on Sunday and feature live blue grass music. The do bottomless mimosa for $12 and they a bunch of different types of juices, So many different, delicious options to get to eat! My favorites include the stoner and Chinese chicken salad. Everything is made fresh! They have a bunch of different side options including every flavor of hummus you can imagine. Definitely check this place out!!! I could see how people think it is insanitary, dogs are allowed inside. Service is a hit or miss

It was a Monday after the first Eagles tailgate and lets just say I was feeling a little rough. One of my coworkers recognized my mental state at the time and referred me to City Hydration. To be honest, I was both skeptical and nervous about IV therapy but hey I was hungover and willing to try it out. 

From the moment I stepped inside City Hydration, all my anxiety and skepticism was put to ease when Christie introduced herself, told me to recline in a comfortable chair, gave me a water and offered a blanket. She knew I was on a tight schedule and with the utmost efficiency she started the hydration process. There was no pain, there was no feeling of coldness, it was a tranquil experience that took no more than 30 minutes. After the process was complete, I stood up and almost immediately recognized that my nauseousness and dizziness was subdued. Christie did state that it could take an hour or two to realize the full results. I'd have to agree with her statement, within a couple hours I was my normal functional self again. I think for anyone who is skeptical, City Hydration is the perfect place to try IV therapy. I would highly recommend it and will go back to try the other IV options. Thanks again Christie you're the best!
Went back since owner responded to my previous review.  Boba was great like before.  Tried grilled pork on rice noodle and it was good.  I do wish their sauce wasn't so watery.

I was staying at the Sheraton and was looking for a place within walking distance so I looked on Yelp and Chef Ron's popped up. 

The food was excellent. While I was eating Chef Ron himself came out and sad hi. I got the stuffed gumbo which is their mumbo gumbo with a piece of fried catfish on top. It was cajun perfect. For desert I got the bread pudding. It was to die for. If you ever go there make sure you finish your meal off with the bread pudding, you wont be dissapointed!

I have now come here twice and loved it. First time I split a French toast and and traditional eggs Benedict with my boyfriend. Both of us loved it. This time I just stopped for a mimosa and some mots sticks. Same server both times, she is very sweet and pleasant. 
Brought my dogs this time and the first thing that was brought out to me when I sat down was a dog bowl full of ice water. I am greatful for that.
Overall just a nice place to relax and enjoy your meal.
I would not recommend going here if you are in a super rush, but on the same note, if you are in a "rush" you should not be stopping at a restaurant to eat.

I've been dying to step foot in this place ever since it opened so I was thrilled when a friend suggested we stop in after dinner.

It's a small place, but bright with elegant and simple decorations. The macarons are neatly displayed like jewelry in their case. There are so many varieties of flavors, but I ultimately ended up with the Coconut. It was delicious. Nice crunch on the outside and then soft as you bite down. And lots of flavor. The four stars is merely because I have had very few macarons in my day so not sure if it's the best one I've had yet or not. But so far it is!

They also have Norman Love chocolates...one of the best chocolatiers in the area. I tried a hazelnut truffle and it was truly heavenly.

They have gelato as well, but I was too distracted by the macarons and chocolates to give that case a look. 

The guy who waited on us was also very nice...and French! Thinking he may have been the owner, or at least a manager.

Can't wait to go again!
Horrible service. Served our food to another table and then brought it to us. Food is OK at best. Better BBQ places in area to chose from.
Just finished lunch here in Ybor City. The pizza is fantastic and the staff are great !!!!
The most amazing deep tissue massage I have every had! I have been to 5 star resorts that don't even do this good of a job. Emily is the best!

I absolutely LOVE Marie's Sandwich Bar!

You cannot get a better sandwich anywhere in the South Jersey area.  The portions are huge, the ingredients fresh, and there is something for everyone.  They even offer gluten-free rolls and soups.  

I have tried the Ruthie, Tony, Diablo, and the Joe; along with various soups (the cream of chicken - OMG!) and salads.  I have never been disappointed!
OK, went here this morning and the coffee is now incredibly weak. I didn't even finish one cup. The noise level is horrific. Something needs to change. I will no longer recommend this restaurant.

My family and I have been long time customers, but over the past year we've noticed a significant decrease in quality. At one time this was the best pizza in town. Not even close anymore. They've definitely sacrificed quality for quantity. And don't even think about placing a delivery order unless you want to wait 2 hours for a cold, soggy $25 medium-sized pizza. Okay option if you can dine in during the weekday, otherwise order elsewhere.

The Iron Door is a unique gift to the Mt Lemmon area.  My 13 year old and I decided to head up the mountain on a rare rainy/cloudy day in September and were greeted with a 57 degree temperature.  Iron Door had the fire place cracklin' and our server, Nelson, was quite humorous and engaging.  The decor reflects the German heritage of the restaurant, and they offer a few German beers as well.  My son had the sliders with grilled onions and I chose to have one of their specials, a green chile chicken & rice soup.  No complaints from either of us, the service was great, the food was great, and the atmosphere was perfect for a rainy day.

I hate snobby people that serves people and think they are better that who they are serving...I practically have to beg for a refill of water...this trick refills my water as it sat on these small ass tables and drips water ALL in my pancakes.

I decided to give this place a try since it was the closest brunch place near me, and I didn't feel like waiting for first watch. It's a very cozy little place, it almost feels like your in someone's home. There's French music playing in the background and a nice little old lady was my server. She constantly checked up on me and asked me if I needed anything. The service was great, my food came out very quickly and the portions are pretty good too. The menu has your basics for breakfast and a few items that definitely catch your eye, like the French omelette. They also serve lunch entrees but it's more than just sandwiches, which is awesome. The chicken cordon bleu was very tempting. 

My friend got the biscuits and gravy. The gravy was very bland. Instead I got the basic good morning breakfast with a side of grit. The eggs were seasoned well, and the grits was average. The pancakes were good. It was a little dense but the flavor was spot on. I Would definitely come here again to try out some of the other items. 

Update: went there again and got chicken cordon bleu and special omlette with goat cheese and veggies. It was phenomenal! Very flavorful. My only downside is the waiter. The older woman is such a pleasure to talk to but the younger waiter is not very pleasant and we had to wait till our meal was over to get a refill on water. She never came by us once.

I love Wawa.  I got hooked on the one on New Jersey Ave in North Wildwood & it's been LOVE ever since.  

Wawas are clean, have great food & fast service.  They have ATMs, bathrooms & a lottery machine.  They all seem to do a lot of business and sometimes get a little crowded.  Since they are so busy, there are cars & people going in & out constantly. 

 Most of the smaller Wawas have small weird parking lots.  If I am going to one of these, I sometimes will park on the street further away, just to be free of the hassle.  

The larger Wawas that sell gas are also super busy.  One has to be extra careful and aware when moving about here.  I usually head to the back parking lot at this location if I am not buying gas.  It is a little less congested & more orderly back there.

After running into stumbling blocks with other lenders -- including a nationally-acclaimed lender marketed specifically toward veterans -- my most excellent real estate agent (see his review elsewhere) recommended Jason Griesser and his team at Prospect Mortgage. My situation was somewhat unique and more difficult than usual, but not only did they work with me to qualify for the mortgage I needed (where the other lenders fell short), they were also extremely helpful every step of the way through closing. They made the entire process seem nearly effortless, including all of the extra steps required of a VA loan. In addition, I ended up with a slightly lower interest rate than I was originally expecting, as well as some unexpected cash back at closing. They were supportive and helpful during every step of the process, always answering any questions I had, and were never condescending or obstructive in any way. Settlement was never in jeopardy of being pushed back because of mortgage delays, and I closed in far less time than I had expected at the outset. Based on this extremely positive experience, I would gladly recommend Jason and his team to anyone looking to purchase a home or refinance.

THE BEST TIME EVER!!!!! Me and about 20 of my closest friends went here on Friday night. Had a private room and TONS of bottles of wine. thank god for byob. i did not do the ordering, that was someone elses job. we had salads, and aps. lil tastings before the main event. then the HUGE boat came out. all good stuff. but sadly i cant remember a one. we are so loud. we cant help it. no matter where we are, best behavior is not our strong suit. i heard the guests in the other room, were less then pleased by our presence. but, i guess it sucks to be them. us? we had a blast. great food, great wines, great friends. who could ask for more? but heres where it gets amazing. after all the chowing down, the ruckus and laughs, it came to $30 bucks a person, including a 30% tip!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i thought there must be some mistake! i felt like i was taking advantage of them. how can i have this much fun, with a full belly of goodness for 30 bucks? sushi? on the cheap? crazy!!!!! i dont know if this is a good or bad thing for tako, but we'll be back. prob every friday until the weather gets warm again. maybe even when the weather gets warm. perfect place to pregame or have it be the main destination. yaaayyy,
I'm a real estate agent and work with Castle both personally and professionally. They are terrific!

Great Cuban food north of FL!

The camarones al ajillo (shrimp in garlic sauce) is wonderful - soak some of that delicious golden bread with the sauce and you'll be in heaven.

Fantastic ropa vieja, and the maduros are nice and sweet like they should be.

Friendly service, good beer list if a bit uninspired, but more than enough.

More than once I've found myself wanting to try a different place in New Hope but I pass by here and can't help myself.

Having stopped in for lunch, I want to update my previous review and offer the highest praise to their egg salad sandwich. With L/T on a rugged multigrain bread, it's hands down the best egg salad I've ever had. They have a nice style with every food item, nothing is taken for granted, just as they didn't do a routine egg salad. Yes, comes with the horse radishy potato salad, yum. Excellent coffee, semi-friendly baristas - what more could you want? As mentioned, I particularly like their potato salad, check it out, it comes with sandwiches but I believe you can also order it as a separate side order. Outdoor seating is a plus. Wifi and warm, quiet atmosphere (despite the many young kids that are brought in) make it not a bad place to get a little work done as well.

The WORST breakfast we've ever had, I don't know what all these Yelpers are talking about.  I get better pancakes from Aunt Jemima.  My partner ordered the Swedish pancakes which tasted like shoe leather, and don't even get me started on the flavorless undercooked hash brown potatoes.  We have always relied on Yelp for dining and they have never let us down..... until now.  Obviously we will not recommend the Pancake Pantry, way overpriced as well for tasteless food.
5 star based on the food solemnly . Otherwise the waiter sucked . The steak was amazing and juicy I didn't expect it to be so good . I couldn't have enough, everything was on point!

Artsy fartsy Elite Events are my fave, and Yelp Reno and Board & Brush certainly delivered! I am a performer, not really a visual artist, but I love coming in not sure about what I want to do and just figuring it out along the way, buffing and blending as I go...Working on wood is particularly therapeutic to me- I love distressing the wood and then lovingly sanding, staining, and dolling it up it afterwards.

After a friendly welcome from Reno's favorite Michael,
 we got to meet the lovely Ashly, owner of Board & Brush, and her charming team of helpers, all creative and fun-loving, who have a great time helping folks out with their projects. I'm fairly autonomous when working on creative projects, but Board & Brush really has a great balance of when to step in and help someone find their way, and when to just let folks get their art on. They're also full of helpful painting tips and techniques to help you create what you're going for.

What was also cool about this event was that I didn't even know anyone there, but we were all singing and jamming along together as we worked on our signs. All the finished signs I saw turned out really cute, and everyone seemed to be happy with their final product. Thank you Yelp Reno and Board & Brush for a fantabulous evening! Can't wait to come back for my birthday!
The space looks small but downstairs says otherwise! Got some crepes to start off my morning.
Never done this before. Great time! The raft trip was pretty amazing and would love to play again. Creed was a workout! Definitely worth the money and good time!

Service was excellent! The server answered all questions and was very polite. Never seemed frustrated or rushed. I ordered the pizza trying to be safe. She informed me about the spicy sausage that is also on the pizza. I was so glad she did because I cannot do spicy  she must have read my mind!   I loved the thin crust pizza. You could taste all the flavors plus the crust is delicious  

I was very very satisfied with my meal and will be back. Everyone in the group was happy!

FYI the individual pizza was enough for lunch and I was able to carry the rest home for dinner. 

The only downside was they don't have to go cups. I always take the rest of my soda to go.

Other than that it would be 5 stars!

Great find for BBQ!  
I had the ribs, potato salad and baked beans and was delighted!   I'll be back to try the other selections and of course, get more of those ribs. The gentleman in the kitchen was delightful and helpful as well.  It was well worth the find!

No issues so far. The machines are fine and I have no problem getting on the treadmills. The gym has always been clean when I go and people are polite. Staff has been helpful and friendly. I haven't taken a class yet but look forward to trying one out.
They were incredible about an exchange and very helpful with finding items. I'm going back. Very nice people.

Decided to stop here since we are visiting from Long Beach, CA. Service was amazing thanks to Ponce and our hostess Robriyion! We ordered the alligator and crawfish nachos and Rockefeller oysters ! We were told these were a must, but the whole menu is great! Would highly recommend, such a friendly atmosphere! Finishing up our visit with a Passion Punch!
They have such friendly staff and great products!! I can't wait to come back to visit even though it's over an hour from where I'm located.
The tour guide was very nice and informative. With the price that we paid, We had a good time.

Slightly better now with the new owners.  The lady at the register with the green/blue hair is the only polite one who works there. Everyone else needs to be trained/taught how to deal with the public. The health and beauty department is always about 90 degrees fahrenheit and I doubt that helps keep the products from spoiling/melting.

The last time I ate there, I was eating, when I suddenly heard the sound of nails being clipped. I looked over, and yep, the lady working at the cafe was standing right by the food trays, clipping her nails. When I told the owner bout it, he shrugged his shoulders and walked away to go back to stocking shelves. 

The cafe serves up flavorless slop and I cannot believe I gave it the benefit of the doubt on three occasions. I could not even eat most of it. (you are better off eating at Soy Cafe) The prepared food in the refrigerated section is okay, a hit or miss. I keep asking them where they moved their 'Awesome foods' brand items and they keep pointing at other foods that are clearly not the same brand. I tried the other brands and they are not as good as the Awesome Foods brand. I guess they no longer carry them. 

The juice bar attendants act as though I am torturing them when I place an order. No worries, there are LOTS of other juice bars in Philly, yes, even in my neighborhood (fish town)

Overall, their prices on most items are too high and I suspect that their employees are paid a low wage. I often see products on the shelves that are about to expire the next day and there is no discount on them. All of this is a recipe for going out of business.
I still go there to buy certain items, but do most of my shopping elsewhere.

Penn Herb Company is MUCH better, so is Whole Foods and several others.

yup! this place is legit. we ate here before a week long cruise. we ate here again about 9 days later. our server remembered us, asked about our cruise, and remembered how stressed we were the first time we ate there. food was amazing- everything is freshly prepared, service was perfect, and location was very convenient. love this place and highly recommend!

First time trying Burger Study while in town for a work trip. Casual setting to try some St Elmo's favorites. Service was great and quick for a large group during a busy lunch hour. Only downgrade was one order was messed up but, that wouldn't stop me from making another trip.

Waited in the drive thru line for 26 minutes and ended up having to drive off so I wouldn't be late for work. Awful. I was excited to live close to a Steak n Shake but after that experience, I am bummed that they would open up without having all their stuff figured out. I'd rather just drive to the one in Murfreesboro.

This is definitely one of the coolest, hippest places in Indy I've ever been. The outdoor seating was very beautiful and the overall ambiance of the place was hip and cool but also homey at the same time. The food was really really good. The bacon is more of a short rib and it was a highlight of my meal. Another thing that blew me out of the water was the biscuits. Wowza. Best biscuits ever. Period. 
The only reason I am not giving it a 5 was because of the unwillingness to take out a nonessential ingredient due to an allergy. The waffle is topped with pistachio butter, which I am allergic to, and when I asked for it on the side or not to be added they said they couldn't do it. I don't get why not. That was about the only disappointment.

Columbia needs a coffee house, but Mokka is NOT it.. The food is not good and expensive. I went a second time to get a coffee, now mind you it is maybe 4:30 on a Monday, I was told they were closed, period, no I'm sorry, nothing, some young girl that looked like she needed a shower was handling orders... Gross. I don't think I will be back, and it's walking distance from my house, very sad.

Wow!  The quality of food has gone down and the service has bottomed out! What's happened? I went in with two gentlemen with special needs.  I'd hate to think that this was the cause for the poor service..  The server dropped off the food and only came back if we flagged her down.  Miraculously once the forks hit the plates, to indicate we were done our meal, she ran up with the checks. We asked for boxes for the remaining food.. she ran off before we could ask for refills for our drinks.  Came back with ONE box and no bag.  We flag her down for the drinks. "Do you want those to go?"  First  time she actually asked us something since the food hit the table...  no,'how is your food?' No,"would you like anything else?' No, "Would you like a dessert?"  We ordered dessert....after we flagged her down again.  Same "Do you want the to go?"  My friend finally asked, "Do we have to leave?"  I mean damn!

Okay so then the server did not create a new check as we asked and just added it to one of the gentleman's checks.. we asked her to fix it.  She didn't. We go to pay and the gentleman was over charged.  The General Manger was called to try to fix the error and had a disgusted tone to his voice... and he turned out to not ask questions either... hmmm..  Crappy service and the quality of the food no longer supports the prices...  I'm truly disappointed since I used to enjoy this place.

This was a great fund in downtown Indy.  My wife started with a glass from the their ample wine list and I explored their really cool bourbon selections. Now onto the rib eyes that had plenty of flavor and nice color.  If dining together, I suggest each person getting a different side as they don't do family style.  I asked for a wine recommendation to pair with the rib eye, expecting it would be the most expensive selection.. haha, the server suggested the zin.  It was fabulous.  We are generally 50/50 on having desert but based on the recommendation of the bread pudding we indulged.  Well worth the extra calories! The service was excellent and friendly.

Will NEVER go back! Myself and 2 of my co workers went after work. We each got an appetizer and wanted to just talk and relax. After we finished eating in within about 10 minutes, the waiter asked us to leave!!!! Yes, asked us to leave. It was 3pm in the afternoon, there was no wait. He suggested we "finish our talks at the bar." I am 7 months pregnant. Wow, I was floored. Shared my expereince with management, they didn't care. Was quite insulting considering the group of ladies next to us were there much longer than we were. Very rude servers!

I'm literally going on every review page I can to ensure no one else goes through the awful headache I did with this bus service. I showed up to the bus station about 45 minutes early for my 3:30am bus so I wouldn't miss it if they tried to leave early. They show up 45 minutes late to the terminal. I tried asking around the terminal to see if anyone knew the status of this bus, but there was not one rep for megabus present at all. I tried giving customer service a call but nothing the entire 45 minutes until the bus came. Freaking out because I have a set engagement to get to, I tried buying a ticket with greyhound instead around 4:10, WHO IS MUCH MORE RELIABLE HERE BTW, but ended up getting a refund for that because that's when the megabus showed up 5 minutes later. Finally getting on the bus and the bus driver was just rude and very short on words when I was asking him questions about my baggage and boarding. Now getting into the bus, it smells like this thing hasn't been cleaned in the past year. Please save yourself the headache and just fly, drive, or take the Amtrak.
The food was amazing and let's not talk about the margaritas! The service was good and a nice little spot to hang out near the beach....

Very very meh. 
 The interior of the place is cool looking but the food really sucks, too bad. The pretzels were fried but you can tell that they were microwaved as well. I ordered the sliders which were...meh. The bread was too thick for sliders. My wife ordered the berries and Gorgonzola salad with shrimp. She said that was very average at best and the shrimp weren't grilled but rather boiled or steamed and no seasoning whatsoever. We will not give this place a second chance.

Went in today on the reccomendation of a fellow plantars faciatis patient. Walked in at 11:30 am. Asked for a 30 minute massage to see if it would work. Very nice young man took me back and got me situated. Nice music playing in the background , he got me very comfortable cleand my feet and legs with a nice warm towel and proceeded to massage my feet and legs. By the time I walked out my feet felt better than they have in months, even better than when I got a cortisone shot in my heel to help with the pain. By the time I had tipped the gentleman it cost me $37 for 30 minutes which is less than my copay. I intend to go back twice a week for about a month month-and-a-half and I will report back how it went. Overall I'm highly impressed with this facility do not understand some of the complaints here but I will let you know after I've gone a number of times.

Desperate for some coal fired pizza and was lucky to find Bricco! The two pizzas' crusts we ordered was just a tad bit over done for my liking (hence the 4stars) but tasted very good. Portions are great, the smaller size pizzas will be great for sharing and even the kids pizza is very generous. I loves the woodfired.wings and their ricotta fritters are worth coming back for really. The interious and service were great too! Definitely worth a visit this place.

Food is good. Or...was good. Tonight we went in for dinner. We've been to Eureka over 10 times, at least. The food is always good. Until tonight. My husband and I, taking advantage of their happy hour, ordered their nachos. We've had them before and they are yummy. But tonight, instead of cubed moist chicken they gave us soggy, shredded, crock-pot like chicken. Also, the nachos are supposed to come with beans. I counted the beans.......there were 7 total beans (I sent it back asking for more beans and my plate came back with MAYBE 12 beans). Flavor was lacking. My son ordered the corn dog pops. He loves their cheddar-IPA sauce. Our server did not tell us that the restaurant no longer made this sauce (despite us requesting two sides of it), and instead brought two sides of spicy mustard sauce (he's a little kid! What was the thinking there??). I have one other complaint that I have felt for awhile, that being that the service is T.E.R.R.I.B.L.E. Don't go in there expecting to get your drinks in a timely manner. You are lucky if you get them before your meal. And even more lucky if a server comes up to you to take your order at all.

In the 12th South area, The Filling Station is a must.  It is located right next to Edely's BBQ.  

They have a great selection of craft beers for sale in 6 packs and a small group of beers in tap that you can drink inside or take home a Growler.  

The decor is old wood and makes it very cozy and the staff member was attentive and really took the time to explain the history of this quaint building and if the beers we were trying. 

It is not an all night party place. If you want to stop in and try a new beer or two, this is a good place.  We will be stopping and getting some growlers for the road so we can have them back in Indiana.
New China is a great option for good Asian food.  Pho is available, as well as a large assortment of Chinese food.  Good service, and nice atmosphere. Quick, and delicious.

I've made two trips to Brothers.  My first trip was to get a Po Boy because i heard they had the Previous owner's recipe (Patrick) and were still getting the bread from Leidenheimer's in New Orleans.  It is indeed the same Po Boy(which is by far the best poboy in Nashville), but I have to admit was a little disappointed to get a half for what I'm used to paying for a whole.  At least offer a whole for $20, I'd pay that for it.  My second trip was for a Burger, because when I was there the first time, the burgers did look fantastic.  I ordered a Jumpback Jack and my wife got the Fun Guy.  Both were excellent.  The combination of flavors on the Jumpback are about the best I've had in a long while.  While I've had some burgers at other places that I thought the actual meat was better (dry aged or wagyu).  The actual combination of toppings and meat really made it special.

There's no better place to go to when it's cold outside and you and your friends are hungry.

 Definitely start with the pretzel and homemade mustards, yes, as in two of them. One is seedy, sweet ,and tangy while the other is like a more robust dijon. So goood. And the pretzel was a winner, easily one of the best I've ever had. It was fluffy and chewy and had just a little sour tang. 

I got the Hungarian beef stew with buttered spaetzle for my main. Mmmm...The paprika laced stew was hearty and flavorful without being heavy. It just warms you from the inside out. We split the sauerkraut (a must-order), the Brussels sprouts (another must-order), and the fried potatoes (I could do without these). I tried my friends' brats and thought they were yummy. I don't think I will be able to eat another J-ville brat again. 

The apple strudel was flaky and buttery, but I would love to have a scoop of homemade vanilla on there, even if that's not how the Germans do it.

The food was excellent, but the service left something to be desired. Our waitress was condescending when she talked about the beers with us, she was MIA for a while, and she spilled beer on my boyfriend while flirting with him. Those would all ordinarily result in a lost star or two or three, but hey, the food is awesome.

Great prices, food and service.  Been very satisfied every time I've gotten food there.  The boom boom sauce is good.  Same goes for the Mahi Mahi tacos, the zuzus pizza, the zuzus chicken cheese fries, the lamb burger, and I'm sure all the other things I havent tried yet.

Posto Sano was great. Found out about it going into Scordatos pizza which is another gem. But came to Posto Sano around 11AM and it was truly pleasant. Food came out on a timely manner and service was good. Food was tasteful and right amount of portions - would have given a 5 star but ordered dessert and they had ran out of cream for the fruit bowl and couldn't substitute it with anything else. Would recommend to anyone. Overall good place. Good job Danny Scordatos.

First off we were so happy to see them open closer to home. We were already impressed with their Mt Laurel location.

My wife and I went in for lunch and were amazed by the decor and spacious interiors. Mt Laurel is so tiny but always busy.

She got the red curry with tofu after getting Thai basil fried rice all the time and was impressed. I got the green curry with shrimp  and it was super delicious. We both got spice level 4 which gives a great kick to the sauce. Same flavors and taste as the sister restaurant. Large portions and decently priced.

People are still discovering this place since its just been a month since it opened but give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

Came down to New Orleans so had to do a swamp tour to clear my bucket list. 

This company is great they covered the bus to the swamp and the boat ride. It's a fair long boat ride so definitely prepare to leave at least a half a day for this.

You get to see alligators, raccoons, wild pigs, birds, and snakes on these tours and the captains know the animals and the routes really well.

Overall had. Great experience and would 10/10 recommend this company to tour the NOLA swamps with!
Long lines to check in and out. But overall, it is pretty good. Nice spa and pool.

POOR EXPERIENCE/NON-EXISTING SERVICE. We booked a reservation in advance on OpenTable and upon arriving was told my choice of seating was outside (64 degrees and windy) or at the sushi bar. There was an open table and I was told they were holding it for a reservation for 3 (which could have also been seated at the sushi bar.)   I was told a reservation only guarantees 'a seat' not a table and not even necessarily inside - crazy!

As a result, I do not anticipate returning or giving a favorable recommendation to try dining to this establishment.  With so many other great options in the Passyunk area there's no need to go here-- we dined at Noord close by which was our first choice anyway and it was fabulous!

Our first time headed to the livery! We had a reservation for 9pm and they sat us exactly at 9. The atmosphere was great, quiet enough to have a conversation at your table but still a great hip vibe. We ordered off the DevourIndy menu, getting a full 3 course meal for $20! For our first course we had chicken empanadas with guacamole, mushroom empanadas with jalapeo crema, and ceviche. We were very pleased to find the ceviche had shrimp in it, even though the menu did not state that. For our main course we ordered Paella. Our waitress did a great job of telling us that their Paella was a SPICY dish. And it was true to the warning, but amazing with all the different flavors and the fresh tastes. For dessert we had chocolate flan and churros, both great but it was a unanimous vote at our table for the churros in Carmel sauce. Overall it was an amazing experience with absolutely no complaints to be had!

My daughter made a reservation 3 weeks in advance and I clearly understand why, it's the best restaurant for service, wine selection, beer on tap, freshest ingredients and attention to detail detail and detail. 

Despite how busy they were we were never rushed and food suggestions were superb and the espresso service was the only problem, they didn't serve until I had my desserts and I wanted it with the desserts.

We chose the pre-fixe menu so it was so amazing to try 8 delicious appetizers. I really was full already but the main entrees were just as good. I've had better ribeye but I loved the Branzino with the red pepper paste. The olive oil garlic paste for the steak was amazing. 

The desserts are delicious and I can recall it was a melted cheese with rose water syrup but can't remember the name, it's intended for 2. Do order that. 

We had the top 5 mezzos but you must try the Fatteh, chickpeas in the brown butter with cashews  and almonds was my favorite. I also loved the other mezzas like samke nayyeh with raw yellow tail and fried kibbeh (because my husband wanted some meat)

I almost forgot to mention but I was impressed with the beer on tap called Kronenbourg Blanc (I can't drink wine) really nice fruity blend.

as an update we went to a couple of classes last week ... boxing, abs & booty bootcamp. So much fun! Yoga on Sunday...
 Love the large clean space as well as staff there to show you the latest equipment and how to use it. Tyler,  Chelsea, Cam, (Mgrs) super friendly, informed and nice upbeat environment!
We decided to try somewhere new, we stopped and were pleasantly surprised, Excellent service , no issues with food, will return

After seeing their 'breakfast in a cup' online I just had to stop in.  It's a charming caf/bar where locals and tourists converge for quick meals, a place to work on laptops, read or people watch.  The staff is very welcoming and easy to talk to.   
 
Breakfast in a cup is a disposable coffee cup with food layered inside grits, hash browns, sausage and gravy, eggs and bacon.  Since the grits are on the bottom it's very hot to hold, but it's really good.  After stopping there the first day of my trip I stopped here almost every day for coffee and/or breakfast in a cup.  The building was clean every day and the coffee station (utensils, sugar, milk, etc) was always stocked.  They have local artwork hanging on the wall above the coffee station.    The bathroom is in the back counter - the sign is slightly hidden.

This is an awesome way to team build or hang out with friends and family. The instructors make you look like a rock star even if you have zero talent. The paintings are simple and easily customizable. 

I love that you can bring snacks and drinks for your private classes. I will definitely do this again!

I was looking for a new shop in Jersey to service a new bike of mine. I split my time between Jersey and Philly. The service here is great and the prices are competitive. I've never experienced any issues and would recommend Freeride to anyone. It is about 2 blocks from the Patco station and as convenient as it gets.

"Jr" is always honest with what he can provide. I have been coming to this place for a long time. Customized tire and wheel packages and they always do a great job. I have had two previous cars customized and lowered suspension. Never a problem. People forget when you customize your car, problems will occur from elements other than the tire shop. I recommend this place always because of the honesty and convenient location. Parking is always hard and so is space but that's because they share a lot with another good car garage.
Pork gyro was good, not great. The wrap was a bit too bready and pork was dry. Liked the French fries and veggies, and tzaisiki sauce was good. Will try the chicken or lamb gyro next time.
Had a great meal there last night! Our server Patricia did a great job! Highly recommend this to anyone! Very good food and great service!

Food was so so nothing great for the price. I would recommend not eating here unless your stuck at the hotel. Paid about 20 bucks for a burger that was nothing special and left me running for the bathroom

My bf has been raving about Al-Sham so I had to try it with him! It was ~amazing~ to say the least. We ordered takeout as we were crunched for time.

The food:
Two delicious chicken pita sandwiches filled to the brim with very flavorful chicken and salad with large tomatoes, pickles, and delicious sauce.
It was truly mouthwatering and the sandwiches are huge, we split one and were so full. Seriously do yourself a favor and order this. So so good even the pita tasted amazing.

In addition we ordered 2 orders of falafel- each order comes with 2 large falafel- so much flavor and I could not stopped dipping them in the homemade yogurt sauce.

This place is the real deal and the prices are extremely reasonable for how much food you receive.
In addition, the employees are very professional and friendly. I cannot wait to try other options on their menu :)
With 3 tables full on a Thursday evening it took over an hour to get pancakes and eggs. I've never been to a worse IHOP

Exceeded my expectations! Beautiful hotel..upscale..better than the other Marriott's on Canal. Exceptional service from Brian at the concierge and Aaron at the door. My room was clean. Excellent decor they really thought of everything. Even the shampoo and conditioner and lotion were superb. I have natural hair and whatever's in that shampoo and conditioner just glided through my hair...but that shower though!!! Perfect water temp and design with a waterfall shower! Heaven! The bed...I was asleep in less than 5 mins every night..woke up refreshed due to the light blocking curtains. Can we talk about breakfast. I am chef... I was throughly impressed! Fresh everything and fresh shaved prosciutto! Beautiful outdoor patio.. Close to bourbon street...etc etc...I will DEFINITELY be back!!

Loved my chicken quesadilla. Super filling and tasty, couldn't finish it all. I think this place is a pretty affordable, convenient, and great lunch stop. It's not much to look at on the inside but their menu is stock full of possibilities and I need to get back to try some other items they have on the menu!

What a cute salon! Such a great environment and the staff is all super friendly! My stylist Lexi was super sweet and did such an amazing job on my hair! Love the experience here and highly recommend!!
Love the food and the presentation. A little on the pricey side. Our waitress was excellent. Can't wait to go back!

This place is the best for delivery in this area.  The below reviewer may have had a bad experience with them, but we've been getting them for years and never had anything but great service. Their food is not fancy - it's basic Chinese delivery food - but it is full of flavor and very well cooked.  When I go elsewhere now I always think the food is bland in comparison.

Just a heads up guys, a few friends and I stopped in there today (4-23-15) for the happy hour special of $3 craft bottles and paid with my debit card. That was the good part, the bad part is if you use a debit card for your purchase they will put at $100 hold on your account. Yes, you read that right folks they will hold $100 of your money if you choose to pay by debit/credit and they do not notify you of this. So beware, and pay with cash if you plan on going. Oh, and the flat breads are slightly better then ellios pizza.

Finally as of July 2017 The Attorney General of Pa is actively investigating GEORGE NICK CIRCIU of Feasterville Pa 19053, George Circiu and his Scam companies, have 11 open cases filed against him so far, I hope justice will be served and he goes to PRISON where he belongs,

GEORGE CIRCIU has fooled me again and blocked all his phones from me, he has no intention of honoring the contracts we signed and he planned to steal my money the whole time, I feel very defeated and humiliated, But I want to thank everyones for your concern and prayers, I did appreciate the support but I guess its just my fate in this life and I know they are worse things in this world, Thanks Jim

It is now June 2nd 2017, I have been patiently waiting since Feb 13th 2017 for George Circiu to finish and fix my house but he just treats me like a fool and laughs at me, but took my 54 thousand dollars , BEWARE He and his father John Circiu are still in business with his other company Penn Home Remodeling LLC out of Feasterville Pa.

 Is there no justice for people who are scammed by dishonest contractors


I can not believe how this company has ripped me off, they stole over 54k dollars from me
 The work they did do on my house is so bad I think I have to have it completely redone.
I have been living in one small bedroom with my two dogs since Jan 2nd 2017, 4 months as of May 2nd 2017, They only did work up to Feb 13th after they received my last payment of 18k dollars cash, they demanded this payment be in all cash. So no workers for over 6 weeks now, no one answers the phones anymore. I should have known better The Owner was so aggressive and threaten not to finish the work unless I paid, so I gave in, still never thinking he would just leave with my money & never come back. Besides being angry I am so humiliated and depressed over this.

I do not even have a railing to hold on to going up the stairs, Water is now coming in where they built in my Air Conditioner, My wood floors are saturated and starting to warp 


Please DO NOT USE Father and Sons.or Penn Home Remodeling LLC

Love this place! The ladies who work there are friendly and know what they are doing! My dog always come out looking amazing and the price is right! I've been coming here regularly for a year and a half and I'm never disappointed.

I've been here for a few times, and I'm in love with this place. The menu is quite impressive, and it will seriously take more than a few minutes to read through the choices.  (The huge star in the middle of the menu can be quite distracting!). If you need a good sushi lunch place, then get the lunch special. They have an awesome deal at 3 rolls for $12, which includes either soup or salad. Guess how many choices of rolls you get to choose from? 43!!! Lots of choices to choose from, and I really digged the Pepper Tuna roll and the Alaskan roll. I had the crabmeat apple roll, but didn't care much for it.

More reasons to love this place: Service is fast and friendly, and they have LOW-sodium soy sauce. 

My challenge is to try different rolls/dishes each time I go there, except the California roll. :)

Wow! I am updating my previous negative review. 

We went to the Peppermill Reno Casino last night and it was great! Both my husband and I were having fun gambling and instead of losing and losing we were both winning. 

And... I am pleased to announce I won $1,000 on a nickel video poker machine. I haven't had a large single win like that in quite some time.

Thank you Peppermill for listening to your loyal customers. We are definitely returning to our favorite casino again and again.

This food is awesome and both herbivores and carnivores will LOVE this place I guarantee it!  Make sure to try the sweet potato fries - they are so delicious!   Also, the banana whip makes an awesome, delicious and guilt free dessert!
I had never had Cajun food, until I went to Yats. I was surprised by how delicious it was. It was also very affordable.

I had one of the best chicken sandwiches I had ever   The pickles were so crunchy, the spicy chicken was just the perfect spice that you could finish the Sandwich without your mouth on fire and also the blu cheese was extremely creamy and delicious fine to dip fries in and put on the sandwich! Also has a beautiful view of broadway on the rooftop.

Can I give them 10 stars please? They exceeded expectations in the two main points that count, price and customer service. We bought a GE stove there. Price: they matched the sale price of a big box store nearby, even though the big box store didn't even have that model in stock. Both big box stores couldn't even get one for weeks; Mark's got theirs in within 2 days. In terms of customer service -- all I can say is wow and I'll never go anywhere else for an appliance. First, our stove died just before a houseful of people showed up for the holidays. Big store: "sucks to be you." Mark's: "We will move heaven and earth, reschedule some deliveries that aren't time critical, and make sure we get it to you." THEN...the original one I ordered didn't fit the space. Seriously? With a big box store I would be SOL; Mark's ordered another that, on paper, was the same size, but the cooktop was configured a little differently, and voila, it fit. They didn't charge for ordering, trying to fit one, taking it back, then redelivering another one. Can you imagine the nightmare that would have been with the big box store? I offered to pay for the extra delivery and they said, naw... Last: it's now 9 months later. Fan sounds a little loud to me, not sure it's an issue, but could they check it out? Sure.... no problem... they'll come by to assess. There is no way on earth someone from the big box would just "run by" when they can, and even if they did I'd wonder if they were sending someone knowledgeable. I'm just floored by their great customer service and product knowledge, and would highly encourage anyone in the area to try them before ordering elsewhere. Just completely superior.

The Carmel Eyecare (formerly Wittman 20/20) maintains the family feel of Wittman and brings with it renewed feeling of modernity and expertise. Matt Clark is a young, competent, and enthusiastic doctor who is happy to explain anything to you regardless of how technical of an explanation you want. I look forward to continuing with Dr. Clark and recommend his practice to anyone looking for a new eye doctor.

As an aside, the office seems to be embracing new technologies including new imaging techniques, payment methods, and social media. I was happy to see a check-in discount available for yelp, which helped me defray the cost of the fancy new imaging/diagnostic techniques. Yay for non-restaurants using Yelp!

If you want to get a blended drink that's just full of sugar and no taste go to Starbucks but if you want to enjoy some tasteful coffee that doesn't need sugar or milk then their Cold Brew is the best! Don't even get me started on their service I just walked in and the 2 girls behind the counter were helping decided what I wanted. I went in for some drip coffee and left with a yummy honey lavender latte with a pretty design on it. If you think about the location price is understandable. I would definitely come back and the ambience is cozy

I really enjoy this awesome donut place on magazine street, mostly because of their selections that have NOTHING to do with donuts! The sliders are delicious yet expensive. My favorite is fried chicken with pickled sweet jalepeo, sweet spicy slaw, and a fried piece of chicken skin to top it off! They also serve some fantastic coffee. They run different specials on sliders and donuts that change daily, so you never know what you are going to find when you walk in. They do have certain staple dishes (like the chicken and the burger sliders)

Eaters beware: the line on weekend mornings is about 30 people long, so make sure to call ahead so you can cut the entire line and get your stuff right away! 

This spot is cool, hip, progressive, and laid back. Make sure to head in if you're in the neighborhood.

Friendly staff, and actually quite knowledgeable about French pastries. Pastries have all been awesome and it smells great. My only nag is the coffee mugs are square shape with a big lip on them and it makes it hard to not drip when you have a sip. Looks cool it's just not that functional

I eat here roughly once a month. Absolutely the BEST Cuban food in town. As the owner says "the ONLY Cuban food."  I would recommend this to ANY who enjoy eating, let alone Cuban. Inexpensive, amazingly delicious, wonderful people and atmosphere. Come one and all!

Received a gift card awhile back and have been meaning to write a rave review about Alexander Customs! Took my 2010 Camaro and Mike had it looking like I just drove it off the showroom floor! Amazing! You definitely get what you pay for! Would recommend to my friends and family.

Wow I am extremely impressed by this salon. Taking that I'm not from here I was on Yelp looking for nail spots around the Brandon area and sis - this is it!! Seriously I can't imagine going to other places that I had found rather than this. It's only a couple minutes away from Westfield mall while I was there anyways. First off, my technician is a perfectionist. Didn't get her name because I forgot but I def won't forget her face and talent. I got a fill and repair and I feel like I got a whole new set (but not for the price of one ) my coffin shape is beautiful, absolutely structured perfectly and man are they built nicely. Not too much acrylic nor gel polish on top. She even used a nail form to fix one of my nails because it was curving so bad, like I said she's a perfectionist. She didn't have to do that but she went ahead and made them even more outstanding. Secondly, as soon as you walk in your greeted promptly. They sat me down within 5 mins and I had a 3pm appt and walked in at about 3pm lol. Their selection of gel colors and dipping powders was overwhelming - but in a good way!! They just had so many colors, glitters and everything. You walk in with one idea but end up seeing all the things they have and end up wanting something else!!! Overall such a good experience, prime technician and beyond excellent work and talent. Like my tech said "there's no limit" because literally, they have it all!
