If I could give it more than 5 stars I really wish I could!! 10/10 highly recommend. Pricing wise, it's up there but it's affordable. For the work, quality and dedication you're receiving it's worth all the coins!! I so wished I lived closer and near because this would no doubt be my new go to spot. 
Lol and yes I used my pup as a background and prop
Really good food and sweet treats.  Coffee was great.  Just be prepared to wait in line, a very long line.

I first found this spot by searching yelp for good places to study when I first moved to Philly. I cannot believe I have yet to write a review for it.

They have PLENTY of big tables (and lots of little ones) in the big main room and also some additional seating in a smaller adjoining room. The back patio is a nice place to hang if you don't need an outlet. The staff is super friendly and do a great job with any order!

The drinks are pretty good - my favorite being a vanilla dirty chai with almond milk. They also have a bottomless cup of coffee deal for $3 - perfect for an all hours study binge! The food is decent - nothing fancy, but it's fresh and they have gluten-free bread that they'll substitute for any bagel. I like the Rox out with your Lox Out (open face) sandwich and the Garden Griller, but I mostly just eat here when I'm pulling a long study session and don't want to go home in the middle. 

The music they play is pretty chill and usually my style, but you can easily put on headphones if you're feeling something else. 

It can get crowded sometimes and harder to find a big table, but something usually frees up eventually!

I would recommend it for studying, grabbing a coffee with a friend, or even a first date (I've eavesdropped on a some hilarious blind dates here).

We had a 30th birthday celebration at Luke's and they devinatley delivered! The food was great, the atmospher was great, and the waitress we had (Christin) was amazing!! Next time I'm in NOLA, I will make sure to go back! 
If you're looking for a nice place to eat, but also have fun - PLEASE go to Luke and ask for Christin to be your waitress!

I can't give this place a one star since it's still my kids' fav place. It's just the service... The past 3 times we have gone to this place the waiter/waitress skip us. They take orders and bring drinks to the tables that come after us. It seems like they have no sense of organization. Tonight I decided to talk to the manager and all she did was give me the excuse of them being too busy and having poor quality of workers.. Well, how about management, how about leaving poor excuses on the side and take care of the situation... If it happens once it's fine, but all the time with different employees... I don't know.. something isn't right.

Walking down 104 is always makes me feel good. I see a bunch of new places to check out and I'm just so excited to try them.

I finally took the plunge one lunch to try their lunch menu.

The interior is super swanky, super chic vibe but with the sun out, my friend and I couldn't resist sitting on the patio to take in the nice weather. I was a little disappointed to discover that a lot trucks like to rip down this road which kind of took away the experience but I always enjoy patios nonetheless.

Although I didn't try any of their wines, I still enjoyed the always default water. Their water had lemons in it which was a nice change.

I decided to try their sandwich: panino italiano. I don't have a palette for Italian food but I'm working on it. I think this was my first experience eating authentic Italian meats so the taste was a little overwhelming. I came away feeling "this meat tastes game-y".
To be honest, it was a struggle to get through the sandwich. Only until I got to the middle I tried to focus on mixing the flavors of the tomato-y spread with the meat and cheese and the flavors mixed better.

Waitress was friendly and came by to check on us frequently.
My sandwich came with a very small salad with oil and balsalmic vinegar.

Sandwich came out to about $12. 

I'd really love to come back and try their pasta but until I can figure out what I'm supposed to expect for Italian meats, I probably won't order the sandwich again.

I have worked with Cliff Stoufer, my service advisor,  for the past 10 years and two Hyundai's.  Cliff works hard to make sure the repairs are done correctly and immediately addresses any issues that arise.  If I want to make sure that my car's service needs are properly diagnosed and fixed, I go to Cliff.  Crown's prices tend to run a little higher than independent garages or repair chain shops, but I know that I do not have to wonder if I'm getting unnecessary repairs performed. Also, I never hear anybody grumbling and grousing about ripoffs while waiting in the customer lounge, which, by the way, is very comfortable and stocked with coffee and snacks. Simply put, I trust my cars to Cliff Stoufer and Crown Service.

This restaurant used to be good, but it has gone really really far downhill. The food tasted like they are serving semi-spoiled food that may have been cooked hours or days before. I actually feel physically ill and I think the health department should check this place out. My brothers food was dripping with orange grease, it was an omelet. I ordered the Toad in the Hole sandwich, which I used to love, and I had to take off the tomatoes and avocado. The tomatoes had white spots all over them and were yellow in the middle; they looked like they were maybe a day from being rotten, if not already. The avocado was covered in brown- grey spots. I honestly wanted to throw up after eating it. All in all, I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. I don't know how it has managed to stay in business this long, and it does not deserve to stay in business. Next time you want to eat out, go somewhere else instead.
The food was pretty bad.  Black bean taco salad was just that.  Canned black beans with almost nothing else.  Chili was made with really fatty beef.  Disappointing.
There were two of us. Ordered Chicken Makhani and Palak Paneer. Both dishes were excellent and reasonably priced. The service was also good. Nothing not to like. Will definitely be going back.

Not only delicious steaks, but excellent customer service. My wife had ordered Aussie fries and thought she was getting some doctored up fries with cheese. When regular plain fries were delivered, she mentioned it, but did not demand a replacement. After the more than courteous server Jordan inquired several times, my wife said it was her mistake and no problem. Minutes later, the manager Jessica arrived with an order of cheese fries. How unexpected and customer service oriented. Great gesture Jessica. You just earned a customer that usually goes to the Fishhawk location which is about the same distance. I had the Mouth watering Victoria filet and broiled lobster tail with a side baked potato and Caesar salad. All were cooked to perfection and would highly recommend. Happy hour till 7pm  is nice and the IPA on tap was earthy without a bitter after taste. The strawberry shortcake was scrumptious. Jordan was very upbeat and arrived at the table during the right times.

My go to restaurant for Indian food in the northeast. Sometimes it's a littler bit of a wait for the food but today It came out quick. I tried something new. The chicken karahi with mild spiciness. It was good but i missed the variety of other vegetables and the sauciness of other dishes. Next time I will order something with potatoes and other vegetables. Bell peppers and onions is too basic for me.

I was fairly disappointed with Gooey Louies. I biked down on a hot summer day with a friend, who had been there many times. The location is very odd (it's within some sort of business/outdoor mall kind of thing). The inside of a place is a deli/convenience store setting with not much room.

You head to the back to order your sandwich and the staff isn't particularly friendly nor are they rude. I ordered the cheesesteak, which seemed only appropriate. We sat outside to eat our meals and as I took a bite, i was fairly disappointed.

The meat was kind of sad looking and the sandwich overall didn't have a lot of flavor. I ended up throwing the other half out. I hope that I'm wrong, and that maybe it wasn't the right day so I will try GL's once more int he future.

Rich City is the best Chinese food I've had in the area here!  Yes, being it's so good they do get very busy and I've learned over the years to figure in 45 minutes to an hour for them to deliver especially on rainy or inclement weather nights.  If other people love their food just like I do then yes, of course Rich City would get busy and that's a good thing if you ask me.  The food is always great and I love the steamed chicken with mixed vegetable and the sweet and sour chicken is amazing too!  Oh, and the pizza rolls are the best... It's worth the wait!
a gem! loved the caf con chocolate as well as the chilaquiles when i went there for a sunday brunch. mad friendly staff and comfortable vibes

Great place to bring your friends from out of town. 

Super positive vibes. Great food. A little pricey, but the over all experience was quite nice. 

One of the best parts, especially considering it's winter, was that we had the ability to check our coats from our table. 

I would suggest sharing, mixing, and matching smaller dishes; you get to taste all the flavors while still filling that belly that so desperately growls.
Love this place for hatha yoga. New juice bar is great, too. Try the Prana Chill juice.

Greek restaurant on the south side of Edmonton.  Nice decore feels like one of the restaurants we went to in Santorini. Low ceilings with Vines across the ceiling.  Food is expensive.  No bread or anything to munch on while waiting for your food unfortunately.  Drinks pricy. Individual lamb skewers were bland at $12 each!  Large portions for pistacho but not up to fine dining standards for $25. Many entrees were $35.   I found the wood chairs very uncomfortable with little padding.  I am slim but they didn't fit my derrire.  Nice outdoor patio.  Staff were very attentive and very polite.
I'm here all the time, love it, great staff. But super unhappy you discontinued the coffee cream for the French toast... that was pretty lame

I actually had to come here twice in order to their delicious shrimp poboys. The first time was around 11:30pm on a Saturday night, but they had ran out of bread for the night. We decided to try again the next day for lunch and was able to order a shrimp poboy.

It took them about 20-30 minutes to make 10 orders of shrimp poboys, but that meant it was a perfect time to grab a frozen irish coffee from the bar. 

The shrimp poboys reminded me of vietnamese sandwiches. Same type of bread with lots of veggies, but the key ingredient is the fresh shrimp. Every time I've had shrimp poboys, the shrimp has always been fried, but this time I was pleasantly surprised to see the shrimp without batter. 

The sandwich was quite delicious although quite expensive at $14.
I'm from NY and this is the best pizza I've ever had. Crust is great. Old school fresh ingredients. The way pizza should be. Fantastic!

Dadz is a sports bar and a restaurant.  There are a good number of tvs, so you'll always be sure to see whatever sport it is you're looking for (including golf, tennis, and auto-racing.)  During the NFL season, they carry all the games.  The bar itself is dark, and the walls and ceiling are covered with trophies and other memorabilia.  Recently, Dadz grealy expanded the number of beers they carry on tap (close to 20.)  Dadz is also well known in the area for BBQ ribs and buffalo wings.  It was voted best in those categories in Burlington County for 2008.

Recently Dadz remodeled and added an outdoor deck where smoking is permitted.   They also run regular poker leagues and feature live music weekly.

Check out the webpage at: http://www.dadzbarandgrill.com

The food and BOGO drinks are an AMAZING way to kick off your day! We stayed in NOLA for five days and ended up visiting Daisy Mae's twice for breakfast. Hearty comfort food and strong drinks - a perfect combo!

So much YUM. I absolutely love to dine at Convivio (both locations, but the Carmel location is so close to my home, it's my favorite!). The pasta is homemade and so delicious. I tend not to eat a lot of pasta, but it is so darn good here, it isn't too be missed. Yet, I would say the same for the pizza.  It's so good.
My favorite dish is the Pasta Putenesca.  Highly recommend and not to be missed. Atmosphere is good. I wish the bar area was bigger.  It's always busy.

Captain Gary is the best!! He was knowledgeable, entertaining, and a great boater. He also really knew how to handle and entice the animals, while still respecting them. 
This place DOESN'T use marshmallows as bait! They use actual exotic animal food for the sake of the gators' health and I am HERE FOR THAT.
Things to know:
If you are getting picked up from the Decatur location, there is no office you'll be waiting on the street. The cafe on the corner there has a bar. 
The buses are big and can fill up, but are comfortable. 
Remember your bus number. 
There is a place to wait for your boat after going through the gift shop / check in that is covered with games. 
Don't panic if they don't call your group color and all the benched fill up, there are lots of boats. 
We were on a covered boat that fit about 22.

The worst haircut EVER.  Go elsewhere.  Save your money and go to a real stylist.  When was the last time a hair hacker 'feathered' your bangs?  When Farrah Fawcett was a Charlie's Angels.  Incompetent hackers

Stopped for lunch around 1pm. Most tables were occupied but there were a few open. Waitress said take our pick so we sat at a table at one of the openings to Jackson Square. Hubs had the jambalaya, gumbo and crawfish . . . all excellent. I had the crawfish etouffee which was delicious as well. Service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely return next trip and will recommend to friends.

The wine tasted like it was poured from a urine filled shoe. One gal that worked there "Shasta"(?) was so blue lipped I almost called 911.  The wine glasses looked as though they had been "cleaned" with dirty bar rags. The space was filled with methane gas from either an overflowing toilet or a broken sewer pipe. Go there at your own risk and only if all your vaccinations are current.

K-Mart...K-Mart...K-Mart...sigh...

I agree with Paul, I think the reason other chains are so successful because they upgrade there store and there store policies. I rarely shop here because the store is gross, old and there is NEVER anyone to help you if you have a question. They need a facelift and new employees and lower prices and I think they will succeed. My wife and I went in to get some drapes for the new house. (I know, why K-mart) eel they do sell Martha Stuart Home items and she thought that they would have a better selection that the other store (Which they did). 

However the prices were out of this world! I mean for a store that is near death, for them to ask that much on a non designer item is terrible. We didn't get anything there, and unless I am needing something that I can not find at the other chains or they are having a huge sale, I don't think I'll be back. I hate to give a place 1 star unless someone was rude or I have have a bad experience more than once, so I will give them 2. (For Now??)

I had a great experience with Dean's Service. My 18 year old AC broke down and Daniel from Dean's sent a couple of technicians out to look at it right away. They diagnosed the issue quickly and by the next day Daniel provided me with quotes for several options including repair, replacement, and replacement of our other aging unit. He worked with me while my family weighed our options, and was always quick to answer our many questions.

We decided on replacement, and they had the installers out within 48 hours. Angelo and Andy were fantastic, and did a very thorough job. They stayed late to make sure everything was perfect. 

I really couldn't be happier with the customer service, skill, and professionalism of everyone I interacted with from Dean's. I wholeheartedly recommend them for your HVAC needs.

This was one of the first resturants ive tried in philadelphia.  One b/c i am asian and two b/c im a great fan of malaysian food.  I loved their food and i would consider it one of the most authentic asian place in philadelphia ( or at least to my taste and understanding).  I loved their roti canai, asam laksa, chicken and rice and prawn mee. I havent tired everything on the menu but im sure i would love everything.  =) great place to go to and not tooo expensive. true gem in philadelphia.

Signature Parking is truly the BEST valet in Santa Barbara!!!  Micheal really cares about his clients and gives you the best  customer service. His guys are friendly and professional and get the job done. We hire Signature for all of our charity events. His staff always remembers our family when we check into the El Encanto and gives everyone a hand. They go above and beyond!!!

Hilton advertises trail rides at this resort. The trail rides were run by Pot a Gold adventures. More like Pot o Crap. 
We were charged $80 per person for a sunset trail ride. When we arrived as instructed at 4pm there  was only one woman there , she had her retainer out on the table, was eating pizza, and had a pack of cigarettes next to her food, and the staff for the ride wasn't even there yet. We waited almost 20 minutes.
The smell was overwhelming. The horses were filthy, to be honest. They were caked with dirt and feces and their manes were matted. 
Our ride started at 4:40 and ended at 5:15. The sun was directly overhead and it was no where close to sunset. So, basically were charged for an hour sunset ride that was about 35 minutes and not at sunset.the "sunset" ride was $20 more PER PERSON than the one hour trail ride. The manager I emailed said they can't have the horses out at sunset because they get spooked and also because they need to eat. Ummmm, fine, but then don't call it a sunset ride and charge more for it. They refused to refund the extra money they charged for the "sunset" ride, and were very rude about it. 
The horses were not well behaved and my husbands horse just walked off the trail to go back to the stable , the guide said he wanted to eat. The "trail", by the way, is a patch of grass and cacti next to the highway. It was awful. Not at all what was advertised. Will be reporting to BBB for false advertising by Hilton and Pot a Gold adventures.
Beautiful view from the balcony, attentive wait staff, and excellent food.  I had the cucumber salad and ricotta gnocchi with mushrooms.  Absolutely perfect.
The hoagies are delicious and the prices are even better. I will definitely be coming here for sandwiches on the regular

I ordered the salad with the homemade spegetti with the fried poached egg on top & my fiance ordered the duck confit & both were remarkable!  I usually order the homemade spegetti with the fried poached egg, but I will now make the duck confit my #1 choice!

Just left my first appointment where I saw Elizabeth Bleeker. She is awesome, attentive and gentle. I would highly recommend asking for her. She's new to the practice (went to school at Vandy then moved for work and is back in Nashville) so she had good availability. I called Friday for an appt and got in Wednesday. 

The reason for not giving 5 stars is 2 fold. The front office staff is not professional, welcoming or informative. Didn't even stop their conversation to greet me when I checked in. I used to do their job for a living so was disappointed to find yet another medical office with cold, uncaring staff. The other reason was the wait time. No one came to say "Sorry for the wait, she'll be with you soon." Not a word and I didn't see the dr until an hr after my appt time. That's one of my pet peeves. Everyone knows Drs run late, but what happened to decency. If you're running more than 15-30min late have the courtesy and let you patients know. Thankfully I wasn't on a babysitter time limit today like I was going to be. I would still recommend the office because the Dr makes up for the rest. She's awesome!

The first time I went here to Katie I had one of the best haircuts of my life. The second time Katie only did my color and it was fantastic. The third time I left with crooked ends and green tinted highlights and lots of breakage. When I called to have it fixed, Grace, who by the way is really nice, said Katie wouldn't get on the phone with me but it was beigey blond when I left so I must have done something to it.  Yeah, because I want my hair to look like green hay so I messed with it.  And Guess what?  Helen Keller and Stevie wonder both stopped me when I left  the salon and asked me why my hair was green. Anyway, she said I can come in for a clarifying shampoo and conditioner.  Yeah, I can go to CVS and do that myself.  I informed the very pleasant Grace to tell Katie not only did she lose me as a client but my friend who was horrified for me as well. I just went somewhere else at my expense to repair the damage as best I could. I did receive a call from the owner, who also was extremely nice, but by that point I didn't feel comfortable going back, which is a shame because all the other stylists' customers left that day with gorgeous locks. So one star for each good experience. The quest continues!!
Your best bet for "no frill" tacos at any time of day or night. Got a 3am craving? They are open! And don't forget to order with an Agua Fresca.

Very nice library and the best parking spot in town, by far.

If you decide to visit Nashville but don't want to pay for expensive downtown hotels, this library will be your best friend. Cheap parking here and walk a few blocks right to the heart of downtown.

Good burger. Expensive but you have lots of variety when you get the build your own burger. Parking is a little tight as you have to look around. There are extra dedicated parking spots across street parking lot next to that donut place.

New ownership is a sinking ship. Ordered two hotdogs and a drink (used to be big hotdogs which is why i went here over five guys). The cashier who took my order bummed a cigarette from a homeless man while waiting and proceeded to smoke it right where the cashier window is outside. Got the two hotdogs which looked like luncheable hotdogs and they didn't remember the drink. I didn't remind them, but left ASAP. Wont be returning.

Having moved here from Buffalo, NY my expectations of quality and familiarity were high. This place did not disappoint me at all. The hot wings recipe may have been a little off the mark, but this place undoubtedly understands the importance of CRISPINESS! That's right... The easiest way to ruin a chicken wing is to take it out of the fryer too soon. Wings over Broadway knows exactly how hot to cook 'em and for how long. A wide variety of flavors are available for the curious eaters, but I'll always stick to the Buffalo standard - Hot with bleu cheese!

Matt & Kristy, managers of the service department are top notch! I had my 60k mile service done here & my experience initially was less then optimal. I went back several months later to address some lingering issues & they stood behind their work & even helped me even correct problems that were not their fault but that of a mischievous toddler who likes to put things where they don't belong. Juan of the service department was a smart & friendly guy who was very helpful as well. 

Yes it is expensive, but I trust their work & its not some iffy jiffy lube. I feel like they could benefit from some better organization because it is a rather large service department. Matt & Kristy earned this 4 star review & perhaps more importantly a future customer. They will have a chance to further impress me next time!

It was fine. The honeycomb flavor is amazing and my husband loved the strawberry cheesecake but nothing else was a standout. The butter cake was too hard and too dense to be enjoyable and we did not enjoy the cookie but the brownie was okay according to my son.

What are some other reviewers talking about when suggesting that...  The portions are too small?  Truly insane.  We ordered the rabbit ragout and were shocked at how large the portion was for a "small plate".  The same goes for all the plates we ordered.  The cocktails were inventive...loved the seelbach and the dark and stormy although the amexica had a few too many bold flavors to work for me (drank it though didn't I?).   The chicken liver pt was phenomenal!  Duck breast was cooked very well!  The mussels were quite tasty but a little lacking in salt for my taste.  Four solid stars. Looking forward to my next visit.
love this place, jess is fantastic. i've been to places over the years where the water can be awkward, but she's great. the place is also super clean, i won't ever go anywhere else again.

Their breakfast foods are really good! I ordered myself the breakfast bomb which came with egg stuffed pancakes, potato, and choice of meat. You get a lot of food here for one dish, although it is moderately pricy at around $10-12 per person. 

The establishment itself is really clean, has great lighting, and plenty of seating for big groups. That being said you might want to call in advance just in case because a couple times I've been here it was really crowded. Unfortunately they only take cash here which is a bit of a bummer and they don't have any wifi to use either. 

Everything else about this place is awesome, I'd recommend giving it a try.

Amazing!!

The ambience and decoration are truly well done. The food from the bread to desert was amazing. We also had drinks which were amazing too. Would recommend the hamachi, beef duo and beet salad. The coconut tres leche desert was amazing! Great service too, our server took such good care of us!

I love my nachos loaded and messy! I got the pork nachos for the second time and topped with my favorite toppings and sauces. The pork was juicy and flavorful. If you're looking for some heavily piled nachos and Izzo's is near, go get some!
I am very glad I found this local barbershop for my 9 year old son. As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted. And all of the barbers are very, very friendly. They made us feel right at home!

The breakfast here was not anything too brag about, BUT I loved the atmosphere! I always come here to study and I would consider it to be better than B&N because it's so quiet there. I love the triple berry cake that they have. It is beyond words. The fruits on top tastes fresh and the cake itself is so moist. the only thing about Parrot Pete that I don't really like is the high prices. They a trip with those pricing!!

One of the best meals we've had in a while. This is a high end establishment with $$$$ food. Our appetizers, main dishes and deserts were excellent. By far the ambience, service and experience were at least 5 stars. Great place for a special occasion.

Just finished my pizza. I used the online order form to request two medium pizzas (coupon!) for delivery. I followed the online tracker as Pete (I think) put my pizza in the oven, quality checked and then put the food out for delivery. 
My food was here in 20 minutes and so hot you almost couldn't hold the box. Plenty of toppings, delicious!
Last time I ordered from Reginelli's it cost me 30.00. This was 19.09...and delish!
I will be calling them again.

I went there with my family on a Groupon... if I hadn't had the discount, I would've been fuming.  Even with that, I would never go here again.  Similar to many other on here, we sat down to a partially-set table and waited 40+ minutes for mediocre to completely sub-par food.   They do not have chai (my favorite part of any Indian restaurant) and they waited until AFTER two of us had ordered lamb dishes to tell us that they did not have any lamb in the restaurant.  That sucks, but tell us that when we sit down so we don't waste time deciding which lamb dish to order!  My mom hates spicy food and ordered a mild chicken dish.  I love spicy and ordered a medium chicken dish.  We had to switch.  Hers made my eyes water and mine was bland.  The food itself was completely bizarre... none of it had any sauce.  Hers was a really dry biryani.  Mine was some kind of weird chicken sausage, which consisted of about 8 slices on a bed of iceberg lettuce.  Totally blah - I've had better Indian from a MALL.  Super disappointing and ridiculously overpriced for what you get.

When the oysters came they were small, but wow were they sweet and full of favor, good choice. The head cheese was excellent as was the seafood gumbo, then came the mussel. When they pick up the lid off the dish, there must have been 50 in there, or it seemed so. I could hardly finish the dish and what tastes. It was reasonable for what we got, but what a steal as far as flavor. A must do when in NO

As soon as my friends and I walked in, the atmosphere was welcoming and the baristas smiled at us. As we approached the baristas, they kindly described the menu and all the wonderful variety of coffee beverages. 
Despite us being obnoxious and having several questions they were happy to help and carry on conversation with my friends and I. Overall i have an amazing experience. The coffee was perfect.

Went back the next morning and "wow" what a completely different level of service!  First, the no-smile hostess was not working on the second day, but rather a very pleasant and happy person.  We were told the wait was about 20 minutes.  I thought impossible with the number of people waiting.  So, we walked down to CVS and came back in 20 minutes.  Our name had already been called, denoted with a question mark on the wait list page, and scratched out.  The happy hostess said she'd seat us next.  And she did.  And we got Lauren again!  And she recognized us!!!  We ordered and waited just a short while for our breakfast.  It was an amazing thing to watch the kitchen pump out meals for their guests.  They were awesome.  We got our food and once again it was delicious.  I love, love, love Another Broken Egg Cafe!  Visit here, eat here, enjoy life here.  5 stars all the way (as long as the no-smile, unhappy hostess isn't working).

Absolutely delicious food. Everything we've ordered has been incredible. The chicken 65 appetizer is a different taste than I'm used to having at an Indian food place, but it was outstanding. All the traditional dishes are very flavorful and can be made to suit your spice level. The service is friendly and attentive. Can't go wrong!

The services and ambiance was really nice. Meals were really reason. I ordered broccoli salad which was good. Cauliflower and buffalo sauce which was really good, however we order the buffalo wings which came with five wings which was unseasoned and unpleasant. 
I live right across the street and will not be returning to this restaurant although their customer service and atmosphere was nice the food was mediocre and not the favorite.

Mr. Electric have resolved a months' long problem of flickering power to the house. The patience, determination and sheer professionalism that Gabe from Mr. Electric exhibited was more than impressive. He wasn't satisfied that it was our panel being the problem (most others just said I needed a new panel), but narrowed it down to the EPCOR power supply. EPCOR had been out once and declared the power stable. He got them out again, and together they found a bad (arcing) line in the roadside cabinet. Problem found, and resolved. I cannot say enough about the service this company provided to us over the festive season. I can say that I would recommend them to anyone without reservation. They are an outstanding example of great service.

If you are looking for that completely nourished in the stomach and the heart feeling, try a bibimbop from Bab Cafe. The food is clean, delicious, and has all the nutrition you need! It's great for takeout, or hang out in the trendy restaurant! Make sure you stir it up more than you think you need to! And keep sipping that miso soup! It's such an amazing combination. And because there are so many options and combinations, the revisit value for this place is high. Vegan, vegetarian, and kosher people can eat here and have a great time with their friends without judgement!

Just had the greatest experience at Bauhaus. I'm fairly new to the area and was so hesitant to find a new hair salon, but decided to try it out because of the positive reviews.  I scheduled with Brittany (they got me in within a day of calling!). I was actually late to my appointment and everyone was so nice and accommodating.  Got a GREAT cut- Brittany listened to everything I wanted and did such an amazing job. And for a GREAT price! Consider me a regular!
This isn't your run of the mill BBQ joint, incredible selection of fresh meat and seafood. Do yourself a favor and try the filet mignon sandwich.

This was my first time eating here and it will be my last. A friend recommended this restaurant as having good ribs. They weren't tender and very chewy. What makes it worse is I couldn't even eat the sides because the were loaded with salt. Waste of time and money.

Instead of waiting 45 mins for a table at another fairly new bar in town across the street, I gave Ole Red a shot with only a 20 min wait.  Once my table was ready, I was told to walk across the room to the stairway and walk up a flight of stairs to be greeted by another hostess that would show me to my table.  The table they offered me was in the corner away from the live entertainment that was playing on the main stage downstairs.  I denied their table and found a spot at the bar on the same level that was not crowded.  I ordered a drink and sat back to relax to the sound of the band playing cover songs.  I thought the red tractor hanging upside down added a neat touch to the atmosphere inside the bar.  The drink I ordered was smooth and easy.  I just wished the band would have mixed it up with their own songs along with singing cover songs.

I love this place and try to stop in whenever I'm in the neighborhood. The tuna cheesesteak legitimately blew my mind. Super delicious and unique. I am not a vegetarian but I only really eat seafood in terms of meat so this was perfect for me. Everything else I've eaten there I loved and I like the divey seafood joint atmosphere. Get that feeling this place has been around a while, which wouldn't be at all surprising.

I loved smileys for the first year when they opened. I ate it about 3-4 times a week. However, lately, the pitas have been stale and the falafel very dry. Also it seems they have started skimping on tomatoes in the sandwich as well. I keep giving them another chance bc I'm vegetarian and there's not many options in manayunk. But I think this sandwich is my last. It seems ever since they turned the restaurant over to teenage workers the quality drastically dropped. Hopefully smiley and his wife read this and get back in the kitchen themselves. I miss their sandwiches!
Maria came to our home today and did an amazing job!!!  We work crazy schedules and have 2 boys & 2 dogs so it's tough to keep up with the house. I couldn't be happier with the way my home looks!!!
Not too good last night. Seaweed salad overly sweet and a tad old. Yakisoba had over cooked veggies.Sushi was terrific. Usually much better so I'll go for three stars in hopes it was a fluke.

My favorite orange theory location in New Orleans! All of the instructors at this location are amazing. I've taken classes with Sasha, Kristian and Josh...enjoyed them all. The staff is extremely friendly and always wants to help where they can. The first couple of classes may seem overwhelming but stick with it, it gets easier and is totally worth it. 60 min of cardio and weights, can't beat that when trying to fit in a quality workout in a busy schedule! Love love LOVE OTF mid city!!!!
A group of 8 of us went here on a Saturday night. We did have to wait a bit for a reservation, but it was worth the wait. Food was good, service was really nice.

At first I thought this was a sketchy idea. My boyfriend wanted to eat Chinese but the only problem is that we couldn't find the restaurant. It doesn't have a sign and the area is pretty scary. The restaurant is located underneath a Mexican store. Be on a lookout for the yellow building. Walking in my first thought was this is a hipster fusion Asian restaurant. Staff are very friendly and laid back. Upon ordering I read other reviews about the general Tso chicken so I got that. Also the ginger noodles, craw rangoons and Hawaiian fried rice. The craw rangoons are delicious but the only problem is there's not enough filling. They cut their rangoons in half making the cream cheese filling melt out but the spicy green salsa condiment on the plates makes the dish taste amazing. Next the ginger noodles. The serve it with a gigantic spoon... This dish was my least favorite. It's was bland. I didn't not like it. Do not get it if you want to waste $12. General Tso chicken was pretty good. It's not your regular chopped up chicken. They serve you a breast, thigh, wing and drums. Best Tso chicken I ever had. It was a bit overcooked but tasted good still. I would recommend subbing the breast for thighs. Now my favorite dish is the Hawaiian fried curry rice. This dish is f***ing amazing. The pineapples were sweet, the bacon made the rice smokey, the curry was just awesome and I love how they had just a little bit of vegetables in the dish. Overall I would recommend this restaurant

We moved down here from New York and have been looking for a nice coffee shop in the area. After one year of no luck, we are so thrilled we finally have a nice cute coffee shop in town. What's even better is that the coffee is really good. The ice coffee is cold brewed (the owner should call it out by the way!) and the croissant is just great. At the end of the day, how can you beat great food at good price? The owner is very friendly and I love her risk taking entrepreneurial spirit and story. She also provides free wifi. I hope this place can eventually become those places where you can come in with your laptop and work for half an hour with a cup of great coffee. P.S. If you think her coffee is great, don't forget to tell her that! She took the effort to get coffee beans from Italy!

The 4 stars is for the burger - I did not try any other items (Fries, mayo or shakes).
I got soggy sweet potato fries at L'il Dans - FAIL.  (But that's another review.)

The burger itself was on the rare side - and I had the special with a fried egg (perfectly done - a bit runny but not raw) and cheddare cheese (subbed for swiss), lettuce tomato and scallion mayo.

Perfection!   (And a calorie bomb.)

Can't wait to visit again - but not for at least 4 weeks.

$9 for just the burger.  (That can really add up if you get a $3 soda or $4 fries)

I was a little disappointing with Rippy's to say the least.  The atmosphere was amazing I love the open bar and the roof top dining. I think our mistake was coming here excepting  a nice sit down meal. Rippy's is great for after work drinks or a quick dinner, but if your coming in from out of town and want to enjoy a nice meal I would suggest another place. The plastic cups and Paper plates were a huge turnoff epically for the price we paid

The Food was ok we had the nachos with pulled chicken, I believe they would have been better if they weren't served Luke warm. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs, and usually I am not a fan of dry bbq or bbq where you have to apply your own sauce but these were good. The meat was tender and smokey and fell right off the bone. The sweet tea could have been better.  My overall opinion is that the food was tasty and the atmosphere great but that does not equal a good restaurant. I would def try if your in downtown Nashville its a def must experience. I personally would just get an appetizer and drinks.

This is like a Denny's, in that they offer a huge variety of foods, but in no other way - it is one hundred times better than a Denny's. When you walk in you see a wall of cheesecake and you pretty much know it is going to be a fun experience. We were fortunately seated near the HDTV at the back of the restaurant as we watched the Jets fail their faces off against the Steelers - that part sucked, but even that sucking moment was still fun since we were hanging out at the diner. We were in a big group and we also were sitting right next to another big group, the Duke University fencing team. This place draws big groups in because it has a legit reputation among everyone, locals and those from far away who had a great meal here once a long long time ago.

The big guy (4u) waiter right off the bat was friendly, gracious, and funny - top notch staff here for sure. The water was not exactly refilled at a regular pace but I guess it was pretty busy. It was really hard to choose a dinner since everything sounded so good. I finally settled on the open faced Monte Cristo, longing for 'ye olden days when that deliciousness of the Monte Cristo used to be available at Bennigan's before their shenanigans shuttered their doors across the country. Penrose does not make 'yo daddy's Monte Cristo and that is not an entirely bad thing.

This is french toast as the base, two pieces and very moist and eggy. Not fried like Bennigan's. Just french toast that is AWESOME. Then meat piled on top of the french toast. Then some cheese on top of that. And a big helping of fries. The fries were solid, the good diner kind, not the shoe string or crinkle cut or that other junk places try to pass off.

I will be back for more Penrose.

I've been holding off on writing a review for this place. Only because we've eaten here multiple times and every time was a different experience. 

First visit was great. We met the owners and everyone was so helpful and accommodating. Their suggestions for sauce choices were on point. Food were delicious and fresh. 

Second visit was ok. This time my salad tasted dirty, as if it wasn't washed and prepped before serving. I did saw the guy open a bag and dumped it in. I'm sure a lot of businesses do this as well but maybe we just had a bad batch? I don't know. It threw off my entire meal. I ended up having to pick around it.

Third visit was better. I wish I remembered which combination of sauces I created the first time. Pretty sure I've tried every sauce they offer. 

Overall, nice place. Clean setting and bright, open space. You can either build your own bowl or choose one of their specialties. Love the freshness of the seafood. So far the best poke we've had in the city.
this is a quintessential, classic bar.  thank you, southwark, for filling the void for philadelphia.

Love, love, love McAllister's Deli.  The service is great, the managers are awesome.  My son loves eating here.  And I love that we get to have a good time over a huge plate of Nachos.  If you love Nachos and chili you will not be disappointed with the Ultimate Nachos, we sure aren't.  Only thing we don't like is that I no longer work in the area so we can't go as often as we would like.  But even with that said we manage to still frequent the place.  (Hey, when your pre-teen son offers to go to work with you during the summer break just so that they can have a chance to go to McAllister's Deli for lunch you know they are doing something right; plus it beats burgers and fries any day of the week.

Fried pickles were shitty! More like a big basket of fried breading and grease. The salad was simply lettuce on a plate with dressing. Service was fair at best. The kitchen appeared dirty from walking past on the way to the bathroom. Very loud place. Drove behind the place only to find a huge pile of trash and boxes out the back door and the door wide open for bugs to fly in while 3 kitchen guys were sitting outside smoking.  Not impressed don't waste your money!  Plenty of other options close by

We decided to try a not so high end brewery out for New Years and saw a "good deal" going on at Prism and tried it out. It was a bit of a mistake.  While in the beginning the bartenders were nice and personable, toward the end of the night they got rude and played favorites. On New Year's Eve usually people have fun, drink and get a bit loud- I don't think they really accepted that here. While those around us were making noise on noise makers and yelling all in good fun, an old fossil like woman with a not so good look ( to say the least) turned and yelled at patrons to be quiet and " even the bartenders are annoyed with your loud behavior". The bartenders said not a word and continued to tend to their favorites.  It was uncalled for and very discouraging to watch. It's a shame because of this we were appalled and would never return. I'll also be sure to spread the word to all our local friends about this. 
Have a great day,
A non returning and irritated customer

I skipped breakfast in anticipation of eating a decent brunch at Valerio. Bad idea. Ordered the quiche at 12:45 PM and was told that even though they had just run out, they would have another ready to serve in 1 hour tops. I waited until 2:15 PM until I walked up to the counter to politely inquire about the status of my quiche, as I was starving. Got a cold look and a "Actually, it'll be 45 more minutes because we still have to cool it." Fine. Waited until 3. Still nothing. 
The weirdest part was that they had ALREADY charged my card for the quiche. Before I could ask for a refund so I could purchase something else, she rudely snapped "you can keep coming up to the counter if it makes you feel better, but I just can't cut the quiche right now." I was so shocked that I just said okay, honestly was a little frightened off. When it was finally made (2.5 hours later), it was essentially 4 bites of a veggie omelet with no crust. It would've been nice to hear a "sorry about the extended wait" instead of getting attitude. 
It's totally fine if it takes you 2-3 hours to make that. Just don't lie to your customers in order to get them to buy things. And don't be insanely rude about it?

Also worth noting - the wifi here doesn't work if there are lots of people

First time ever here with my sister for two gel manicures. Upon entering temperatures were taken and they had us use antibacterial. Selection of gel colors was good, just the right amount to pick from. Coming from New Jersey I have very high expectations at nail salons and they met every single one here. Staff was very friendly, the atmosphere was very relaxing. I really enjoyed the light spa music playing. Both of our nails came out great! Highly recommended. Not to mention it's only $32 for a gel manicure!
Thus is the second time I've been but they deserve an amazing review they do such a great job and are very careful and caring!

Absolutely loved living at Sharples! The walk to town is easy and in a perfect location! The staff is fantastic and can't thank them enough for making it home for over two years! Neighbors are great and if you have an animal it's a fantastic place with great ability to walk right to Marshall Park or all over the city. Definitely the best place to stay in West Chester!

My favorite restaurant in the area! The food is incredible, fresh, well-made, and really reasonably priced as well. I usually call ahead on my way home from work and it's always ready when I get there, and the owners are super nice and just generally joyful whenever I see them. Highly recommend the falafel pita with a side of hummus and a raspberry lemonade. This is where I send everyone who asks about good food in Manayunk!

I scheduled cleaning service online using the 3 room cleaning for $119 discount code. Only one room was cleaned. I was charged $115. My husband told the technician "Brandon" he thought his wife had scheduled 3 rooms, but Brandon responded that he could not clean rooms that were not on his order. Why would someone select the 3 room discount code but only want 1 room cleaned for almost the same price? That makes no sense. My husband didn't know what to do and paid the bill. I have since been in contact with customer service Maria Marriner who told me I could pay an additional $99 for the 2 rooms to get cleaned. Extortion at its finest. Poor interaction and extremely frustrating experience.
It's still a great concept which I like very much but based on the quality to price ratio I'm lowering the review to a more realistic level.

We've been really impressed by the reliable quality of everything we've tried here for both dine-in and takeout. Kale risotto is a standout favorite. The spaghetti has a generous amount of lobster. Lemon poppy pancakes come with unique and addictive sauces. The only thing I haven't liked was the bee sweet sundae, which I found too sweet.
Terrible, unprofessional, unsatisfactoy. Tint had particles, bubbles, was redone after going back several times. Still not satisfied. Better job and outcome at other places i suggest.

Came here for only a few days and this place was recommended to me twice! It did not disappoint. The waitress seemed to be the only server, and she did an excellent job managing all the tables. The food was incredible with a real family vibe, and an old lady even walked up to me and handed me my napkin which had fallen on the floor and said, "Biden said we should be kind." All in all a great local experience, with delicious bread, lamb and artichoke sauce.

It seems like most reviews take points away for the location.  For me and my friends that was a huge positive.  I love how it's hidden inside a furniture warehouse.  I think it adds to the thrill of going there.  It's like a speakeasy.  Food is great, and I even went with a friend who is a French chef, who agreed that the food is good.

We had my sons birthday party this weekend there. Needless to say, I will never go back and talked to the manager twice and all he could do was make excuses for the terrible service we got. Our "party planner" (I won't name her on here)was completely checked out, sat in the dark room ( not with the kids) playing on her phone. Thankfully my friends were there to serve the kids drinks and pizza. We paid for laser tag, ball blasters and black light mini golf. The laser tag was broken, one ball blaster wasn't working so one kid had to sit and watch and we never got to play mini golf. We had no clue what was going on or what activity was next as our party planner was no where to be found. We talked to the manager and he gave each kids ( there were 8) tokens to play arcade games... ha! What a joke. The games were broken and just took their tokens or didn't spit out the tickets. I called the manager today and he told me she is his best girl and something must be wrong. It's sad if that is his best girl. He told me to call him and he will let my kids play golf anytime on him. I said no thank you, we will not be returning. What really pissed me off was having to leave a $25 to a girl who played on her phone. I should have tipped my friends. I will never go back again.

Yum! I had lunch here with some coworkers, and it was delicious. I'm a fan of the rolls, and the fried chicken was just right. The mashed potatoes were creamy and smooth, and the pineapple casserole was an unusual hit with me that reminded me of pineapple upside down cake. It served as dessert with its sweet taste.

While I had never heard of Barbara's, the atmosphere was interesting and homey. I felt like I was sitting down for a bite to eat at my grandmother's house. Service was friendly although not particularly fast, and photos of famous people who have visited line the wall behind the cash register. Actually, it sort of reminded me of the Loveless Cafe with better rolls.

This place will be awesome- but a few kinks to work out first. I visited on a Thursday evening hoping to have a casual food truck + beer- although no food trucks were available. Love the interior decor although acoustics are bad- it gets very loud and echoey even with a small crowd. That said on a nice evening the place to sit will be out on the lawn. Really like that they have a lot of bike parking out front. I was also hoping to try the new blood orange beer but they were already out! Will be a go to spot for sure

I decided to try out guitar lessons because I've always envied the fun my brother and uncle have playing guitar. Also, with a little one on the way any day now, I think it's important for kids to grow up with, and around, music. Even though I had played other instruments fairly proficiently in the past, I knew that with something like the guitar, I could save myself a lot of frustration, bad habits, and time by getting lessons from a professional. And that's where Kale comes in! I've enjoyed and learned from each lesson from day one. I like the pacing and combination of music theory, technical lessons, and the opportunities to play along. My confidence and ability, even though still quite nascent, are far beyond what I could have accomplished on my own by watching YouTube videos or that kind of thing. When my husband hears me practice, which he admits to enjoy, he's impressed that he can recognize songs or notice improvement in such a short time. I'm very appreciative of Kale and the careful attention he has applied to my playing and lessons.

Fan of the baked Mac and Cheese, it was delicious, comes baked in a crock served nice and hot.  Great hang out for apps and drinks with 3 levels to hang out in! Classic atmosphere, lots of history in this old building. Great downtown location.

A relative  of mine recommended me to the Bakery House about  1 1/2 years ago.  We frequented  a local bakery for years, so, I was hesitant to change, especially since the BH is out of my way.  Well, I am hooked!   The cakes, pies, breads and bars are astounding!   Every baked good is made from scratch.  Their chicken salad is homemade and a staple in our home.  We are truly Bakery House converts!  We have a Bakery House cake whenever there is a birthday or a special event . The drive is not bothersome when you have such  great treats a the end of your trip! 
***A quick story.  The daughter of a friend was in Europe  for a semester.  The first thing she wanted when she arrived back home was a Bakery House cupcake!
Check out the Bakery House!  You won't regret it!

My favorite day of the year is Labor Day, when I attend the Reno Rib Cook-Off. This year we actually were there the day before Labor Day. It was a little bit more crowded at the event but the drive back to the Bay Area was much faster than doing it on the holiday.

Parking is generally very easy. It can take a minute, but there are several locations that are closeby, if you're patient. The streets are closed for the event and lots of stands to choose from, selling ribs and roasted corn, or other fried, delicious foods. 

Sampler plates (3 ribs) are about $7 - though this year we saw one as high as $9 (and it wasn't very good). and one that gave us 4 ribs for $7 (from Memphis.... served dry, without sauce - they were the BEST ever!!!)

Two restaurants local to our home make it to the Cook-Off every year: Kinders and Back Forty Texas Barbecue. Both are really good but obviously I am not going to stand in line to try them at the cook off when I can get them at home.

Lots of vendors sell jewelry, clothes, popcorn, etc behind the street. There are also rides for kids. 

The BEST thing is that there are lots of porta-potties, and they are super clean! They even smelled good... at the end of the day! In the HOT HOT HOT sun. It was nice.

So next year: save up your money, hit up the fest, and try like 5 different rib places and then some corn... get some sodas or stop at one of the bars on the street, ...maybe do a little gambling -- and you'll definitely have a new favorite day of the year! 

[Make sure to get a hotel room in advance because this weekend is always booked in Reno! Completely! From Motel 6 to Grand Sierra Resort to the Nugget - everything!!]

If you've barely travelled anywhere.  Lived in the same town your whole life.  Only place you've ever vacationed was an amusement park or Disneyworld.  Best restaurant you like to eat at is McDonald's, this is the place for you.   If you have more experience with anything better than what was mentioned, avoid this place, it's nothing more than one step up from Chuckle Cheese.

Best scallion pancakes in the area. Greasy , but a tasty guilty pleasure. Ordered the soup special. Pork dumplings, Roast pork and Mei fun noodles. Also ordered as spicy. Very delish. Next time need to order a more substantial noodle. Mei Fun better as a main base. Too delicate for the soup. Thai basil chicken also tasty. The chicken was super soft. Nice crunchy fresh vegetables. Silverware, chopsticks and sauces provided.   Fortune:  "Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors."  Happy New Year!

Refined environment. BBQ shrimp are DELICIOUS. Warning: skip the bread pudding. It was lukewarm, the sauce was cold. The waitress said they couldn't heat it because it was a cream sauce. The best bread pudding is at a restaurant called The French Market Restaurant and Bar. It's only a mile away in Decatur.

We ate here a couple of months ago.... had a burrito with their homemade salsa.  I've never had a breakfast burrito I didn't care for until I ate this one.  It was so salty, neither me or my husband could eat it (and my husband likes salt!).  When I mentioned it to the waitress, she said she had several other customers say the same thing...  She then went back to the kitchen to inquire about it and then informed us that this is how it is supposed to taste, so it must just be our taste buds.  She was nice about it, so we don't blame her.  The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because their banana pancakes were pretty tasty.  Just wish they would have handled our complaint differently.

My mom works for AB so we had to stop by the brewery and take the Beermaster Tour.  It was well worth $25 - you get a souvenir hat, glass, you get to drink fresh Bud out of the tank, and you get to try a selection of beers at the end of the tour until time's up.  

Our guide did not impress me, sadly.  He wasn't friendly to me and prefaced the tour by apologizing that he was a lil hung over.  But I've been on brewery tours before so I know the process anyway.  

At the end I discovered Shock Top Raspberry which was soooo good.  Must try to find that in California.

Definitely go for the paid tour when you visit!  I'd like to do the Beer School one next time.

Ate here a few times and we can't get enough. Awesome breakfast combo's that're a perfect mix of diner and restaurant. The staff is fabulous and the wait isn't too bad. I had the Birds in a Nest. The poached eggs were PERFECTLY cooked and the spinach/onions added a nice zing to the dish. Their pumpkin pancakes??? No words. Pumpkin Pecan Pancakes with dried cranberries and brown sugar butter? Oh ok. Fluffy and decadent. Light and airy yet rich. I can't wait to go back and try other meals.

I've only gone to this Walgreens a few times. The employees seemed fine, however the Pharmacists were nasty, mean, inconsiderate and NOT VERY HELPFUL! I HAD to go there a couple of times, NO option, NEVER AGAIN. There is NO reason to speak to a customer in such a degrading way. I don't know what was going on during those months, but NEVER EVER, EVER, EVER AGAIN will I go to that pharmacy. I will change from Walgreens to CVS, Walmart, Schnucks, anywhere, there are so many that I do not need to stay with this pharmacy and no need to put up with someone's need to be disrespectful to a PAYING CUSTOMER. What these people in NEED OF POWER do not realize is that I, THE GENERAL PUBLIC IS PAYING THEIR WAGES. And if enough of me say something, that pharmacist will no longer have a paycheck. So, please be nice and have some respect for people who are paying your wages. Stop being a jerk and get off your high horse.  Two stars for the poor employees at the front desk for having to put up with the check out jerks at the pharmacy and the pharmacists who deserve NO STARS.

Honestly one of my top picks for breakfast, the people who work here and the owner/manager are just outstanding fantastic folks! The food is great, pretty much no matter what you order. Their ice coffees will get you where you need to go without being overpowering. Best bacon in the city.

I purchased my wedding dress form here and my 7 bridesmaids also have purchased dresses from here. I've been working with Cathy and she is amazing. Not only is every staff member willing to help but they know their stuff. They will help you make your dream wedding come true. I don't know where I would be without Cathy. Thank you Robins bridal!
A great place for Italian goods! The place is ALWAYS packed so be prepared to feel claustrophobic. You should really know what you're looking for before going. Their bakery is to die for!

I was visiting in town and decided to stop in for lunch. I noted upon entering the Resturant was full and everyone was enjoying their meal.  We were a party of three. We were seated very quickly. Our drink orders were taken and brought back quickly. I ordered Big Mikes BLT. My husband ordered Bacon Mushroom Swiss Burger and our guest ordered  a Western Omelet. My food was good it was served with onion rings which looked better than they tasted, they were somewhat soggy but the BLT was Great. My husbands burger was delicious it was served with fresh fries which were also good. We each had a salad that was just ok. Nothing much but lettuce. Our guest said her omelet was very good but I noted her toast was somewhat burnt. Our drinks were replenished quickly and are waiter was excellent. All staff were busy and friendly. Will eat here again for breakfast. Breakfast is served all day. A little pricy.

The places has changed owners several months back and its mediocre.  The coffee was way to bitter and the owner was just not very friendly. He was mad about everything and my curry chicken was so wet it made the bread soogy. It was just not a good experience and not worth the effort.

Got this delivered last night.  Ordered a pepperoni pizza and some breadsticks.  There were a ton of breadsticks.  I requested plates and plastic ware and received none.  This is the only thing that caused it to lose a star.

I used to really enjoy this place...before the high class makeover. Now they're just too good for their own good. 

We stopped by today for brunch on our way to McCall. I ordered some coffee (drip) and a slice of quiche. The coffee handed to me was luke-warm. The quiche was not even luke-warm...yet they asked me if I wanted it "heated"..."Yes, please."

To top it off, we changed our mind and ended up on the outdoor patio in spite of the fact that we ordered our food to go. They made a point to tell us "the patio is for full service customers." OK, I guess the 10% tip I left them for handing me a box wasn't good enough for the patio?

Still, I'll give them 2 stars for their location and patio. You'll just have to endure the food to get to the good stuff.

We came from Chicago for a concert and were not familiar with the Indy area. We had an awesome experience with Top Shelf Tours shuttle from the Broad Ripple area to Ruoff Home Mortgage Music Center! 

They had designated pick up spots so we were picked up at Thr3e Wise Men Brewery in Broad Ripple and they got us to the concert in perfect time. Very nice staff. Would absolutely do this again!

This was one of our stops during the Eat St Pete food tour.  Wow!!!  The food is so freaking fresh!    The spicy tuna basically melted in my mouth.

And HEATHER is amazing!  I loved her energy and how well she explained the history of the restaurant, paintings and where the fresh food is flown in from.

We live in the area and plan on coming back many more times!

The first time we enjoyed SF Kitchen it was Christmas evening around 7:45 p.m. They were one of a handful of restaurants open. They gave us a heads up that the wait would be longer than normal (45 minutes) because of the holiday, which of course we didn't mind. We were just grateful they were open! When I stopped by to pick up the food, the place was packed. Every seat and table was occupied and they had to-go orders lined up on the counter! 

We ordered two bowls of Pho with flank steak raw beef and it was delicious. The beef broth was very favorable and the meat was tender. They provided a very generous amount of toppings: bean sprouts, basil, lime, duck sauce, jalepanos. Each order of Pho was enough for two meals.

We've ordered Pho from here multiple times since and it's consistent and good. They normally have to go orders ready within 10 minutes. This is definitely a go-to place for us for Pho.

Visiting our favorite Tucson Airbnb and this came up on Yelp.  It was wife's birthday and she wanted to give it a try.  Glad we did!  She had the chicken salad on sourdough and I had the bbq with slaw sandwich which is grilled.  .  Bread is made on site as are most of the ingredients.  Also the kettle chips.  
Do yourself a big favor.  Stop reading this review, get in your car , go there, enjoy.  Your mouth will thank you!

The customer service was good. The restaurant is clean. The portions that you receive for the price that you are charged does not work.  The portions are small. Also, the food lacks seasoning for it to be considered a "soul food" restaurant.

Love the decor and food at this place. From the French toast to the eggs everything rocked. Staff is friendly and served the food quickly. I was shocked when I got the bill and saw how cheap it was. Definitely a Tucson gem.

For what it is, a tiny, neighborhood art store - this is such a little gem! It's not massive, so it doesn't have a HUGE selection of products, but what it does have is a very thoughtfully curated stock. The products they keep are hard to find in a lot of other places (lots of neat brush pen options, and Faber Castell water color pencils which I haven't found anywhere else!). The prices are really good (not 'boutique' - if that makes sense) and very reasonable to be honest. The service is great - the owner is friendly and so knowledgeable - he has a toolbox of supplies that you can test! How awesome is that?? Love this place - so glad I can support small businesses like this whilst also indulging in my love of all things stationery!

Still the best pizza in town, but I finally got around to trying their sandwiches.  The Philly Cheesesteak is very good.  The salad selection here is pretty limited, which is my only real knock against this place.  They have a surprisingly large beer selection with very good prices.  They also have daily specials to keep an eye out for.  Highly recommended if you are in Oldtown and in the mood for pizza.

My usual Cpap supplier was absorbed by Versus. They have been absolutely horrible to deal with. Me and my husband needed the supplies we were do for the month and they are trying to send us all the supplies for a three month period. Our insurance only covers certain products per month, per 3 months, per 6 months. They kept transferring me from sales to billing then billing to sales and back and forth having to explain my story each time. I was simply due an amera view cushion and disposable filters which cost me $12.16 with insurance last month they were trying to get me pay $212+. Come to find out they had not even run it through my insurance yet. This was all over 3 different calls. So very upset and frustrated. Going to find new supplier. Update: After looking at mine and my husband's EOB from Insurance Verus had over billed us both. It it took 2 months and numerous calls to get a refund. All started first of July They said check had been sent in August then in September oh check has been on managers desk to sign. Got my husband's refund of $107 still waiting on my portion. Don't do business with this company

Angela is a gifted intuitive and a great communicator, answering your questions quickly and even providing dates for when things will happen. I have been back to her for several readings as I always feel supported and loved. Don't hesitate to contact her! Many thanks Angela for the work you do." ~ Georgia, NY

I ordered a substancial tile order from SCS Tile and I did not receive what I was shown. When I picked out my tile I was shown a square roughly 18x18 travertine . Yesterday my contractor went to pick up the tile and it was a  Versailles pattern. This pattern has 5 pieces, one of which is square. I went to see what the mix up was. The owner told me that I must have "forgotten" what type of tile I ordered and that he showed me all 5 pieces.  I explained that he did not , he only showed me a square piece and that I even had him come give me an estimate to set it diagonal . I told him that if he had shown me all 5 pieces I would have never ordered that. He was adamant that I did not remember what I ordered. He said he would let me order new tile but I'd have to pay a 25% restocking fee. He said the contract says no refund. While I was there he raised his voice at me, so I raised mine back. It became a shouting match at at one point he yelled SHUT UP. I yelled the same back . There was no reasoning with him . Now the tile is going to cost more to install because it more complex and more pieces. I think he should pay for the additional cost of $3150.00 dollars. He was not forth coming with what I bought . I had my contractor pick up the tile and I left , there is no reasoning with him . I'm appalled that he would treat a customer that way and believe that as a customer I don't know what I ordered! I have filed a complaint with the BBB and will seek legal action if he does not pay for the additional cost of installing the tile . I think I am being more than reasonable . I will never shop here again and will make all know of this awful experience!

Tony's has a new location and we wanted to try it.  Meet friends there Tuesday afternoon around 4:30, got seated right away.  Our server Meka was prompt in getting our drinks orders. There is a new menu and I really like it.  Not too wordy and overloaded.  They kept many of the favorite entrees.  I had the shrimp scampi,  had about 10 nice sized shrimp on a bed of linguini.  It eased delicious,  linguini cooked just right and shrimp tender.  Had a salad and steak fries as my side.  Salad wad loaded with dressing.  Hubby had the 12 oz pepperloin with baked potato and salad.  He said the steak was good.  We'll be back.

There are not adequate words to describe how amazing Dr. K is with animals. She is literally the St. Francis of Nashville. I was gifted an American Bulldog puppy shortly after my husband suddenly passed away in 2013. Dr. K came highly recommended by my friend Jen who has owned and recused about a million dogs. Dr. K was just about to move from Value Vet to open her own practice on White Bridge Rd, so I decided to wait the couple of weeks for Lazarus' initial visit. He had his first round (or maybe two) of shots, but was not fully vaccinated. Before her office opened, he got very, very sick. 

My friend Jen and I were thinking the worst - parvovirus. Jen gives me Dr. K's cell phone and having never met this woman, she said get him up here - now! The office was not opened yet, final construction was still going on with builders and workmen and supplier deliveries in and out...are we clear, this was a vet's office that was not ready for business. It didn't matter. She took him in her arms, tested him, confirmed it was parvo, hunted through boxes and bags and an unorganized mess to find what she needed and began treatment. She had me bring him in every other day for the first week for shots and fluids and SHE called me daily to check on him. In about ten days he turned the corner and recovered. With parvo, you either get better or you die - no in between. Lazarus would not be here today without Dr. K.

She later led my dad's precious Shih tzu, Scooter, over the rainbow bridge at age 16 when he had a stroke and was beyond help. She is simply the sweetest, most caring, compassionate, effective, intelligent person you can trust to treat your furry family members. I wish she treated humans - she would be my PCP in a heartbeat.

Oh, as a bonus, her prices for services are very reasonable. She could charge double what she does and it would still be a bargain for the care provided. Places like Murphy Road Animal Hospital should  be shaking in their boots with Dr. K as competition.

Amazing place, crystals galore, lots of knoWledge to be learned and tons of money to be spent!!!
This is a great shop and the people workinng and running it are true  "gems"..... pun intendedd.  but goodness me  the prices are jacked so high up you'll astral project yourself right out into a space if you think anout it too hard.  We'll be back if thEres ever a special need but  for our purposes we've just got to find a place more affordable.
I have never enjoyed the food here and there's always problems with my order. Not sure what all the hype is about.

The folks are reliable, reasonably priced, and do excellent work.  I have a small house, but no time to keep it as clean as I'd like.  They do.  And the customer service is as good as it gets.

Can't say enough good things about these people!

They are a fraudulent business, be careful they charged me a professional shop price (over 3000) and the work they did was equal to a alley mechanic.
They didn't put parts or screws back on correctly, i had to return 2 days later to have a light that fell out replaced.

I had to check twice to make sure I was reviewing the right place, based on the other reviews.

Reading the menu, the entree noted "...bread of choice...", and asking the waitress about it, she replies 'it comes with toast."  Pointing out the menu, she says, "I don't know what that means, it comes with toast."  Mmmm, toast and shrimp, yummy.  It also came with a salad which turned out to be lettuce with finely chopped tomatoes, and thats all.  

The shrimp plate also came with dirty rice.  The rice was hard, dry, and clumpy, just like mom used to make, mmmm..  The shrimp was actually decent, hot, but for $13.95, that was the extent of it.

Total bill - $17.50 for lettuce and chopped tomato, dry clumpy hard rice, toast, 14 shrimp and a coke. As I was staring dumbfounded at my bill, the couple who was just seated by me looked at the menu, got up and walked out.  "I should have done the same thing", I thought.

I'm sorry to say that I just don't like this place.  Granted, I've only had their buffet, so it's possible that their  la carte menu is decent (but I doubt it).

The restaurant has a nice vibe - but that's about the only plus.  The food is very Americanized and average.

I recently ate breakfast at Half and Half in Webster Groves for the first time. Everything was perfect. The service was great. The food was fantastic. The space had a rustic and hip vibe to it. I would highly recommend it for a special breakfast experience.

I came to visit family for the holidays. I always make sure I stop into Eegee's everytime I am there. I love their sandwiches and of course the ranch fries. I look forward coming here even if it's only once a year.
Love this little hometown restaurant.  Food is always good. Macaroni salad is amazing.

Food is always excellent tasting and very well presented. Service has always been very good. Two guys always stand out for us: Branden has been our server or assisted on numerous occasions and has always treated us outstanding being courteous and polite. Juan though slightly robotic in his mannerisms has always been extremely helpful getting us anything we need with no hesitation and very quick to clear off tables.

Tujague's is an oft-overlooked classic New Orleans eatery / bar, over 125 years old.
Having eaten there with family numerous times "in me youth", I hadn't been in several decades.
We dined there Sunday evening.  It was every bit as wonderful as I recalled.  
Had the "prix-fixe" six course offerings; filet for me and pane'ed veal for Wife.   Both delish and price very reasonable for such "fine dining" !
The interior is unremodeled old N.O.  The food is unabashedly yuppie-chef-less !  Just classics, all done to perfection !
I live here and am very familiar with ALL of the other area places.  If one wants classic old "N'Awlins", this is IT.  Others should go to their usual chain places.
Notice the addresses of those others who give negative comments.
Please, please spend one evening meal here; don't miss this fine dowager of classic N'Awlins restaurants........

If, like me, you've avoided shopping at Whole Foods because you worried you'd blow your entire month's grocery budget on just one week's worth of groceries, this review is for you! While Whole Foods is definitely one of the priciest places in town to grab ingredients, some strategic shopping can really help take your home cooked meals to the next level. 

In particular, the produce section is well-worth checking out as not only are the fruits and veg incredibly fresh, but there are also some rare/weird ingredients that will likely be impossible to find anywhere else in Nashville; I mean, the various farmers markets around town are great, but I've never seen satsumas (i.e., the best clementines you will ever eat), celery root, or kumquats there! I've also been cutting way back on my meat consumption, but I do still make one or two dishes a week with animal protein in them and I really appreciate how transparent WF is about where each meat product is from and how it is raised. Yes, you'll definitely pay more than you would for the anonymous bulk chicken you could get at Kroger, but I'm willing to pay a little bit extra to assuage my conscience about the meat I'm eating (and let's be honest,  meat that's raised on farms is going to be healthier than factory-farmed meat). I'd say you can pretty easily skip WF's frozen seafood selections, however, since I once got halibut here and it wound up having tons of bones in it (an issue I've never had with the frozen fish from Publix or Kroger).

Another huge plus to me is that you can get eggs and milk that are sourced from LOCAL farmers, which again, is worth a few extra dollars as far as I'm concerned. But it's also worth noting that the WF brand of organic milks and eggs are actually a bit cheaper than comparable products at Kroger, so not everything is necessarily pricier here. I've also found that if you're looking for frozen dinners and the like, if you stick to what's on sale, you can definitely walk away spending less than what you would at other stores (though the regular prices will definitely cost more than elsewhere).

I can't say that I'm at a financial point in my life where I can buy all of my groceries at WF with impunity, but picking up a few unusual fruits/veggies and some "happy" meat is not nearly as cost prohibitive as you might think. Plus, if you feel like picking up a quick meal once your shopping is done (or before so that you can build up your energy?), the hot bar is always filled with yummy options... but be careful, because my husband and I have easily spent $30 there sampling random things!
