WF definitely feels like a luxurious shopping experience, but if you care about the quality of the food you ingest, I think you'll agree that buying certain core ingredients here and supplementing your shopping at a cheaper grocery store just makes sense!

It was no where near as good as we were expecting. It was really cool that we could order ahead of time to save time. However, the fries were tasteless, the milk shakes were so thin, they treated like chocolate milk. ..with a root beer after taste. ...was very odd. I posted the bbq bacon chicken burger. Super greasy. Not to mention the order was Ali wrong.  I just wanted bbq sauce, bacon and crispy chicken. I got bbq sauce, pickles, cheese, unions and grilled chicken. 

I think we will go to five guys next time.

On April 6 I called Progressive Ins  to advise them of damages cause to my vehicle while in a parking lot on April 1, 2018. I was assigned a a adjuster. Then reassigned again to Johnathan and have correspondence with him several times but four to time restriction he  schedule and inspection with Benton who after looking at my car and leaving a message that the vehicle is a total loss, but not returning my calls. So later I receive a call from Juan and he advises me of vehicle was deemed a total loss and I would be getting the amount less the deductible. Advised of all the information he needs and next day all the paperwork. Then Benton calls me after the fact telling me that I will get a call from Juan. I advised him  I talked to Juan signed the paperwork and awaiting my check. He (Benton)was a terrible communicator throughout the process. Juan after I became frustrated he made it right.

Warning everyone considering buying from Ashley to look elsewhere. I opted to pick up my furniture at the distribution center to avoid the 79.99$ delivery fee, meaning I would assemble it. After assembling the entire tv stand unit, the final piece had a major flaw in the finish. After offering to bring back the flawed piece for exchange, I was told that I needed to disassemble the whole piece to bring it back by their customer service center to have it replaced, that their "return policy is just like if you were to buy something at Walmart." I wish I could now just return the whole thing and be done with it, but Ashley policy states that isn't an option either.

Stopped in on a drive home from a business appointment.  Used to go to this establishment many years ago and wanted to check it out again. Very happy to see the place was busy and the soft serve ice cream has not changed. It is very good and such a clean environment.  They take care of their customers with appreciation and pleasure.  I will recommend them as a must stop if you are in the area.
Husband had the crab cake Benedict and I had the special 'fried chicken Benedict on jalapeo and cheddar fried crab cakes.  DEElish!!  The coffee, service and service all 5

My order was very simple and only 3 items. It was quick except when I got home I found out I was MISSING my burger! I also ordered a wrap which was very poorly put together and looked disgusting. Look I know it's fast food and shouldn't have high expectations but at least give me the food I paid for!

In a word, delicious. Fantastic view, nice wine list.
The seared scallops were insanely good, as was the calamari and the conch fritters ( which I selfishly ate for lunch and still had plenty to share) all of the sandwiches looked amazing and according to my fellow diners they were. Best of all though, I swear the key lime pie was THE BEST I've had in my entire life and I've had lots of pie.
Such a beautiful elegantly themed Thai restaurant. One of the best in the Nashville/Antioch area.

Food is honestly the best Italian food for miles!! The atmosphere is so quaint and cute, and the staff is the friendliest and most personable people. Totaro's is truly unique and one of a kind that gives you a taste of Italy right here in Conshohocken
Tried PANA for the first time today and WOW, they are GREAT!!!  They're not heavy and greasy like some donut shops. Definitely deserve 5 stars, if not more!!!  Will be back for sure!

Tried ordering craft beers but server had no clue about beer . Told us the beer menu was old and some beers weren't available. Took forever to get first round . We got our appetizers but had no silverware. Wedge salad was good . Wings were good . Don't order the Italian flat bread , the picture is a lie . There were very very few toppings and for the price . I was offended. Food was ok . Service was poor . Don't believe pictures on yelp , they are professionally doctored.

I absolutely love this place! Newly they have brought in some younger staff which I do think was needed as crystals are growing in popularity and I think it's important to have people of all ages working there so everyone can have a person to speak with that is on their level. The prices always blow my socks off as it is very affordable. The more time progresses I am seeing more maybe not authentic (whole sale, possibly purchased from wish or eBay or some equivalent) which I'm not super into but otherwise it's lots of beautiful pieces, mostly great staff and incredible prices.

Excellence in service. Family run business. Philip explained everything step by step and found the problem immediately. Reasonable rates. Fixed my air conditioner the same day. Gave good advice on prevention of issue in the future.
If you want to listen to a 50 year old bum sexually harassing his employees this is where you should go.  Ask for Billy, he'll talk down to any women in there.

I've been in a property for the last 4 months and i dont have any major complaints. The office staff is friendly and understanding yo your needs.  However i will say I've been waiting on maintenance for awhile now to fix some small issues that i noticed when i moved in.

We went on a Sunday morning for breakfast. Our waiter was Mario, he was great and always had our tea filled. Carne Machaca burrito was delicious and my partner had Carne Asada burrito it too was very tasty. Their salsa is flavorful with a kick which I love. Would be nice if their burritos came with side of beans and rice (burrito by itself is not very presentable) also wouldn't hurt to put sauce and cheese on burrito (not just tortilla). Overall we were pleased so we will be back.

The service was good & staff was friendly. The food was average & wasn't worth the wait. My cousin ordered the po boy and it came cold to the table. She sent it back and they re-dipped it. She sent that back & they finally made the sandwich over.

Right to it: The Yelp Indy International Supper Club rolled in 26 deep for a full dinner on a Wednesday night at 7. Over in the other corner was a party of 10. I was blown away by Peter & Co.'s service.

This was my first sit down, full meal at Saigon. Expectations: High. Reality: Really High. 

This place is exactly why I travel. Nearly every city in America probably has something similar -- a strip mall tucked away in a unsuspecting area -- that is thriving with authenticity. Especially here, the Banh Mi & Pho! 

Now... that's not all they have... their menu is, well, how do I say it, um... HUGE!

From lemongrass beef wraps to catfish in a clay pot. I went with the finest soup & sandwich of my life: bbq pork banh mi & Pho Special of flank steak, beef brisket, beef meatballs and tripe in classic Pho fashion. 

My first visit I thought I was eating bbq beef banh mi, I was incorrect -- it's some stellar bbq pork that is spot on.

The bean sprout & fresh basil side plate with the pho was a supreme touch. 

The service was pretty remarkable considering he's serving a party of 26 in a restaurant that seats about 40 at most. Um, the Yelp Supper Club came through -- big time here. At the other end of the table, I salivated, and salivated, for the Vietnamese Coffee that Jessica  & Rodney were having. My lord, I have to return midday before my coffee cut off time of 3pm. 

And then, something historic happened. There it was, the banh mi bbq pork (re: photo)... it sat there with it's open profile of pork, cilantro, cucumber, carrots & jalapeno on a french roll; she just couldn't resist. She, whom is anti-pork as my Inner Rabbi, my LP, took her first banh mi bite, and I have a Sakijewa golden dollar on it that she'll return for more!

As will I!

Note: Amazingly classy touch of the sides of beer six packs cut out and taped above each booth in a row to display what beers are offered (which includes 3 Viet beers!)

I'm bias.  The first time I went there was for a wedding.  There was a photo slide show of the couple up on the big screen playing before the vows were said and the bride and groom ran the bases after the kissed; it was really cute.

Fantastic!
After a 7 hour trip we initially booked a stay at the Baymont to "save money".
No... 
Stick with the Peppermill.
Even at 12 midnight we were secured a room. Before we woke the next day they were gracious enough to find us accommodations for the rest of our stay.
Clean rooms, friendly staff and safe. 

We will be booking here in the future for sure.
We stopped with eight people to eat outside but never got waited on.  Requested service for ten minutes.  No response.

Pretty unprofessional when the workers are sitting down when you walk in. Female Staff sitting hunched over on a bench with her back exposed singing the songs and making fun of her workers. Is she high or drunk? Because she sure is acting like it. With the lack of customer service I'm doubtful that I'm going back.

Great Hotel,  very nice staff, great accommodations.  The breakfast that was included was very good, a buffet that included, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, pancake and waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, fruit juices, coffee, yogurt. Room was very nice size and bed was comfortable.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

I had some really good authentic falafel here and the guy fried it fresh from the batter for each order. You get to pick what toppings (salads) go in your pita and say how much and he puts them in. I re-heated my falafel pita later and it was still JUST as amazing, if not moreso! Definitely better than Maoz, where you make your own. The falafel tastes better and doesn't upset my stomach. Also, I can't put a pita together like the professionals here, with their fancy paring knives cutting the pita all fancy and neat and not making it overflow or rip. I just can't do that. So I get something yummy and stay neat too. Neat-o. (*sigh* how I love gratuitous-ness-ness).

Anyway, It was very very yummy and authentic. This is now my go-to place on south street for hummus and falafel treats.

I'd give it at 3.5 if I could. I can count on one hand how many times I've given a place 5 stars. But since there are no halves, 3.5 rounds up to 4, hence the 4 stars. Anyhow. 

My husband and I arrived there just before noon on a Saturday. We were the only ones in the restaurant. There was only one person working at the time. A few min (maybe 10) later, another 2 people came in. The hostess/waitress/cook came over to take our order...but only to have us write down our own order on an envelope because she said something about having to be in the kitchen (very hard to understand her). She then went to the other table to have THEM write their order as well so she could hurry back to the kitchen. While we were waiting for our sampler appetizer another table came in and thankfully 2 more people came in to work. I always read reviews and noticed they were very slow and short-staffed. Once they arrived things started to get a little better. We got our appetizer but was told that it was missing an item and to just eat what they brought out and that they would bring out the other item later. Well we got our main course and half way through, I realized we never got the rest of our appetizer. I waved someone down to let them know and she eventually brought it out. After eating, we sat for about 10-15 min or so, waiting for our check. Like other reviews, we had to flag someone down for that as well, despite them walking by and us not eating. The food was excellent though, thankfully, as this was their saving grace. We ordered the appetizer sampler for 2, the Queen's Eight, and Ethiopia's main dish (I don't recall the name). It was all VERY good and I would def go back, now I know what to expect. Give it a chance, as long as you have ample time to do so!!
Great lunch on the patio here today, delicious chicken tortas and salads.  Excellent service too.  There is clearly a first-rate chef in the kitchen.
I loved this place. Cheap. Easy. And amazing!!! I got the muffelatta and I was in love!!!!! Absolute perfection. Highly recommend

They would not honor my wife's friends gift certificate that he husband bought less than a year ago. My wife will never go back because the owner made a seen over an unexpired gift certificate that was still valid....

Walked in for dinner with my girlfriend on a whim. I had read up on Maynard's here on Yelp, so I knew to avoid sitting on the patio. Apparently this wasn't even an issue as all the tables had been booked and the only available space was at the bar. This suited me just fine since a not-so-secret restaurant tip is that sitting at the bar almost always guarantees good service.

True to that truism, the bartender treated us great. Mixed up an Old Fashioned for me and seemed proud to do it right. I wish I had known about their reputation for good cocktails as I'd love to try more of them. I guess I'll have to go back soon.

My girlfriend got the bouillabaisse which was pretty tasty and she seemed to really enjoy it (I've had better but I'm not holding that against them or anything).

I got the cassoulet which was easily one of the richest things I have ever eaten. It's one of those dishes that is so good you know you'll be burping it up all night with a pang of regret but you cannot stop eating it because it's just so unbelievably rich and delicious. The only thing I didn't like about it was the house-made sausage that came with it. It was like a light liver sausage that I'm sure would have pleased a palate more accustomed to it, but I could have done without it.

All told, the food rated between very good and excellent, the drinks were well done, we were treated well by the bartender, and I really enjoyed the ambiance and architecture. I will certainly return.

Oh, Billy Bob's, I really wanted you to be more than three stars.

When I went here for lunch today, I was pretty excited.  I had been looking forward to checking this place out since it had opened a few months ago.  I like BBQ and sandwiches (although I'm no BBQ aficionado) and I went in with an open mind.

As soon as I walked in, my friend and I were greeted by the manager and were immediately seated.  We then met our server who was extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful.

For an app we ordered the fried pickles which came with ranch dressing and another dipping sauce.  They were really good and got me excited for the meal.

I ordered the hamburger, only because I wasn't in the mood for a huge meal and my friend ordered the brisket.  I got an order of mac and cheese as my side.  When my burger came, it was dressed pretty basically with lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles.  The burgers aren't cooked to order, and the one I had was pretty dry and over cooked.  It wasn't juicy at all and I didn't even finish it.  The mac and cheese was good, but it wasn't overly spectacular.  My friend ordered potato salad with the brisket, which I tried, and could tell that it was likely store bought (which isn't horrible, but I've had better).

All in all, the place was a solid three stars.  The staff was amazing, the atmosphere is nice and the food came quickly.  I was sad to see that there weren't more people in here.  I really am rooting for this place, especially because I think the Westbank needs an "authentic" BBQ place.
Another amazing deli. A little pricey, but the food sure is worth it. Ride a bike in and get a discount! love this place

We ordered the Creole Trio and a 1/2 oyster 1/2 shrimp po boy to split. The trio had red beans and rice, gumbo, and jambalaya. The gumbo was my favorite. It was loaded with sausage. The jambalaya was flavorful, but the rice was too mushy. I liked the beans, but prefer them creamier. That is a personal preference so I don't hold that against them. 

The po boy had enough shrimp, but only three small fried oysters. I know the price of oysters has gone up. The first oyster po boy we had during our trip was also lacking in the oyster department AND they added a $2 up charge. At least Desire did not have an up charge. 

Our server was quick and friendly. 

They have decent beers on tap. 

It was a quick place to stop and was pretty good. 3 1/2 stars.

Used this shuttle while staying at Lake Tahoe for a weekend event.  Made arrangements for both pickup and drop off, round trip.  They were exceptional in their communications and prompt to pickup my party of four!  Also left sunglasses in their vehicle which joshua there kindly mailed back to me.  I would use them again!!

The Warhol Foundation don't give dough to "friggin jokes" [cf the snide 3 word review below].  This place earned that seminal grant the hard way - by scraping barely-sufficient pennies together in crumbling warehouses for a decade - and earning the loyalty of area artists and art lovers for the duration.  Warhol allowed it to move into a clean, well lighted space finally...

... with a gallery space large enough to do some good shows, & the other spaces - former admin offices of Tucson's Fire Dept. - the impromptu meditations on this space's history and future - just what I'd expect from a MoCA.

I reconnected in 1 of those with a Walter Benjamin essay I hadn't read in decades, particularly apt for our contemporary situation [something about art and reproduction, you either know it or not], in another met the living room furniture for our near-future downsized living quarters, and in the gift shop discovered a local writer, Aaron Michael Morales.

Few 'BIG CITY' museums have ever given me more.

This is the best gelato I've ever had! It is so flavorful, and may I say that it looks so incredibly appetizing in the case. We split the medium between two people and it was more than enough. We would have gotten a small, but you can only get one flavor in a small (which is kinda a bummer). We got chocolate hazelnut (it's way better than the Nutella) and black cherry. Both were incredible, I plan on coming back here on a regular basis!

Came to check out mole y abuela with my family, we had an amazing experience. Abby and Tayla were super helpful with recommending cocktails for us. Would definitely recommend checking out this spot for a late afternoon drink! P.S get mango white claw.
Got a great deal on necklace and bracelet set staff is very knowledgeable Sergio is an awesome jeweler

A grown-up hotel in a subdued, sophisticated, extremely well-appointed atmosphere. Service is amazing, and you'd have no idea you're just a few blocks off Broadway. I'd come back to Nashville to stay here again.

Very tasty Sichuan place near Trenton. Their specialty is Sichuan style fried soft-shell crab. It comes to the table wrapped in foil along with veggies and herbs. Underneath the foil is some wax or other material that they light on fire with a lighter to finish it off so it is at peak taste when the foil is pulled back and the amazing aromas greet you. And then when you bite in deep, the taste is full and juicy.

The food is just okay, it's cheesecake factory, it's the cheesecake that makes it all worthy of the silly prices. They have decent burgers and salads, but nothing that is outstanding. The service is usually slow, but that always seems the case with any of the locations I have visited.

The food here is really good. You need to go early or it will be a wait outside. Cory was the best waiter we have had in Nashville. I understand why the locals go there all the time. What a great place. Next time we are here pancake pantry will be a must.

Pro: You can ship a package from here.

Con: Very, very strange parking lot configuration that I can usually only manage by making an illegal u-turn.  Tiny, cramped store piled full of shit that just gets in the way, such as racks of greeting cards.

Overall: Comparing this place to other UPS stores, I find it below average but not terribly so. Comparing it to my average experience shipping a package the US post office, it is, of course, MUCH better, because post offices tend to have awful customer service.
Everyone is very nice and the drinks are very good!! Would recommend there nachos and salmon salad

Loved this burger place! We came here shortly after opening and the staff were very friendly. We ordered the nachos which were amazing and easily fed the three of us. For entrees my mom and sister split a salad and shared the slider combo. The salad was fresh and crisp and the sliders were cooked perfectly. I had the backyard burger and it was also delicious and cooked to my request. They have plenty of different burgers and other items to choose from so we will definitely be back to try it all!

Nirvana Beauty Lounge is amazing, from the beautiful
interior, to the amazing owner Joann and her staff! This is the place to be in midtown! Thanks to Vincent for always making my nails look fantastic and Kevin, thank you for the pedicure! You must come check it out!

Rarely do I ever regret eating. Out of five people eating, nobody was very excited about the food they received. On a positive note the bloody Mary was excellent.
Brunch, is not super difficult to cook. Maybe the dishwasher was the only one in the kitchen, and he had to prepare all the meals. If that's the case hi 5 dish guy.

This is easily the best pizza in the area and it's always my go-to spot.

I really recommend dining in. The pizza tastes much better when it's hot out of the oven. Even a short ride home can make the cheese harden up.

It is definitely a no-frills very casual restaurant, but if you are prepared for the mom and pop experience it will exceed your expectations!

I called the manager about a problem with my car window that would not close- it was stuck halfway open. He discussed the problem with me over the phone and got me in right away to look at it. It was able to fix it right away. The thing I like about this place is they communicated really well, customer service was great- very friendly and honest. I would take my car to them to fix anything!!!! Thank you
Great steamer bucket and very reasonably priced.  Great find!  If you are looking for some great seafood off the beaten path this is the place.

As old school as it gets. The register is from the 1930s or maybe older and it actually gets used. It's amazing, worth the price or admission alone. Key copies are a couple of bucks, and they'll be accurate as hell. Don't waste your time at Home Depot or Lowe's folks. These keys will last you. 

Aside from the keys, they have a bunch of hardware for your quick fix/job home improvement needs. I found myself purchasing things for jobs I wasn't even planning on doing because it was just so cool to be in there. I'll definitely be back and you should be checking this place out. 

Just to watch that register work at the very least. 

It's old school baby, but not in the hipster way. 

Ring it in baby...
I've had my share of vietnamese food as my close friend is vietnamese, this place gives me some of those vibes. We order here frequently since it's in walking distance. Our orders are always spot on.

We ordered this through door dash and it was just ok. We ordered drunken noodles, pad Thai, egg rolls, and crab Rangoon. The drunken noodles were ok but I didn't taste much flavor other than spicy. The pad Thai was just ok. We didn't get egg rolls because they gave us spring rolls instead (they were good, I love spring rolls). The crab Rangoon was a huge disappointment, there was maybe a teaspoon of filling with a huge wrapper.

First of all, I need my house to look exactly like this place. I love the ambiance so very much! The food is always unique, delicious, and served quickly. A great way to spend our 11th anniversary! 

I had the wild boar pappardelle which had such amazing flavor. My husband had the spicy scallops (I forget the actual name). He loved it!

The Good: I like the space. The decor is perfect for a hip little mexican joint.

The Bad: Our chicken quesadillas were ok. Certainly better than one would get as bar food at any non-mexican joint. The real problem was with the pieces of chicken meat in them. Several sinewy  tendon pieces and an over all texture like one gets from sub-par chinese food. 

The Ugly: THEY ARE SCREWING THEIR CUSTOMERS. I found a tequila I like on their menu advertised for $8.50. No other explanation, so you can have a shot, or a marg, or whatever, right? Wrong! The check comes and drinking it on the rocks is a $3.00 up charge!!!!!  No lime juice, no cointreau, no shaking. Just put ice in a glass, pour liquor over ice...$3.00! I am tired of these faux trendy spots dropping an up charge for pouring what should be the same amount of liquor over ice, so I complained and they took off the charge, but only after I got a condescending "education" on how they screw people. 

The waitress explained to me (in a "you dumb-ass" manner)  that drinks and shots are made with 1oz pours and that on the rocks was 1.5oz. and so they cost more. THIS IS BULLSHIT! Shots and drinks are (should be) made with 1.5oz of liquor and then add the rest of your ingredients. The exceptions are "pony shots" which are 1oz pours, but one finds this with fine brandies and cognacs. To add insult to injury, our drinks were not even 1.5oz!  

I spent ten years behind a bar in Austin, Texas. Five of those years as the head bartender in an Interior Mexican restaurant that is considered one of the best in the world. Two more as the bar manager of a more trendy and fast paced Tex-Mex joint. I know how to pour a proper drink. 

Don't assume your patrons are idiots, it's the fastest way to loose them.

The sushi here is pretty good... I can't remember exactly what I ordered since in addition to our sushi rolls we also down about 6 bottles of wine. Needless to say I had a great time here and thankfully I did take a picture of my rolls to help piece together the blurry evening. The servers were friendly and very attentive in the beginning of our meal, towards the end the service slowed down and we found ourselves sitting around waiting for our checks to come back. 

Jackson's doubles as a night club at night. I have never had a bad time here and I tend to find an older crowd here, which is refreshing in comparison to the 18 and up crowd at some other bars in the area. 

Jackson's also offers a pretty good brunch on the weekends. It's all you can eat stations for about $22-$35 a person (I can't remember exactly) and does not include drinks.  They have everything from sushi to carving stations to a chocolate fountain. My favorite part of dinning here during the day is sitting outside since the restaurant is located right on the water. This is a great place for a more upscale brunch. I think Jackson's could be a #1 brunch spot if they offered an 'all you can drink special' with brunch since this seems to be a very popular option right now.

If your seeing a punk rock show in somebody's basement in West Philly this is your place to buy Booze.  Stuff here is dirt cheap. I never got around to trying any food here though. If you were trying to rob this  place, I'd try somewhere else. They have authentic 2 inch thick plastic every where. This might foil your robbery attempt.

Enter a warm glow, surrounded by violin music, grass & dogs. All elements of this place are spot on. It's exactly what it should be, down to the porcelain. Go here always

* Matching Uniforms
* Warm Shrimp Salad
* Mushroom Soup & Tart
* Eggs Benedict
* French 75

Only down fall is giant oversized bottles of wine as decoration.

Very disappointed- would give less than one star if it was an option. 
     Tried the seasonal special Lemon blueberry cupcake 
How can a blueberry cupcake get the seasonal name when dehydrated blueberries were used and they still had some crunch to them?
The lemon frosting was dense, too much sugar taste and over an inch thick with a string immature taste 
DC cupcakes has nothing to fear from this wannabe franchise

I've been to this restaurant a few times and just want to point out that the food is phenomenal. They give you so much food for the price and the ambience is very nice as well. No televisions here though so you actually get to have a conversation with someone. Cant wait to go back.

I love spicy foods, and this place is satisfied my hunger for spiciness  I always ordered thai fried rice with extra chopped chilies with fish sauce!! I never tried their chinese and American menu, so I can't make any comments. Pork Larb is the other menu to try!
Great place for breakfast! Really creative biscuits...and it's almost all biscuits...options from the simple to the eclectic.

Great food, service and reasonable prices. Had the poblano burger. Usually I think the toppings make the burger. The toppings were very good but this burger was awesome! I would have been happy with just a burger patty. Fries were great too. Add to that cold beer and outdoor seating on the second floor overlooking downtown Boise and you've got a winner.

Poutine with mezcal is the way to start. Be sure to save room for the pork shoulder -- so tender you could eat it without teeth. The wooden finish and hanging lights provide a casual formal elegance. Best meal I've had all year.

Love going here for the tasty tacos! Corn tortillas are hand made with each order. Wonderful cabeza tacos, fish tacos (the number 1 combo - 3 fish or shrimp tacos, rice, beans & a drink is a steal for the price!). Huge tortas, excellent burritos and delicious desserts. One of my family's go to places in South Tucson. Their home made taco sauce is delicious but quite fiery

Loved this place.  Great music, cozy venue (reserved seats were nice) - only about 30 reserved seats in the whole place.  Band was fun, really seemed to love what they were doing.  Be if the highlights of our trip to New Orleans.

Best Vietnamese on the NorthWest side.  I love everything here.  Especially, the spring rolls.  The grilled pork rolls are great.  And the beef  lemongrass rolls, are not what you think, but a very different style and texture that settles and melts in your mouth.

Fantastic food and service! One of the best cafes around! My only wish is they would extend their hours because the food is so great we crave it often! Try the silver dollar pancakes with chocolate chips!

Great atmosphere and food!  Best tacos in Nashville and a large variety. Fish tacos and a veggie bowls we shared was delicious and fresh.  Their margaritas were delicious. We stayed inside for brunch but they have a large covered outside too. If you want a quick stop get cafe treats quickly. Friendly staff and very clean.

We found this place by CHANCE... if your looking for a great seafood awesome view and environment I recommend this place.  Our server josh was surprisingly very attentive and anticipated our needs..   absolutely impressed with the food environment service and location..

Great vegan food, but too expensive for vegetables. Interesting menu items,  the wild mushroom tostada is very good, but $19 for a tostada is a bit ridiculous . Small restaurant so make a reservation and don't expect a lot of privacy when dining. Dressy casual attire, nice for a special occasion.  I think the food is very good vegan food, but it's a splurge spot in Montecito.
I have been going here for years. Always clean, always pleasant.I love Ms. LINDA! she is super quick.no pain.no ingrowns

I am not really a fast food fan but sometimes you need a quick meal that's good and that's why I come here.  This location is convenient for me and I appreciate that they actually cook the food here and not take it out of a plastic bag or freezer.

The people are always friendly and the service is fast.  The food is fresh and good, I have never had any problem with anything served at this location.  

I also like that they give you options between white and brown rice, pinto and black beans.  They include their toppings at no additional charge except the guacamole.

Good place for a quick bite!

This place is delicious and very authentic. Came here on Saturday night with a group of friends and ordered take out. I got my usual steak taco supreme (for me of course) barbaco enchiladas and steak fajitas! Nice friendly staff, beautiful decor and delicious food. Must try!

Delicious!!! Best food we've had in Reno!  Great service...friendly, fast and so courteous!  The tri-tip arugula salad was perfect!  The meat was so tender..just melt in your mouth!!!  Definitely will come back again next time we're in Reno!!!

New Orleans, Louisiana ---

In my quest for a breakfast diner with counter-seating (a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite), I discovered the "Please-U-Restaurant" on St. Charles (tourist zone) ...

"Please-U-Restaurant" (since 1946) is a TOTAL disappointment ...

No activity, only basic-of-basic service, and an owner that sits in the corner and does not reply to a "good morning" (but just walks by), and REALLY REALLY REALLY bad "sausage n' biscuits" ...

wasn't even "sausage-flavored" ... bland white gravy with a "few" pieces of a frozen sausage patty (very few tasteless pieces) ...

When in NOLA I recommend stickin' with the coffee cafes & their food selections (hint: HiVolt) ...

day 041 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA) 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here! 

#RunAwayBill #DUSA2017 

03.04.17


UPDATE:
son on "non-sociable" owner "just" called me with this opening line after reading my Yelp review:

"how dare you harass my dad!"

my reply was, I only said "good morning to him"

...  son then went into such a non-stop verbal attack on me for "harassing is 63 year old father" (that is mean calling his father "old" at 63 ... shame shame)

03.04.17

My mom and I where in town. The first thing on our list was to find a french restaurant and so we did. Found it on one of the gem guides. We get there and already we had issues with seating, the tables where wobbling all over, finally moved to the 3rd table and was fine but we had to move all our plates, drinks etc ourselves (red flag)... I don't know if it was our skin color or what, but we felt something...Waitress greets us and was like rushing us to order. We ordered Pate, coquille saint jacques, garlic custard, stuff shrimp, onion soup, and the mussel which were cold you can tell it was sitting for a little while... After we ate a table next to us order the same mussell dish, to our suprise it came with a small fork and a big bowl to toss the shell....and we got crap!!! The best french food we've had in a long time since living in Tahiti and we are american/french!!! Unfortunately some of the staff  perticularly Vanessa just ruined it for this great french restaurant, you folks needs to bring in professionals to wait. Our bus boy and food runner  should of been our waiter, not once did she even bother to ask how we were doing....

I have been a regular patron at the Brew Pub for quite a few years and am still a big fan!  IPAs, ESBs, etc are my favorites.  Great pub style food with a few twists are great! I love the quiz nights!!

Meh. A perfectly average night out in carmel. A good beer selection, and the pear and Gorgonzola melt was good. It would be more fun if I cared at all about soccer. The wait staff is inconsistently good, as is the availability of seating.

This is the place to see and be seen in Wayne. It's always a party when I walk in -- job interviews, grandparents, yoga moms, college students -- there's always talking and typing going on. There's not another place like this on the Main Line, I think. The sandwich/soup or salad combo is the best lunch around, the coffee is great, and the atmosphere is perfect. Plenty of outlets and tables. Come here to eat or just get a coffee and work, either is perfectly ok.

All you can eat sushi - something I've avoided until now. If, like me, you've worried about the quality of all you can eat, you don't have to worry anymore!

Zen on Calgary Trail is a great spot for lunch with friends or dinner out. The best part is that everything comes in small portions so you may feel like stepping out of your box (if you have one) and trying something new. 

Look over the easy to read menu (with pics!), mark your selections on your order form, and enjoy as it is promptly delivered to your table. 

Golden California is my fav... And I'll try anything there.... I plan on working my way through the menu in time...

Who's in for lunch? Great price, fast service, good selection = perfect lunch spot (opens at 11:30).

First of all, and most importantly, the pizza is "meh". The ingredients seem very fresh but the dough tastes off somehow. I've tried the pizza three times now. It's hit and miss, kind of like the customer service at this place.  Speaking of that, as other reviewers have said, they don't take credit cards. The last holdout business in town, presumably because they can't afford it (although they'll pass the cost on to you in the form of a "convenient" ATM that will charge you a hefty fee). They can, however, afford to spend money on gaudy light up palm trees in their parking lot that cheapen up the neighborhood.  

Tip:  Do not order a Chicago style pizza to go. The cardboard box is woefully inadequate to handle the amount of sauce they drown the pizza in and you will end up with sauce all over you and/or your car. Also, apparently it's too much trouble to slice the pizza for you too, as ours was not sliced after we got the sopping wet box home. There was so much sauce it drowned out the other flavors of the pizza.  We threw most of the pizza away.

After eating all that po' boys and fried catfish, Surrey's Juice Bar definitely offers a welcome change.  You'll drive right by it if you're not careful as it's located more of in a residential neighborhood.

Tried breakfast on a weekend and were lucky enough to get a table for 7 (right near the front door) without a wait.  Inside definitely had that local restaurant feel that made you feel at ease.  Staff seemed generally cheerful; our waitress was alright as she seemed a bit impatient while we decided over the menu.  

Watermelon juice tasted fresh as their menu offered a good variety of choices from granola w/yogurt & fruit to shrimp & grits.  My meal cost about $15 (incl. tip & tax) for juice & one menu item.  It's a decent place to go if you're in the area.

Food: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Value: 3.5/5

Two stars is sad... I hate giving negative reviews. But it's deserved. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends. Perhaps it was built too hastily, perhaps it is just poorly maintained. Either way, on my mom and her friend's stay, everything that could have gone wrong did. I booked this based on shining reviews, location, and style. I thought it was a cool, swanky place that would be a cool experience for my mom, and it turned out to be a nightmare. Thank god she and her friend have a good sense of humor.

So here's what happened.

The first night in the room my mom and her friend go to pull down the curtain over the sliver of a window at the far left of the room -- which, let's stop right there -- this thing let's in as much light as a prison cell I'd imagine, don't expect the room in the picture with those big windows and nice views -- so this window was sad to begin with, but when they pull on the curtain the whole thing collapses on them. They kindly call the front desk, very sweet girl who works down there, and she sends the maintenance guy up, who is also very nice, but he informs them that the window curtain was broken to begin with and not properly installed so no wonder it came down on them. After some apologies they pack up their stuff at 10pm and are moved to the same room but 3 floors up.

In this new room they unpack and settle in, the curtain comes down without any hassle, so that's great. My mom decides to take a hot shower, but surprise, the water never gets hot. They call the front desk again and the same maintenance guy is set up again. They are promised hot water by the morning.

So then as they are laying in bed, relaxing and reading, they hear a loud BOOM. They don't even want to go around the corner to see what it is, but they do, and the clothing rack -- which by the way only provides you with 8 hangers (so 4 hangers each for a room that is suppose to be double occupancy) -- has broken and fallen down. I can't tell you that I've ever experience a solid wooden bar to fall to the ground with only 8 hangers worth of clothing. 

They don't even bother call downstairs this time.

Sadly the woes would not end there -- the walls were so thin they could hear not only the sound of their neighbor pulling down Their curtain, but partying neighbors that were up all hours of the night to the point where they gave up on sleep at around 630am. And that "chic retro" clock ticked so loud that my mom ended up unplugging it and putting it in the bathroom. 

On top of that, my mom's friend goes to shower with that hot water promised to them in the morning, but it's only mildly lukewarm again. To top it off, the shower drain was clogged and backed up so far she was worried it was going to spill over the lip of the tile. She took a picture and let it sit for and hour -- when she came back the bottom of the shower was STILL clogged up. So the maintenance guy was called up again to unclog the drain in the morning, and from that she witnessed the gallons of hair clogging it up.

On top of this, the pool is just ridiculously small and only has 4 lounge chairs. Yep. FOUR. For the ENTIRE hotel. And there's just one complimentary small bottle of Dasani in the room - I mean ok, the complimentary part is nice but for a room with 2 Queen beds that could hold up to 4 people you better hope you don't get thirsty in the middle of the night and make sure you ration your water out sparingly.

They were thankfully compensated free breakfast, free drinks, and parking, but this is nowhere near what they should have been compensated. I would say at least 1 night returned to them out of the 2 nights they stayed there. On top of that, my mom's friend left 3 voicemails on the general manager's phone that were NEVER returned. This is just bad business. There should have been a call even just to apologize for the series of unfortunate events that happened. 

With it's terrible quality of rooms for the high price you pay, this place just fell flat on living up to it's expectations and promises. The only reason this is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is for the incredibly kind and awesome people they have working at valet, the front desk, and the maintenance guy. Either way, I'm booking my mom somewhere else next time. Good luck if you take a chance on it.

The rooms are small along with the bathroom; the bed is "King" size but looks like a Full.  The only thing my husband and I liked was the Starbucks down stairs and the Air Force Vet Bellman when we first arrived; this will be the last time I stay here; NO FREE WIFI WTF?

Sat at the bar. Prompt service, no complaints. Had a Yuengling for $5.25 and the New York strip cooked medium with the house salad and baked potato for $18.79.

Consistent decor and taste as other Logan's I have visited.

Recommend.

Can I review this if all I did was have a drink, or if I had two drinks? Well, I'm gonna. Vieux Carre' was the drink of choice and they/he clearly knew what to do... perfect drink it was, but almost better than that was the fact that no bar stools existed and silly tourists would venture in and be confused/bothered that they couldn't sit...

Love it.

:)

Love fords! Every burger ive had so far has not let me down, not even slightly. I visit regularly and always sit at the bar. They have sooooooo many beers from drafts to bottles something for everyone. They have different specials throughout the week. The decor is so innovative all the way from the door handles to the bathroom sinks! Bartenders are always cool. over all chill place.

I didn't know that I didn't have a review for this yet. It's a great place to propose marriage.  Well, it worked for me anyway.

Good luck!

I recently decided that I am sick and tired of washing my 85lb dog in my shower at home. It's not that he's a bad dog, it's just that it's a pain in the ass. Usually when I wash him at home, there is more water outside of the shower than in the shower. And usually I'm soaking wet as well as the dog. 

So, this time when it was time to give the dog a bath, I decided to hit up Wags & Whiskers. One thing you should know is that this place is in a basement, so its a little tricky to find. But, if you get lost, just give them a call and they will help you out. 

The staff is very friendly and helpful, and their store is full of all kinds of products. If you need to wash your bod this is the place. It is the prefect setup. No more wet bathroom, just a clean happy dog.
The food was great!  Everything dish were well executed.  For an expensive restaurant, the food was great, but wasn't the finest dinning.  Definitely will come back when I get a chance!

I found this to be a pretty cool little bar & eatery right on the river walk with great city views and a short walk to the convention center.

Prices were decent considering the view.  I did not try the food, but saw numerous items being delivered to tables around me that seemed pretty good.  

Draft selection was decent, including a few local options to choose from.  They had a decent cocktail menu as well.

Victoria Park is the unsung gem of the River Valley! It is close to downtown but without the crowds of Hawrelak and Louise McKinney. During the winter they have a very large skating rink that is used by the Speed Skating community for practice as well as time trials. It is also open to the public most days and there is a sign posted with the schedule in the main lot. During the summer it has a ball diamond to use as well as a playground that is tucked away from the sun (good for families that have little ones). It is great for most outdoor activities such as baseball, volley ball, soccer, and kite flying and has easy access to the trails for roller skaters and bike riders. 

The back of the park runs along the Victoria Golf Course and the east side meets up with the Royal Glenora Club. There have been many afternoons that I have searched for an open picnic spot in the valley but have had no luck in the other parks. Every time I find my self heading to Victoria and scolding my self for not just heading there in the first place. One perk is that it has year round washrooms which is great if you are into the snow sports that the valley can offer. My only complaint is that many people use it as a turn around for River Valley Road so at times it can be a touch noisy. 

At the far back of the main field there is a great group picnic spot that has a very large fire pit made out of a concrete ring. It is big enough to have a bon fire and is encircled in low benches so it is ideal for a large group. During the summer there is also a small trailer parked in the main lot that sells BC fruit which is the perfect treat on a hot summer day.

I highly recommend stopping by to take a look at one less traveled parks that the River Valley has to offer.

My boyfriend and I came to New Orleans just to learn about the loads paranormal history the city has to offer. We are so obsessed with spirits, voodoo, vampires, serial killers, and I have been doing tons of research in witchcraft lately. Peak (please forgive me if I misspelled this) was absolutely fantastic! She was personable and so very knowledgeable. No questions seemed to throw her off and you could tell she really cared about what she was teaching. I was very surprised when she mentioned she has only been leading these tours for about 3 weeks so far. Thank you for an incredible experience!

I've had ate in, taken out and used them for catering and they are always great. When you eat in they are friendly and accommodating, the staff really is so nice here. I have also had catering done and it was also delicious and professional. I will definitely be going back !

Service was good, atmosphere was OK but very dark. Food was mediocre,  very salty and very expensive for a lunch menu.  Not much food is given to you as well. Most likely I won't go back. Ralph's of south Philly in Philadelphia was a much much better place,  we like it there. The food was amazing and it was very affordable! Portions were bigger and the food was not salty!

Really mad !!!  So I was going to buy this clearance item and they didn't want to sell it to me for what it said it was (20cents) and it ringed up and they wanted to give me the lights at 4 dollars each !!!!! Like it's a joke.... very mad and disappointed

Met at door by molly who has to be one of the few people who have personality and a smile. Mind you we left a near by British spot due to no greeting or acknowledgment.  They were able to put us on patio for the nice afternoon weather. Ordered a grapefruit mimosa and ipa she didnt know beer menu but i had her just pick.  Miranda picked dogfish and suggested hodge podge hash. We did a big kid breakfast also. Big kid breakfast was just as it was described basic egg,bacon,and toast. My hash was off the norm with sausage,and lots of peppers and onion with cilantro and sauce. The guy who brought it out noticed i ordered potatoes with hash so offered fruit and i apreciated the suggestion. He never brought the fruit. Hash was good and large portion.43.05 was total left 50.00 . Didnt get fruit so didnt do you 20 percent tip plus 50.00 was easy to not request change. Its a 4 out of 5. 0

SCAM SCAM SCAM. This is the worst insurance ever. I am a visiting student at Harvard Medical and Mass General Hospital and I had an emergency visit at Mass General ER room and they denied paying because they think its a pre-existing condition, I wrote to them with all proof that it is not a pre-existing condition and 4 months after the incident still nothing, meanwhile I have to pay to the hospital $4800. On a different hospital visit, in October, they denied my claim because they wanted it to be resubmitted, even if the hospital submitted a claim on my behalf and there is no reason to deny a claim when it comes to a small injury, for about $900. They say they need more time, they ask for more paperwork, all for no reason. I have passed this to our family lawyer, I will not let them get away with this over my dead body. This insurance is a scam and they are taking our money and not providing any services in return.
Great service and great food!  Call Bitar's directly instead of ordering through yelp or grub hub. Free hummus on Monday's if you get their app.
Very cute cafe. I like studying here. The staff are super sweet and their coffee and pastries are actually good. Its worth spending your money here.

I have been living in NYC for the last 4 years, so I have admittedly become a bit of a bagel snob with the bevy of high quality options in the bagel capital of the US. With that being said, I was pretty impressed with the bagel quality at this spot in St Pete! Crispy on the outside and nicely toasted inside with ample thickness, it really would have no trouble fitting in on any NYC street corner. Also had a large iced coffee that was Texas-sized gigantic and well priced. Would love to return!

I used Home Depot to get a loan for a new roof.  Home Depot contracted with JC Roofing.  They were efficient, professional and did an absolutely amazing job!  My dad (knows everything) semi-monitored the project and he was impressed with their work, which is saying a lot.  After the project was completed, JC roofing personnel cleaned all of the debris and even used  metal detectors to make sure that their were no nails about to puncture tires or injury my family.  I am still just blown away and am very happy.

Slow!!! So slow!  We showed up at 8:10 and there was 1 other car in the bays.  We left at 9:35. I have never been to a slower jiffy lube.  Nothing jiffy about it.  Customer Service was normal jiffy lube standards.  A loyal customer for 10 years I've  never had a standard oil change take that long with no line.

Let's start with the good things-I came on a Tuesday morning with absolutely no wait. We ordered right away and were happy to have our food within 10 minutes of ordering. We started our breakfast with the BONUTS and all the Yelp reviews were right, they're DELICIOUS and a must try! The cheesy grits that came with my meal were good and the biscuit was yummy too. The portions of food were good for me but I defiantly wouldn't take my powerlifting husband here, he would starve. The place is cute and clean and the staff were all warm and friendly! 

Now the not so good, the price you pay for what you get is outrageous. When you go to a breakfast spot you expect good coffee but unfortunately the people I was with said it was burnt, terrible, and undrinkable. Their cups were still full and left on the table when we walked out. 

Overall, the coffee and the cost will keep me from coming back.

I've been coming here for like 10 years...it used to be a small salon and now it's extended 5x as big. 

I have had Beth do my hair for several years now. She is very good, quick. She knows what she's doing and does it and I'm in and out fast. 

The salon is gorgeous!  It is always fancy nancied up in beautiful decor. 

The staff is polite and very professional.  

I feel like I'm in Beverly Hills here...I see Dolly Parton every time I go in! :)

They are a full service Salon and I highly recommend it to everyone, men and women!

The prices are very compatible with any other salon.

Go get your hair done here and feel like a million bucks! It's sooo worth it! You deserve it!

Eight of us from Florida rode the bus with Andy as our guide. Andy was fantastic! He was knowledgeable, energetic, engaging and fun. He took us on a tour of the last brewery, Fountain Square. We went to Sun King, Flat 12, Indiana City and Fountain Square. They gave free samples at all but Sun King was a little stingy on the samples. The trip was made best by Andy's enthusiasm!

What a fun place! We were in the neighbourhood at another event and stopped in for a night cap. We had the Yorkshire pudding and it was a big serving and delicious. Plenty big enough for 4 people to have a midnight snack. Good live entertainment. Although there isn't really a dance floor, impromptu dancing occurs. Judging by thr menu it looks like a good option for dinner and a good choice for groups large or small. The live entertainment on the weekends is a bonus. Pub style entertainment, make requests and sing along!

You have to try a hand grenade, or two, if it's your first time visiting New Orleans...

...you just have to!

Ask for an extra shot and see where the night takes you. That is all.

I didn't give it a 5 star because of feeling like I've been hit by a train the next day just about every single time.
Great seafood spot, just call your order in they can get really busy real fast.

I like Harry's. We stayed at the Sirata and Harry's was our first food experience here. It was solid and the drinks had nice strong pours. Stick to Harry's and don't bother with Rum Runners, I won't go back there, but thats another review. Harry's has a good beach vibe, plenty of screens and decent service. Prices are what you would expect at a resort, not cheap, but not crazy. Three drinks and dinner for about $40.

The concierge at our hotel recommended this place for local BBQ and it didn't disappoint. There was a pretty long line but it moved at a decent pace. My boyfriend and I both had the pork place and were very impressed. I tried the moonshine mojito and it was really good. The bartender takes his time with the drinks and a lot of them featured fresh mint. 

The downsides were that the Mac and cheese was bland and a little cold and they don't have brisket at dinner time. I would still recommend checking it out!
Very nice hidden gem of a restaurant.  Great attitudes, clean restaurant, quick service, and the food is to die for.  I will be back to try other menu items.

Sat at the bar with the intention of getting a drink, listening to Jazz and heading elsewhere for dinner. The Cosmo was so good we ordered food. The food is actually tapas or small portions. Everything we ordered was excellent. Try the Banana Strudel with Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream, WOW!
Great sushi! Best in town! Tried the Ahi Tuna with black pepper! It is the best! I wish I could come here EVERYDAY!!!

The prices weren't bad and I bought a little water pipe that works great. My biggest complaint was the past two times i've been in here the customer services has been painfully slow. I get that you're selling pipes that are 99% of the time being used for smoking marijuana, but that doesn't mean your employees should be stoned off their asses. It's pretty sad when you have to tell the guy 3 times that the glass pipe he grabbed wasn't the want I wanted to see. Every employee in there looks like a typical stoner that just rolled out of bed and is late for a college class. Bunch of Wake and Bakers who threw on the clothes they wore at the party the night before and stumbled into work because they slept in and were running late.

Last time we stayed in NOLA, we stayed at the Omni Royale, so this was way on the other spectrum.  The rooms are cheap and book quickly.  You can get internet rates for like $53/ night.  We called in the day of and got $69 and $99 for 2 nights.  The photo on here of the bed is a great example of the simple rooms (bed, 2 night stands, 2 lamps, desk table/chair, and TV in cabinet.)  Simple, yet all you need 1/2 block from Bourbon Street!
The front desk/bell/valet were friendly enough, but slow moving.  Guess that's the area for you.  If we want a cheap stay in the French Quarter, this is the place!
Parking = you pull in what looks like a small alleyway.  Our Envoy SUV fit, so most cars should fit easily.  Valet comes out to greet you and you take an elevator to your room.  There are no amenities such as pool, business center, gym, room service.  Just enjoy a cheap, clean room in the middle of the French Quarter.
Best lunch in the city hands down. Charcoal chicken platter and he changes it up a little every week. Add in falafel and some form of salad and you're set.

I have been here twice now, the other to be fair was a few years ago.  This last visit decided on a Calzone, with a side salad.  overall the calzone insides were tasty, however I found the crust at the seam very thick at $14.99 i seemed to by buying dough .  In the end I would have to say the serving person took away from the whole event. We felt she was bothered by us being there, and we should give here a big tip anyways.  I am not sure I will make it back here there are a lot of other places to explore in this city.

I dislike the Winn Dixie chain as a whole. I think the products are overpriced and their food selection tends to focus on highly processed foods. That being said, this is probably one of the nicest Winn Dixies I've ever been to. It's always clean, it's a large store, it's right next to a basketball court and art studio, and it's down the street from my gym. The parking lot is also more shaded than most are due to the trees. So I guess if you're going to get ripped off at a Winn Dixie, get ripped off at this one.

This supermarket is out of this world! The best part about Cousins is the potential for quirky and unusual items that I may have never seen or been able to buy in big supermarket chains. This is how I discovered some of my favourite supermarket finds. Labneh cheese, roasted chickpeas, candied dates are some of my top faves.

Went on a Friday afternoon, fast seating. I thought lighting was too dim for 130p. We ordered baked feta, lamb gyro, French fries, side salad. Everything hot and fresh but all just average nothing special.

THIS IS A REVIEW FOR 706 CHURCH STREET LOCATION 
This was a decent hotel for the money. It's close to downtown and a lot less $ than the bigger hotels. The free breakfast is what you would expect. But, again, its a good value. 
Parking is crazy expensive $36 per night. I suggest you park across Church Street behind Library for $14. Free street meter parking after 6pm. Bring your own quarters any other time. The hotel is always out of quarters. 
Rooms are very clean and suites have all the amenities. 
Staff is very friendly.
Great shawarma! One of the best in the city. Service is good and authentic middle-eastern.

Medicore to the max!! I can get better froyo from a multitude of places across the bay.

Someone from the business reached out to me on IG and specially asked if I would bring my Mom friends and their kids in for some treats. I said sure, we'll come spend our money at your business.

The group I came in with was a total of 12 people, moms and kids. The two staff helping us were super friendly when it was just us inside the froyo Shoppe. Then for some strange, weird reason, one of the employees started discriminating against us when another customer walked in. It was super bizzare and very inappropriate considering we had spent about $50 as a collective on some below par froyo.

I actually reached out to the person about how we were treated and she justified her and her staff's actions because "they turned the tv on for the kids".

I'll absolutely skip this place in the future!

I've said it before and I'll say it again: One of the most pathetic feelings in life is running for a bus with your big dumb bag and seeing that bus pull away. So close, so close... Oh I've been there and I've vowed never to be that particular feeb again.

I was reminding myself of this very promise to myself the other day when I saw Gigi and Big R's food truck parked outside of 30th Street Station. I was already on the verge of being late for that accursed megabus to NYC, but I still found myself tempted to stop for some of this truck's Caribbean stylins. 

NO. I had to put my foot down with me. You know why? Cause if runnin late for a bus with your big dumb bag is pitiful, nearly missing a bus, running with luggage and a styrofoam container heavy with fried flaky white fish, rice & beans, cabbage, and plenty of hot sauce shakings is even more risky business. But I WAS tempted, cause that was some good cookin there. I mean, I thought about it.

We had split that hefty platter when we encountered Gigi and Big R at the Mann Center in September. The deal was kinda pricey at about $15, but I will say that they did give you plenty. We shared it in the rain, under an umbrella on the lawn: Crispy fish fried in long strips, tender sauteed down cabbage, rice and beans, and hot sauce. 

See, that would be a nice lunch for you on the bus, if you indeed made it, except that everyone would want to murder you dead for fillin the bus with the delectable smells, and for enjoying your life or whatever. Yeah, you can't be eating on the bus. I reminded myself of that fact too. That's another thing.  What everyone on the bus has in common with each other is that they inherently loathe everyone else on the bus. Why? I can't tell you, but damn don't it seem to be so. On my way back from NYC one time some cat brought on the bus with him some dirty water dogs from a cart. You could feel the hate for him grow every time he pulled another one outta the brown bag. Like, the nerve...who does he think he is?

So yeah, I wanted that fried fish platter, alright. I wanted it. I'll get it the next time that I'm not running late for the bus. Plan ahead, sister.

The quality of our four breakfasts was excellent. The two egg Benedicts was just right with crispy potatoes. The eggs and hash was great and the eggs down medium was just right with fruit cup. Sitting by the fish tank was a great experience. The service was outstanding. We would come again! NOTE: the bathrooms were very clean!

I was in Nashville for a conference a couple weeks ago and had some time to kill, so made my way over to get some work done.  

The first thing you notice is how clean and tasteful this place is.  Very classy.  They have a pretty good selection and will happily serve a mug of something cold while you enjoy a smoke.  The lounge is nice, even if it's a little cramped.  Leather seating all around, a large HD TV and superb ventilation mean that they've hit all the high-points on my list of expectations.

It's obviously in a high-rent suburb, but I felt that the prices were still pushing the upper limits.  Still, my cigars were perfectly preserved and the staff was incredibly friendly.  They also win major points from me for warmly embracing pipe smokers.  

If you are in the area and like atmosphere and quality more than low-prices, this is an excellent option.

Have been here twice - both time for work-related happy hours.
Good service from the sweet Irish barkeep - Connor - and a good big shot of Tullimorew Dew.  (Sweet and smooth.)

Food is just OK.

Love the witty quotes/sayings on the blackboard that changes every day.

The super be dosa was the size of my 5 year old daughter! The food is delicious and good value. Their special chai was very unique and oddly reminded me a bit of Malaysian pulled milk tea. The tea alone was worth the trip. It's a bit hard to find at first m, but worth seeking out. Staff was kinda and attentive. If you like Dosa... And I do... This is definitely a place to check out! Nolensville Rd is an international cornucopia of delicious places to eat, and dosa hit definitely holds its own!

I've been to Big Bang twice for bachelorette parties.  I'm not a fan of bachelorette parties, bars, or loud music (nerd!) but Big Bang was a good place to go for fun live music. 

On my first visit three years ago in a deal purchased with a Groupon, they played the requests of each person in our party.  That made the evening special.  The staff was friendly and fun.

Another group happened to show up on September 7, the final night Big Bang was open.  It was crowded, bittersweet, and as entertaining as the first time.  It was my favorite place on my infrequent visits to Laclede's Landing, and I'm truly sorry to see it close.

Currently staying here and I felt obligated to write this review after my last two experiences. The hotel is nice. Upon arrival, a man with a wizard like cape will greet you and gather your bags to escort you to check in. The hotel allowed us to check in early without question so that was nice. The room itself is basic and nothing to speak of. THe hotel is undergoing renovations so it has a few places that look undesirable.

The bellhop staff is great and very helpful, Especially, Ebanks. However, the front desk staff is just average. 

Now, to what sparked me to write this interview.. There are no vending machines or microwaves in this building. I am 8 months pregnant and those thins are essential. How can I not be able to buy snacks when I need them? All of he walking you do here, a vending machine is necessary as it is annoying as ____ to have to walk to local stores to get bottled water. Also, there is no microwave available for guests to use. This is major as NOLA is a prime place to eat and staying here, you would not be able to reheat any of the delicious food you purchase. Right now I'm looking at lobster Mac and cheese and stuffed red fish that I cannot eat because there is no microwave. Honestly, this is a major turn off for me and for that reason, I would never stay here again. Obviously, I'm pissed, but for 1200 dollars for two people , I need a microwave. Rant over!

Average food and below average service. Real potential to be great but very poor....from missed orders to extremely long wait times for food (over an hour from drinks order to food order) this is a place with a great location, but seriously lacking anything else....won't be back but should be, missed opportunity form the owners.
Their flat bread pizza's are great especially if you're looking for a big lunch or dinner. I usually get take out.

5 stars for this gem of a place because, it really was as good as it gets!  Had the pleasure of trying out Willa Jean's while on a short stay in NOLA.  My girlfriend had Willa Jean's on her list of places to eat, so we checked it out for brunch.  Construction was going on either next door or upstairs, so the sounds of drills and hammers we could have certainly done without --- even still, the atmosphere was nice, the staff was friendly and the service was quick.  Loved the dcor, cute and contemporary.  I had the country fried steak with sausage gravy on a biscuit...melt in your mouth good!  The seasoning on the batter, just delicious...the gravy, flavorful, and the biscuit...oh man, wish I could've taken a basketful home with me.  My girlfriend had the chicken and biscuit with gravy I believe and she too enjoyed her meal.  All in all, we would definitely return next time we're in NOLA.  Definitely worth a try if you find yourself in the area as well! :)

I am giving this hotel a full five stars, but this was only due to the utterly caring and amazing service we got from Jennifer in the Nicolino's lounge and restraint. She immediately noticed we had a very rough day (awful flights, ruined luggage, given a few occupied rooms, etc. ) and came and talked to us, I ended the conversation telling her that she was the highlight of an otherwise challenging day. It is the honest truth. A person like her, who knows how to treat people in distress, need to be the manager of a hotel. Seriously.

Traveling through town. Wanted to hit a none chain place and this peaked our interest. Me the wife and her dad stopped for lunch. I ordered the chicken sausage special side of Mac n cheese wife ordered the half pulls pork half tri tip sandwich with side of squash. Dad got the pulled pork sandwich with spicy slaw as the side. 

I feel like my chicken sausage was the week meal in the group, it was still good just not like a wow thing. 

I can be a picky person  and really pick the visit apart, but her is what you need to know. 

Service was great
Food was good
Environment was comfortable
Homemade rootbeer rocked. 
The place was clean

Food could have been hotter coming to the table.

3-4 star visit and I can definitely see a 5 star easily possible!

Thanks for the meal!
I had lunch delivered by one of our vendors and he brought us some Carnitas and am latino and i have to say they are juicy and very good highly recommend the carnitas.

My husband and I went to a paint your pet night. We had never done it before and had a great time. Kelly, the instructor was nice and very helpful. It was a nice, relaxing and comfortable environment. We liked it so much, we have signed up to do another class.
Great selection of clothing, if you are having trouble finding what you are after the staff can always locate it for you.
Best breakfast in town!  Huge portion sizes and prices you can't beat. A fun, down home, old fashioned diner... be prepared to get your grub on. My husband and I love this place

My wife and I are on our honeymoon, and were craving crab legs. We spent a good bit on yelp trying to search for good places when she came across this place. Casual atmosphere, decent prices. We got a booth, and the side I sat on there was a big pillar and made it annoying to get in and out. Our server forgot my soda order, it was 9:00 PM And maybe six people total there. Aside from that the snow crab legs we ordered were amazing. So good! The fries were nuked and dried out. The potatoes were questionable so we passed. For three lbs between two of us and two sodas came out to $60. Great place for laid back dinner and great crab legs. Would go back for the legs for sure.

I have never had a worse experience with a tshirt company. They could not get the design that I wanted exactly, but I thought it would be okay due to their cheaper pricing. It is cheap for a reason, I came in to pick up my order after I called last night and they said it would be ready today. I called then this morning and they said it would be ready in ten minutes. Two hours later I stopped by to pick it up and the vinyls aren't even at the store. The store manager, jess, did not apologize once she just said she didn't know where the mix up happened. I'm now leaving town for an event with no tshirts and have to drive back when they are ready. They are extremely unprofessional and I will never purchase here again.
The wings are the best.  Not greasy and medium is pretty hot. The flavoring is sort of a hot pepper taste with BBQ to me. I never feel ill or greased out and eating too many of these wings.

Great place to meet friends for a meal, and maybe some darts....batting cages...or a game of pool? (There are also a few other old school games that are more arcade like).   This place has regulars...and that makes it OK in my book.  :-). The food is good, and the service is excellent...but honestly...its the dive bar, sports bar kinda feel that has me smitten. 
Pictures on the wall....classic rock on the jukebox...and games that grown up kids love to play.   Great friends, good food, cold beer...excellent memories.   Give this place a try if you live here...or are visiting.

A good sunset happy hour! Mia our server ,was  thoughtful, Friendly and efficient. She made the night. We had a few beers and margaritas. The chard-boiled oysters and meat pies delicious! The shrimp cocktail was not local Shrimp so not great. The Shrimp scampi was ok. We will be back

This was a culinary experience worth the trip to Nashville!! 
We sat at the bar with Damon I think it was. He was very knowledgeable, and took time to make sure we got everything we wanted. 
The hummus app was outstanding, with just enough chile oil to bring a zest to the otherwise blank canvas of the pita. 
For vegetarians, the chicken fried cauliflower is a must!! I would not miss meat at all if every veggie dish were that delicious!!
I got the $55 steak w fries, and I was not disappointed!! Perfect medium rare, and the homemade steak sauce is so damn good even the most hardcore beef lovers wont be mad you used it!! 
The German chocolate dessert was a perfect ending as we split it, leaving us each full but not regretful. 
My friend had Damon do a coupe of cocktails and he perfectly matched her drink to her meal. 
We loved our evening at this bar!!

I was honestly stressing about who to hire for my photographer for my wedding, and couldn't have been more happy about choosing JW Photography. The pictures came out so well and I get so many compliments to this day! Thank you for taking so many amazing pictures!

A few weeks ago I ordered a hoagie it looked great the bread was stale I looked at the bottom and it was covered in mold. Don't eat there it's not sanitary no one wears glove. The cook went to smoke at the back door came back and immediately started preparing food without washing his hands avoid this place at all cost.

Very thankful for Dean's service and speed during this Thxgiving week. When we needed a urgent service call (w/ high winds & 40 deg. weather) their receptionist was helpful and speedy fast throughout scheduling, and Daniel and Eddie stopped at our place for 30 min. at the end of their long day.  The result - they provided tips/knowledge about our unit, assured us they could come again if needed tomorrow, and best of all got the furnace working consistently.  I'll definitely contact Dean's again in the future.

Food wasn't bad but I didn't get a great chance to enjoy it because it took almost an hour for my BLT to come out. The server was very nice and helpful, but that long of a timeline for a sandwich seems excessive.

Des boules de glaces gnreuses pour un prix tout  fait correct. Les parfums sont trs diversifis ce qui permet de satisfaire tout le monde.
Dans la boutique ? Plein d'autres sucrerie dont des pommes trempes au caramel, du riz souffl tremp avec topping, les fameuses pralines et surtout de gnreuses parts de fudge fait maison sous le regard des clients.
Je recommande cet endroit pour une oause gourmande et rafrachissante sous la chaleur de la Nouvelle-Orlans.

Oh my goodness this salad place is heaven! There are so many great ingredient offerings and unique, flavorful dressing offerings as well. I loved creating my own salad and putting in a bunch of different tasty toppings, and having them chop them all up to yummy bite sized pieces. These salads are huge and filling too- easy for those with big appetites to stay healthy! My favorite dressings were the lemon tahini and chile hatch ranch. I will have to try some more dressings next time!
The perfect answer for brunch any day! Family run, wholesome place with awesome brunch options, including rotating seasonal menu.
Went to my first complimentary session. Josh and staff as well as location are awesome. Looking forward to my next visit.

I love this place. Today was my second time ever being at a Five Guys. Both the regular and little burgers are huge. The fries are really good and no matter what size you get. You get a lot of fries. My family also loves this place. We'll definitely go back

I've never had Japanese food before, well maybe a few pieces of sushi, so going to this restaurant was a real eye opener! I immediately loved the atmosphere of this restaurant, it was very calm and classy and the servers were incredibly responsive and professional. 

Although afterwards it was clear I was not a fan of Japanese food, I still had a wonderful time. It helped that I was with great company but in addition, the atmosphere and impeccable service. 

If you're a fan of Japanese food, or would like to try it out, this is the place to do it. The prices are also quite reasonable and the amount of food provided is impressive.

Love me an Amanda cut...Seriously, she listens and will give you the precision cut that you ask for...and I have that impossible to cut super thick hair...really does a beautiful job and is the only stylist in the history of my 50 year life who knows how to blow out hair properly. This salon is super accommodating, too:-)

I really like this concept. The menu is focused and the ingredients are high quality. Its a great alternative to typical "fast food" and I really like the fancy soda fountain as well. I've only been in here twice but every time the service has been good and friendly.

Why didn't I know about the Rib Cook Off before???  This year was my first time going and you better believe I'm going every year from now on!  We stayed at the Nugget so our backyard was the Rib Fest.  We arrived Friday morning which was the best idea because we were able to walk the whole festival with ease.  There were some people but it wasn't as bad as Friday night and Saturday which are the busiest times.  We had ribs galore (my personal favorite was Bone Daddy's - marinated perfectly, bbq sauce had a little bit of heat to it and the meat was falling off the bone good!), beef ribs, corn, cornbread, cole slaw, beans, ice cream, deep fried zucchini, funnel cakes and beer!  It doesnt get better than this but I'm definitely detoxing all the meat consumption still.
