We woke up Saturday morning went downstairs to buy more ribs and brought it into our hotel because the crowd was approaching.  Sunday we also went early to buy a full slab of ribs to take home.  It says they open at 11am but we went down at about 10:30 and were able to get our orders in.

I'm coming back next year and I'm sticking to the same game plan.  Arrive early Friday until Sunday and staying at the Nugget.  Can't wait for you to come back Rib Fest! Yummmm!

Stopped in tonight for my wife's and mine annual birthday dinner. We have been here several times before. Tonight's off menu surf and turf was exceptional. Service from Mary was excellent.  Fillets cooked to perfection. Salads, sides and desserts outstanding. Definitely a repeat. Fleming's has lost a customer.

Love this place!  My husband and I went here once several months ago and then again recently with out 3 year old. Both times were great experiences. This is a little place run by a husband and wife - he cooks, she serves. They are very friendly, while my husband and I were checking out the menu, the owner came out with a little plate that he'd created a food face on for my son. It was very cute. 

The service is prompt and excellent. We've only had breakfast there, so I can't comment on lunch options, but I can say that everything we've ordered is very good. I had the Hash Mountain once, and the breakfast bowl another time, my husband had biscuits and gravy, and Sausage Mountain. They have great toast too! If you're looking for a good, hearty meal for a low price, with great "mom & pop" style service, this is definitely the place to go!

We went to Katie's on a busy Friday night.  Fortunately, we had reservations because the wait when we arrived was over 1-1/2 hours.  I would say on the weekends reservations are a must and perhaps on weeknights as well.  This is a very popular place for modern, creative pizzas, pastas and other related cuisine.

Ms T and I ordered a Caprese Salad and a Meatball pizza to share.  Our friends the D's did about the same thing, with different salad and different pizza.  They also brought a bottle of good chianti to share.  Katie's will do corkage for $20.

We were both disappointed in the Caprese Salad.  I knew when they placed it on the table that the large, yellow heirloom tomato was way over-ripe.  I could see that it was mushy and it indeed tasted over-ripe in that it had lost its flavor and had no backbone (like an over mature wine that loses its fruit and acid).  This should not have been served.  With good tomatoes, this would have been a good salad.  Again, heirloom or not; local or not, they still have to taste good and have good texture.  I liked the fresh mozzarella but will say the basil was very skimpy on it.  The overall serving was generous, but considering the price, it needed to be.

Our pizza was just OK, not remarkable.  The meatballs are not seasoned much, but the cheese and sauce were good, as was the crust.  The pizzas are probably 10" to 12" and it was easy for the two of us to eat it all, which is something we never do.  I asked for fresh chiles on my half of the pizza and there were not more than  1/2 teaspoon of finely minced chiles serranos that I could see and barely taste.  I paid $2 for that addition.  At least four times as much chile would have been good.

You have to appreciate fru-fru pizzas more than we do to appreciate Katie's.  It is one of those trendy places, popular for being popular, that I expected more from.  This is also an expensive place.  Our bill was $50 for a small pizza, a salad and  1/2 of the corkage.  Ms T thinks three stars over-rates this meal.

Decent Food.  Friendly wait staff.  Waited a while for food.  Pancakes came out cold, but they did reheat them for us.  Seated at a table with wet seats and had to be relocated.  We asked for cheese on our eggs and got no cheese.   Lot a room for improvement.

OK I don't understand why the star ratings so far are so bad if everyone is saying they really liked the food. Maybe the ratings are from competitors?

So here is the REAL blow-by-blow breakdown of this place.

YES it is mobbed. That's because there is a HUGE HUGE HUGE pent-up demand for fast casual Mexican in Tampa, and people are flocking there. After all, let us review our options for fast Mexican food in Tampa Bay: 

1. Chipotle = Sodium-filled food, pre-cooked and later boiled in plastic bags. A digestive nightmare.

2. Tijuana Flats/Moe's = Can't really tell the difference between these crapholes; 
both are substandard Mex joints that would go out of business in California, Texas, etc.

3. Taco Bus = Tasteless food served in cardboard tortillas in a dirty restaurant.YUM!


But back to Lime Fresh:

Do not just show up. Place your order online before you head over there. When you get there, go to the back of the restaurant where the takeout cashier is. Pay for your food there, take it to a table, and eat. This took me 5 minutes. And watch everyone else wait in line for 30 minutes. I had the chicken soft tacos and my friend had the chicken cobb salad. Both were good. Both tasted fresher than any food at the above-mentioned places.
 
Lime Fresh is not the same as Moe's, Tijuana Flats or Chipotle. It is much much better. Is it the best Mexican food you have ever had? NO. Is it authentic Mexican, Cal-Mex, Tex-Mex, etc.? NO. Is it better than the fast food Mexican food in Texas, Arizona, California, etc.? NO. But is it better than Chipotle, Tijuana Flats, etc.?
YES!!!!!!!

The ingredients here are much fresher than at Chipotle and Tijuana Flats, you can taste it. (Well, let's face it, the food from Chipotle comes already cooked in plastic bags, which they later boil.) The execution with some of the meats at Lime Fresh is not there yet, but I am hopeful they will get better with that.

This place is automatically better than the above mentioned places JUST for the extensive salsa bar, which is standard in Cali, Ariz, Texas, etc. but most no one else in Tampa has. And the pico de gallo is pretty decent, as are the other salsas. The menu is extensive, the dining space is nice and huge, the online order process was seamless.

I would def. go back when it's off-peak hours.

Barbara is the best stylist and colorist in the city, hands down.  Aside from being a  master of her craft, she is one of the sweetest women you will ever meet.  I would recommend anyone to her.  Her assistant Nicole is equally as good.  I have been going to them both since they were over at the Bellevue.  I would follow them anywhere.  Bravo!!

A friend and I were walking around Fishtown looking for a spot to get a coffee and chat. So happy we came across this adorable place! The staff were incredibly warm. There were lots of options for treats ranging from cupcakes, cake slices, tarts, bars, cookies etc. So many yummy choices made it hard to choose! I had the Dolce De Leche tart and it was so rich and filling, plus the presentation was beautiful--they clearly put a lot of care into how all of their treats look as well as taste. They have espresso drinks and teas too. I got a small Matcha latte which was actually quite big, so that was a nice surprise. There is a small amount of seating inside but we were able to find a spot. The place is super bright and nicely decorated inside. All around a very cute, clean, welcoming place. Definitely will be back.

I was reluctant to come over at the beginning then loved everything about it. Especially the freedom to create your own salad and pizza. The combo of mini salad and pizza is just perfect for me. And I love the unlimited toppings that you can choose, pretty amazing.

Sports Bar: we have gone here maybe 3x. the first time we went was because it was the only decent bar in the area. when we got there we were not greeted and it took maybe 20 minutes for someone to get our drink orders.i was pregnant at that time and i just ordered iced tea. what i got was not cold and not so good iced tea and it took them another 20 to give us our drinks. on the occasions that we are there the staff is not attentive and would rather chat in the bar area. at one time i was screamed at by a girl who was working the bar... i mean u have super slow service and ZERO customer service at all. if you have to go to this Boston Pizza and if you love their food, go to the family restaurant side.. the wait staff are nice and pleasant and they give average to good customer service depends on who you get. They do accept air miles so that's a positive. they should install accessible doors though for wheelchair users and strollers. a friend went there this weekend and just told us that he is never going back there... and yeah i would advise you to stay away from the bar side...stay far far away. they don't pay attention and they just stand there and chat with each other. the last time we were there the tables were filthy and there weren't very many customers there. there was us and another group playing pool and did i mention the not so clean plates and utensils???their patio?? not clean! common people do u need John Taffer to rescue you?  eeekkk....

Hands down! No more words, want to try some authentic northern Chinese food, Cate zone is the one! So happy there are more authentic Chinese in the area. 

Been here many times, always crowded, be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes to get a table. I'm not sure if they take reservations. And very noisy, definitely not a good for romantic dates.

First time at this local brewery! We tried oolite and porter and they were great. It's a very chill place, will definitely be back. If you're looking for a chill laid back place to drink good beer this is the place for you. Cool dude named brad was very attentive.

First time in any Dollar Tree and won't be my last.

Lots of good bargains and a tremendous variety of merchandise.

Store was maintained better than I expected as there was clearly an effort to keep shelved stocked and aisles from looking cluttered.

Apparently, this used to be a "Deal$" store operated by Dollar Tree where items for slightly above $1 were also available. That would explain the large amount of square footage, but all signs for this location, both inside and outside, clearly show this is now a Dollar Tree.

Also, any store where an employee sees a long line at one register and announces he or she is opening another register to move customers along gets my approval.

I would not recommend parking in the front row of spaces just outside the front door/windows because it can be dicey backing out of those spots when leaving because it is so close to a high traffic entrance/exit to the nearby road. Use the lot away from the front of the store and you can get in and out without any trouble.
My husband and I made the mistake of trying this bar.  Horrible service and unfriendly bartenders :(.  Odd that the manager allows this to happen.  Won't be back.

Candace and Melissa (customer service)

Ordered a part (through Amazon) and received. Unfortunately the part was faulty. After a few attempts I did speak with Candace in CS. I explained and she agreed, stating she would have another part shipped to my attention.
Received the replacement and it seems to be without any defects.
Very pleased with the customer service.

I had a awesome time Skyler our tour guide was great. Took us all over and let us do what ever in a safe manner. Jon was great to he got me all checked in told me everything i need to know about the safety and all about the jet ski. I will highly recommend this place to my friends.

Actually the location on street State Street has improved, but FEDEX delivery in general the is the worst, the worst delivery service. Their app doesn't work at all. Unlike UPS  whose drivers are unionized and excellent drivers because they have to work at a location facility before they become drivers Fedex hires anybody that can walk and talk. Because I am handicapped I have special needs but they are totally ignored by Fedex drivers. I've had shipments put in my yard on top of my chaise lounge which is seven steps down.  You can no longer call any of their facilities directly. They have totally done away with all the phone numbers and then when you do get someone on the phon, their 800 number which is a joke you wonder how they find their way to work.  

This company is still independently owned and the owner has set this up to benefit himself. All the trucks are leased through third parties; he does not own any of the trucks at all. Smart for him, too bad for us. 

I currently have a lawyer looking at a lawsuit because living in California and being handicapped I should be protected from businesses that can't deliver my 
packages where I can get them safely.  

I have requested from Amazon not to use FedEx at all for my deliveries because they just can't seem to get their act together.

Finally made it here and I am very happy with my experience. Keri gave me all of the information that I needed to know. IT is great to know that in a major city there are places like this where you can relax and center yourself. I cannot wait to float more often. 

Just be sure that if you have any cuts, dry skin, or scratches that you put on plenty of the petroleum jelly they provide. If you need more just ask. The salt will get into it and make it uncomfortable.

This is the best dentist I've ever been to in 30 years . For the first time in my life my mouth was really numb and I felt no pain during the process. I highly recommend this Dentist, he listens to your concerns and makes sure you are comfortable. The staff is very nice and considerate and help you feel comfortable.

I came to Mahony's with my friends for Brunch one Saints Sunday. When we got there it was a little packed but it was to be expected because it was brunch time on Magazine and it was gameday. It didn't take us long to be seated. When we got there we walked in and took out seats. Our waiter was really cool. Beware super friendly and nice. I ordered a roast beef poboy. Yeah, interesting choice for brunch. But i didn't mind. I really wanted something hearty and it was a poboy spot so why not. I must say, the food was really delicious. I loved every bite of it. Not to mention, we had bottomless mimosas. That's literally one of my favorite things about brunch to be honest.

Coming from South Korea and having been to Japan ramen has a special place in my heart. I was very excited to find that Tucson had an actual Ramen establishment. So I had been told that the wait here is pretty bad and not to go during the peak hours. Wellll I went on a Saturday mid morning and I'm sure the number of hungover college kids getting breakfast and the super proactive families getting lunch definitely added to the wait time. The door says to wait in line and they will get our names. It also says that some Yelper thinks it's a stupid system. Well yeah IM AGREEING WITH THAT OTHER YELPER. Like a good law abiding citizen our party of three patiently wait infront of the restaurant waiting for them to "come get our name".  I notice people who just drove up (also party of 3) walk in and a few moments later walk out. So I'm like ok maybe they were told to go back out and wait. Then this same thing happens again with a different party of 3. I follow the second group inside only to find out they were getting their names put on the list. At this point I'm just over everything and just want my damn ramen since I've been waiting for no reason for 25 mins already. I finally get our names put down and then another 25 minutes, and those two other parties of 3, later, we get called. Ordered Takoyaki (tastes great but just wish it had a LITTLE more octopus in it) also got the Black garlic oil Tonkatsu Ramen ( got everything on the side because I knew I would finish it all and didn't want my noodle to get all soggy if I wanted to eat the left overs/ broth was super refreshing and the chashu pork was delicious. The tamago for ramen is definitely supposed to be soft boiled and as someone who thoroughly enjoys YOLK PORN I was sadly disappointed. It was just a hard boiled egg sat in soy sauce for a short time period). Hubs ordered the Umami Shoyu and he said it was very tasty. Will be going back but screw waiting outside for them to "come get you".

TE freaking AMO! I can without a doubt say I've never in my life tasted anything like it.... nor will i probably ever. 
It was so trendy and cute! It will be my first stop when I return back to Tampa for sure!

I waited in the emergency room for over 3 hours without seeing a doctor. They were not busy. In that time they stuck an IV in my arm and told me I couldn't leave a specific part of the waiting area because drug addicts come in to get IV's all the time. Extremely offensive and unprofessional. They also took a urine sample for labs, not needed to treat my condition. Basically this hospital is racking up dollars on completely unnecessary treatment for profit. 2 hours in I was told I would be seen next. An hour after that, I left. I arrived at Hendricks regional and was treated and discharged in 50 minutes. IU west should be investigated for insurance fraud at the very least.

They did a GREAT job catering our Christmas dinner on Saturday night! Prime rib and salmon choices, all done to the right requested temperatures. Excellent side dishes, amazing desserts, and service was perfection. Restaurant all to ourselves, nicely decorated, and appropriate background music to add to the festive atmosphere. Priced just right too!

Wow! This place has it going on. NOICE! High end everything. Blantons on the shelf - thank you! You get what you pay for - enjoy your earnings here! Manager Kenny running house in there, everyone is always on their game; A+ team all around!

EVERYTIME I go through their drive thru it takes FOREVER!  Their food is almost worth with wait but don't go there if you're in a hurry or starving!  If you go inside it's a better experience. But again it's probably going to take you the same amount of time if you choose to go inside or through the drive thru.  Also should note, there is never anyone else in line at the drive thru, so how does it take SO LONG?!?!

I was able to call tonight and with 45 minutes notice was able to bring a party of 20 on a Saturday night. The food was very good especially given the variety of what people wanted. Courtney,our server was exceptional and always in good humor. I've liked fletchers but tonight's accommodation and food makes it my favorite in Belleville.

Had the opportunity to visit on Sea food night. Its a little pricey when compared to buffets in town but the few I have tasted in Reno do not compare to Toucan's. I would like to try a different night, this is not a large buffet though they offered various seafood choices from lobster ravioli to, seabags, salmon, 5 kinds of shrimp. I would like to have seen sushi at least some basic rolls. Desert sets this place apart from cotton candy, ice cream to cake that is not dried out. We ate early at the opening which may have contributed to this but for the city of Reno is I want a buffet this is probably it.

this place is 5 stars in the  you get what you pay for and what you are expecting category. 

ok  first off the drinks and the food is fairly priced. you usually do not have to wait for a table.  the wait staff is attentive and the service is good. they seat big parties and do not have problems splitting bills or taking my multiple restaurant . com coupons i'm always using.  

secondly they have all types of vegan options, clearly labeled on the menu. 

third they have KARAOKE that is so much fun!   seriously try it out. 

this place isnt fancy, it isnt trendy, it isnt high brow BUT it is affordable, comfortable, fun and a GREAT place to go if you want to have a nice dinner and dinks with friends

First time I have visited Maggiano's.  It was my cousin's birthday, and this is her favorite restaurant. 

As soon as we met the group at the bar, the pager sounded.  They led a group of eight to a table that barely fit six.  We refused to sit there, and were told we would have to wait for another table. We had reservations.

I went to the bar for a beer for my wait.  I was second in line at an empty bar.  After assuring me he would be just a second then skipping over me (cash in hand) to help two other patrons who just walked up, I finally got my beer fifteen minutes later.

For the price, I expect better service that we were offered that night.  The food was just average.  

I would not return, as there are far better Italian restaurants in town (Buca, Vito's, even.....dare I say it.... Olive Garden)

This would be our fourth year staying at this facility, and the atmosphere is pleasant and the staff poolside is great, however, beware of room service. We ordered 2 burgers from the menu and we're charged 3 service charges....unbelievable! Do not order food to your room for charges that even staff agreed was absurd.

Very nice place.  The prices are great.  The bonus of a free shoulder/neck massage is delightful.  The manicures and pedicures are close to perfect!   Good idea to call ahead for an appt. although walk-ins are definitely accepted.

I didn't end up buying anything at this store, but they have a good selection and their employees are nice and helpful.  I was looking for a pair of Merrell Pure Gloves, but they didn't stock anything like that.  They do have a good selection of supportive shoes and the more minimal styles.  I would definitely consider going back next time I need a pair of running shoes.

This tiny coffee shop is a unique little treat on the Westbank.

If you pull up to the drive thru in the morning, you will see a long line; but not to worry, they handle their lines well. Even in the cold, the baristas meet you at your car to take your order. Inside the shop (if you have the time), you are surrounded by coffee drinking locals, local art, and great conversation.

Not the best place to go to study or work but it can be done after their morning rush.
Great taste of the Caribbean.... Nice hang out spot will definitely come back when am in town.... Happy hour is a blast
Food was soggy and fries had no flavor. Overpriced for no reason! $6.95 for a tasteless cheese burger doused in grease. Not worth the wait or the money.

This Applebee's was a mess. It was a Saturday night and hardly busy, and I see why. We went for the dollar drinks and some appetizers. We were there for two hours and got three drinks -- not for lack of finishing them, but for lack of our server checking on us at all. By the time we got our third drink there were 3 sets of empty glasses on the table because she never took anything back. Dirty plates sat on our table from when we finished our food until when we left. We even turned the call server light on in hopes of getting her attention. That was a waste as she walked past three times without paying attention. When confronted, she told us she had been waiting the tables outside but we were sat by the window and could see that she had not been out there. We had been anticipating a fun night out and dollar drinks to celebrate a new job, but we were thoroughly let down.

Ice cream you scream we all scream for a ice cream!!  

Driving back from Florida, we decided to make a stop in New Orleans to explore for an hour or two before we got back on the road.  It is very rare that I indulge in desserts, but when we walked inside this place the smell was so heavenly, I knew that I HAD to order something....

I could have gone for one scoop in a bowl, but no.  I opted for 2 scoops, one butter pecan and one cookie monster...In a waffle cone.  I ate every last drop.  It was so....creamy.  And delicious.  Found a cute little bench outside and sat in the sun until it was gone.  I felt like five million dollars when we got back on the road.....Until my sugar high wore off at which point i couldn't keep my eyes open and was in desperate need of a nap!  But it was SO worth the hour detour.  I will not hesitate to stop back by here next time I'm driving through!

I thought the food was great and the service was excellent. We were greeted right away by the hostess and by the girl who was going to be taking care of our table. As soon as she saw we had a toddler she offered a highchair. I am not a sushi person so I cannot speak for the sushi but I tried a variety of different things and I was pleased. And so was my husband.
Best McDonald's in the USA. Great Staff & Management. My family spends at least $100/ mo at this McDonald's location. Always courteous and accommodating when going thru drive-thru.

A Co-Worker recommended Frankie's Chef Salad for Lunch and I am so glad.  It is GREAT!.  The meat is thin sliced so you get the essence throughout the salad.  It even comes with carrot slices and celery slices, black olives and pepperoncini (sp). Their luncheon specials which are faxed to our office daily, come with chip and drink of your choice.  AND they deliver! ! !  A great idea for the "captive audience".

I wish I could give this place 0 stars. Actually, the 1 star is fine because I like their concept of allowing customers to interact with the animals, but nothing else is good here. This place was  just a pet store, where it was obvious the puppies came from puppy-mills or money hungry backyard breeders. Now it's still that pet store, but it's also a rescue. DCSPCA should collect their animals.

I came a few times in search for a pet for myself and another time with a friend, who actually purchased a guinea pig. Each time I came here, some animals seem to need a lot of attention, even medical assistance. I always felt sorry for this one guinea pig that looked very sickly. It sits in the  center of the "communal" food bowl of the guinea pig enclosure and just eats, constantly as if it's in a trance. I pet the poor thing and could feel its bones, which means it's malnourished, but it's been eating nonstop each time I've been there.

My friend purchased a rescued guinea pig. It came with a very large cage, and she had purchased the bedding and food. She had a lot of questions about maintenance and the workers were eager to answer her questions. They also gave great suggestions on products to use, until one worker helped us load the animal and its supplies into my friend's car. As we were all walking to her car, my friend asked about the amount of attention and interaction she should give it, the worker replied, "I didn't want to say it in there because I would get in trouble, but you don't need to give it that much attention. You just have to feed it and things like that." Umm, isn't that still cruelty? Guinea pigs are very social creatures and absolutely love attention. He also suggested to not use that much bedding to cut costs, but that would still leave the guinea pig exposed to the hard plastic of the cage. If you have to skimp on the proper pet supplies, then you can't afford a pet.

When we got the guinea pig home, I cleaned out it's cage. The cage was GROSS. There was dried waste caked around the sides and was very hard to get up, which is obvious that the cage was rarely cleaned. It took quite sometime to scrub it properly. The bedding was soaked in urine and the water bottle was completely empty. I refilled the water and the guinea pig began drinking immediately for a long time, which means it was very thirsty. It also seemed very proud of its newly cleaned surroundings.

The other animals such as the rats, mice, rabbits, ferrets, cats and reptiles appeared to be well cared for. The dogs were well-cared for, too. I saw the workers taking the rescue dogs out for walks, which is good. The only thing I would say is that they should clip some of the older dogs' claws,  because they are overgrown. Then again, some rescue dogs have trauma and may freak out when getting their nails clipped so maybe the workers are unable to do it.

I'm also sure that little moon crab for sale was dead. It wasn't moving and it's eyes were sunken in. It looked neglected.

We rented The Narrative Loft for our annual Indy theater awards. The event was a huge success.  The space is very flexible and we were able to seat 100+ people comfortably. We used their family style table as an appetizer table, set up a petite beverage bar, and still had plenty of workable space to take event pictures and for mingling. 

Sarah and Michelle were great to work with. They made setting up the event a breeze. They were also there during the presentation, making sure everything ran smoothly. We cannot thank them enough for their help in such a short amount of planning time. Thank You! and our staff is already racking our brains to find the next event we can host there!

-Santa Barbara Independent

So it's a Native American-themed museum.  For those who have been to the Museum of the American Indian in Washington DC for their creative, highly regarded cafeteria, prepare to be phenomenally disappointed.  Whereas many of the offerings at the DC museum seem genuinely Amerindian-derived, the "Southwestern" theme here at the Eiteljorg consists of standard humdrum salads and sandwiches dressed in catchy names like Rio Rancho or Prickly Pear Cactus Salad or Mojave Valley Sandwich (portabella mushroom and cheese).  Yawn.  And even though the menu says they allow substitutions, I asked to substitute chips for something healthy like a fruit cup.  "No substitutions."  What if I'm willing to pay more for it? "No substitutions."

I came at the peak the week day lunch hour, shortly after noon, but it was only about half full.  A line of 8 people was ahead of me to place their orders; it took 10 minutes for me to get to the front.  And then it took 32 more minutes for my sandwich to arrive.  Not even sit-down restaurants can be that pokey and expect to attract a lunchtime crowd.  The Tularosa Grilled Chicken (chicken, cheese, and may--how Native American can you get?) was actually quite tasty.  So were those chips I really didn't want to have--because I generally don't care for chips.  So the food redeems what was an otherwise lousy experience that also made me late for the second half of a conference.  Call me biased.  But honestly, the Eiteljorg from what I recall is actually a stronger, more intellectually demanding Native American Museum than the one in DC--in fact, some people just skip the museum in DC altogether and go just for the food.  But most of us don't keep coming back to museums week after week.  We do, however, go back to good restaurants, and the Eiteljorg strikes out at one of the best opportunities it might have to pull in a little extra revenue.

Considering the location they have a good variety of Korean food on their menu.  The grilled meat combos are a good way to get extra things such as japchae & stews.

The kalbi meat is very good since they butterfly the beef rib.  It's very tasty since it is not too sweet.

Typical nail salon. Had a rushed pedicure and only paid $20. Prob won't go back to that spot bc it is out of my way. Only went here bc we were having massages up the street and they couldn't accommodate all of our pedicures at the same time.

My husband and I are from out-of-town and we were in the mood for some good poutine. This place did not disappoint. He ordered the Smoked Meat Poutine and I got the Sticky Maple Bacon Poutine and they both were DELICIOUS. The fries were hot and crisp, the gravy was delectable, the curds were squeaky, and the meat was sublime. We each ordered the regular size and that was plenty because the plates were HUGE. We also shared the Maple Bourbon Corn Fritters and those were amazeballs!! On top of all of that, the service was awesome! It was a wonderful experience and I hope to come back one day.

Cluttered,  low rent establishment in desperate need of a rehab.  Great variety of low quality international foods. Prices not particularly competitive. Non existing customer service.  Would not refund a $5 fruit preserve that tastes more like sugar and pectin than fruit.  My fault I admitted to tasting the bad preserve. 
I have been going there for 17 years and today will be my last. I remember years ago I had to argue a considerable amount of time with the manager when I tried to return a jar of rancid olives...why didn't I stop shopping there then?!!!

Good luck competing with Trader Joe and Whole foods,  dear Global!
Solid, clean and remodeled Dennys restaurant. Tasty American fare when you want it.  Try the 2-4-6$ menu!  Had 2 eggs, hash browns biscuits and gravy for $4.

Forgot to add a picture before and we DEVOURED everything. It was seriously amazing!! We got 2 sandwiches, the hot one and the one with the Mac and cheese. Both very good. Fried Brussels and cauli tots were out of this world. Highly recommend the Queso dipping sauce. AMAZING

I love this place. The queso gringo is awesome. It's a little pricey, so maybe save it for a night out instead of a "I don't feel like cooking" night. The decor is modern and spacious, the menu is inventive, and the food is made in house! There aren't a ton of options on the menu, but I heavily favor restaurants that have a small menu of things they do really well vs. a novel of a menu of food that's mediocre anyway

I fucking hate this place we were fine at first but then three more parties came in and they completely forgot about us do to the majority of the customer
s being usual people here. It was almost like "1 person, easy, 2 people, OK , 3 people, I need help, 4 people, Jesus hold on ass hole I'm doing something so shut up and wait. Also the usual people are a bit threatening. But the waiter was nice and all they need is so more help. Also on the plus side it's pretty cheap so that's good

The guys at New Era provide excellent customer service and are quick and efficient. One thing I appreciate is they don't talk down to me or try to get over on me because I'm a woman. I go in for what I need, and leave with just that. It took me a while to find a mechanic here in Philly, but I've finally found one.
One of the best places to get taco salads and nachos on this side of town. Their burritos are HUGE. My workmates and I make weekly (sometimes twice weekly) runs for lunch.
My husband and I went this past Wednesday and the food, service, and prices were great!! Will be back soon and often!
Great service. Dr Chang was fantastic!! Her technician is awesome!! Very comfortable setting. Very little discomfort during the preparation of a new crown. This is our new dentist from now on.

I REALLY enjoyed the tour! Brian was our guide and he did such a great job of telling our group about the hauntings in New Orleans. He kept us all engaged and taught us so much! Whether you believe in ghosts, vampires, zombies, or not you will learn so much interesting history of New Orleans! Do not pass this up! It was the highlight of our trip!
Great selection of clothes and furniture. So organized and clean and the staff is outstanding! Will be returning soon!
Good pizza, great thin crust. Service was much too slow. Waited almost an hour for our pizza.

Only giving three stars because they forgot to give me an item I ordered and also messed up my order (I realized this before I left) and it was a very simple take out order. I didn't have time to go back so I was out money on the item I ordered. The employees were all so rushed so it's no wonder they forgot my item and messed up but also my fault for not realizing I guess... I'll still be back because the food is good but I'll just have to double check I get everything I order!

It's a clean, quiet little salon on the West Bank that I will definitely be back to when I have time to beat the CCC Bridge traffic. If you're a fan of OPI (which I am), they have a pretty decent nail polish selection: mostly basic pinks, reds and darks. They didn't have my favorite colors Chocolate Mousse and Nomad's Dream, but I settled with some other similar colors. The staff is really pleasant and had no issue adjusting anything from pedicure bath water to my request for very thin, natural looking acrylics. 

The biggest con for me was their attempt to do my acrylics while I was still getting my feet done. I can understand if I was in a rush and requested it, but I was just puzzled and told them I would get it done after my pedicure. Of course, I was sad that they didn't have my favorite colors :(

The best thing about this place is the pricing. 50$ for a mani/pedi and acrylic full set. I didn't catch my manicurists' name, but it's the only male there and he was a beast at doing my nails. Made them natural and just how I like them, and did it literally in 30 minutes with no errors. I am obsessed with my almond/oval shaped nails, and everyone is complimenting me on them.
We sat outside on Memorial Day and it was wonderful. Service was prompt and the crowds were less. The food was wonderful.

Can't say enough good things about this place.  Great food at a great price and the staff is amazing.  

Its got the small town vibe diner feeling with amazing coffee!!!   Go here!   You won't be sorry.

Five a stars!! Saji, was able to see me immediately and had my gown altered within days. Now I'm off to my nieces wedding with no worries about my dress. She does great work and the price was great! I will definitely be returning. Thank you so much, Saji!!

Phenomenal food. Cooked and spiced very well. Highly recommend the hummus, batatas, and halabi kebab. Beautiful venue and friendly servers. Their mixed drinks have intermittently had either too much foam or ice, but always taste great. Would highly recommend if in the mood for Mediterranean or Middle Eastern

it's really hard to find a great bagel place in the area that you can just pick up a dozen bagels and cream cheese for some friends after a long night out but newtown bagel is it!

picked up a dozen bagels, so many different kinds which was awesome and also so many different kinds of cream cheese! i personally love their garlic & herb cream cheese, scallion is also delicious. this place is always poppin when i come in so if you have a big order, might be worth it to call ahead.

Why one star you might be wondering? It has nothing to do with the hotel itself. We rented a suite on the 10th floor conveniently located right across from their roof-top bar "Jimmie's Crow Nest" which offers spectacular view of the gulf and the marina and a stretch of downtown. Perfect place to be to experience the wonderful sunsets and they even serve up a free shot at sunset. Yet you absolutely cannot hear a sound once in your room. Room was large with comfortable beds, decent sized bathroom and a small kitchenette area. Hotel located about a 5 minute (tops) walk to the beach and Pier 60. Easy walk to shops, restaurants, bars, etc. Breakfast was okay. Sausage was good. Floppy eggs were strange. Various bread offerings and two toasters. Fresh orange juice. Terrible coffee. I mean, absolutely horrendous. I got up each morning and took a stroll to Starbucks up the street to grab a coffee and then return to have the hotel breakfast. 

Now the reason for the single star. The morning we left, roughly 30-40 minute ride to airport, our driver somehow failed to load one of our suitcases. Not sure how that could have happened, it being the largest of the five suitcases standing there. Nobody noticed until we got to the airport. Luckily nothing of any value in the suitcase. We called the hotel and whoever was at the desk said they'd go down to parking and look and call us back. They did, found the suitcase, and called us back. So far so good. They asked us to call back after 9am to speak with a manager. We would be in the air at that time so said we'd call back around 11am-ish to make arrangements. When we landed we called and asked if they could ship our suitcase back to us - at our expense of course. They said they could not do that. We asked if they could call their local UPS or whoever and have them pick up and ship it to us. They were unable to do that either. Essentially, the hotel refused to assist us in any way to get our suitcase back!  I have to assume that people forget items all the time. Is it then hotel policy to basically say, sorry, not our problem? Cause that's great customer service. They instead instructed us to call a local UPS to have that done. We call a few UPS shops in Clearwater but none of those we called were "official" UPS shops and so would not be able to send anyone to the hotel to pick up our suitcase. We needed to get the suitcase to them. Which the hotel refused to do. We finally got hold of someone at UPS "Official" who recommended we get in touch with someone at FedEx. Which we did. We ended up paying someone $20 to drive to the hotel and pick up our suitcase and take it back to FedEx to be shipped. My wife spent two days on the phone to make this happen. 

If the hotel had been willing to lift a finger, this could have been resolved in an hour. Maybe two. And what would have easily been a glowing 5-star review ends up a 1-star review. Sad.

Chicago Paulies, WHAT A PLACE. such good vibes. funny jokes. Paulie is a good dude who makes great hot dogs. 

My boyfriend Kyle and I recently went to FL for vacation. Our first food stop was Chicago Paulies. It was our first time but saw good reviews.The food was great. The locals seem to LOVE him. We totally get why, Paulie is the heart and soul of that place. He tells it as it is, and has great comedic delivery. Food's great. Local biz. Great dude. We'll definitely come back whenever we're in town.

Pandan chicken and waffles is such a nice twist!!! Who knew that a green waffle and fried chicken are a match made in heaven? So genius to make the waffle with pandan (coconut). The fried chicken is not a flour batter, but something else that makes it so light and crispy. 

The beef stew with noodles is incredible. HUGE chunks of beef and pillowy soft carrots will send you into bliss for a bit. Ease yourself back to reality with the mango/Mexican chili smoothie. Another genius move with the combo. 

The Lemongrass chicken was good, but a bit overrated. I feel that the lemongrass was a bit faint.  Pretty creative to put this Thai twist with a Vietnamese traditional cold noodle, but I'm afraid that it's more "pretty" than tasty. 

Of course, get the sticky chicken wings. I can eat those all day. 

Too bad I live across the country from this place and only have memories and pictures to lean on. Baaaaaaaaaahhhh

Gave this place a try today after reading all the great reviews. The reviews were right! We went it and immediately the smell of the place reminded me of my mom's kitchen. The owner came right over and read us all the specials. We ordered the empanadas (cheese, cheese steak and chicken) and they were delicious. For our entrees we ordered the lunch special : arroz con gandules, habichuelas and chicken stew. It was amazing !!!! Reminded me of my grandmas. The food was good, the service was good and we will be back. I definitely recommend this place if you're craving a nice home cooked Puerto Rican meal.

Underwhelming and overpriced. Pizza Fusion seems to have a lot of hype and a lot of potential but it is poorly executed. I would give them 2.5 stars... most people would round to 3, but I'm sticking to two because my experience wasn't really "A-OK."

Even with a Creative Loafing deal AND a nightly special, I feel like we really overpaid... $27 for a large Do-It-Yourself Pizza alone. How is that possible? This is how: they don't tell you on the menu that the base pizza is $12 (I looked for pricing and there was none). They do tell you that each topping is between $2 and $4 (or more), but you would expect that to be the full cost of the pizza since only those prices are listed, leaving ours at $15 but alas it was actually almost twice that much. Dang! The final product was good, but for that price I can get three equally good take out pizzas. When you add my small white pizza to the mix, our bill was ridiculously high. I do not recommend this place unless you have a CL voucher. They are priced high assuming you will have one. Here is the link: http://www.cldeals.com/products/valid-at-pizza-fusion-downtown-tampa-25-value-2

Want to know something else they don't tell you? The soda is not normal coke product. It's their supposedly organic version, which tastes like a flat diet coke with a whole cup of Truvia added to it... like a previous reviewer said, it's basically cough syrup. They really should tell us this when we order. My "diet coke" was so gross I cringed when I took the first sip and literally could not force myself to get it down. I have never felt that way about any other soda or drink for that matter. Trust me, I know what Truvia tastes like as I use daily it in my shakes and cooking... and I know it's better than aspartame... but this was WAY TOO MUCH TRUVIA! I was so turned off by this product. Yuck.

The service was pleasant but super slow/sparce and we watched as everyone was served before us. As for the food itself, it was alright but honestly not amazing. I wasn't blown away. Also, I ordered the wheat crust and got the regular one on my pizza... didn't make it an issue, but it added to the overall annoyances. 

I really wanted to like this place. I really did. But Pizza Fusion and I are not meant to be. I won't give them good reviews just because they offer gluten-free items.

Summary: okay food, kinda bad service, really bad value, overall a super MEH experience.

This was my favorite part of our trip this past week! We really wanted to do a swamp tour and read through reviews and ended up with Cajun Encounters. We liked the idea of not having an airboat which can be super noisy and windy. 

A few people from our hotel were going to the same tour. The concierge came outside to ask if we were all going and said the bus had called and asked us to meet them elsewhere because it was actually too big to fit down the narrow French Quarter streets! We walked about 3-4 blocks to Canal St. to meet the full size coach bus. (Cajun Encounters offers the pick up service for an extra charge, but it's worth it for ease). 

The first thing I loved was that the bus driver was super friendly, a native of NOLA. A bachelor party was being kind of bro-y in the back and she quickly shut them up with made me want to hug her. She told them the night before they were so bad she'd called the police to have them escort the guys back to their hotel...

Anyway! She asked if we wanted to hear some New Orleans info on our ride down and the majority of us said sure. The ride out to the swamp was about ~40 minutes. She told us about the different areas we were passing through, the graveyards, Hurricane Katrina, stealing crabs as a teenager, etc. etc. She was really enjoyable to listen to. 

We got to the Encounters spot and she gave us very clear directions on how to check in, what will happen, etc. You go inside and show the counter your ticket/reservation/phone receipt and they give you a colored stretchy bracelet (like a livestrong one). That tells you what boat/group you'll be with. We waited outside for about 15 minutes and they started calling all the groups and walking us down to the water. We (and the girls who also came from our hotel) breathed a sigh of relief when the bachelor bros were not on our boat :)

Our boat sat about 25 people - two long bench type seats, each facing outward. We were on the tail end so occasionally we sat on the very front of the boat more up at water level. I don't remember our guide's name but he was informative and funny. On our tour, we saw a few alligators - the guides know where to find some favorites. We also spotted some babies, some cool herons/cranes, A BALD EAGLE SWOOPING DOWN TO CATCH PREY (so cool! So mad I didn't get a photo), and even a baby and adult raccoon! At first our tour was primarily in a wider water area and I thought "huh, not exactly what I pictured as much" but later on in the tour, we went past our boarding dock and went the other way and THAT'S where the swamp I was picturing was. Narrow routes - I'm pretty amazed the boat captains can steer so well to not just hit every tree in the way. A few times he'd just turn the motor off and we'd try to spot critters in the woods. I got the sweetest video of him feeding the adult raccoon - it used its little paws to grab the hot dog! (I may like animals a teeny bit). 

The tour was about 2 hours total. Fantastic. It was fun, relaxing, informative, and friendly - the other people in the boat were all easy going and helped point out cool animals and spots so everyone could get photos. Definitely go to this place if you're in the area! (also look for coupons - I think I saved us $20!)
love the 3 roll lunch special. I order delivery to my office almost every day. You can't go wrong with any of their rolls. It is fresh, flavorful, and fabulous!
A cute spot with excellent ambience. Staff was very friendly and seating is ample enough for a small or big crowd.

Love love this place! Good fresh sushi in a nice atmosphere! It's not extravagant but it's everything you want in a sushi place! It's BYOB, has nice outdoor seating and very nice and polite service staff! We go here often because it's in our neighborhood, it's one of our favorite sushi spots! Their food is creative and tastes super fresh! Their service is on point, the waiter we have is so nice and friendly and always makes good suggestions! You should definitely try it!!

Absurdly good for a chain.  The roasted cauliflower pizza currently sits atop my "favorite foods in the world" list.  We order takeout from here weekly and they almost never make me feel weird about it.  I would love a slightly more expansive salad menu, but other than that, no complaints whatsoever.  The beer is cheap.  Even my picky kids like this pizza.  Just go already.

How do you describe a restaurant which is basically chinese-american but also does good authentic dishes and also has a large vegetarian menu? I can't make up my mind but I can tell you this is a good restaurant to visit if you have a group who wants Chinese food but can't decide what kind. They have all the usual lunch specials and they're very well prepared. They have several more authentic Noodle and rice dishes and some Curry's all of which that I've tried have been good. Their ribs on are the old style large red Chinese ribs... very tasty. And if you're a vegetarian and feel left out there are about 10 to 12 dishes on the vegetarian/vegan menu.

Great place to stop and unwind before next flight . Amazing and knowledgeable staff, great selection of wines (considering it's in the  airport) and awesome food. The lamb meatballs were just delicious, and so was the brie and prosciutto sandwich. Also don't forget to sign up with the app and you get a free tasting!

If you want to know the truth, Parc is the gold standard by which I compare other restaurant experiences.  It never disappoints. Everything on the menu is so perfect that I almost want to cry.  I mean, why can't every restaurant make a simple salad as elegant as what Parc offers.  For that matter, why can't I make a simple salad that is as elegant?  Even the French fries make you regret what you have stuffing in your mouth all these years.  And Philly's deluxe bakeries should be ashamed of what they have been calling a baguette. Save your white bread quota for a visit to Parc and fill up.  I especially love the warm shrimp salad: plump shrimp, slices of avocado that are ALWAYS perfectly ripe, and a beautifully dressed salad.  It's so virtuous you feel like you've earned dessert.  Oh yeah -- and another menu item that brings tears to my eye is the Bloody Mary. Why can't I make something this good????? If you think you have a recipe to rival this one, please please please share it with me.

When your family from Mexico visits, and the first place they want to eat is Baja Fresh... I could live off their salsa bar and be completely happy for the rest of my life. The staff is always friendly and you can easily turn anything on their menu into a healthy salad.

We sat down unsure of what to expect but the end result was without question a terrific meal.  The staff was both welcoming and service oriented.  The meal was brilliantly prepared and  delivered.  A fantastic addition to many of the already great restaurants in the downtown St. Louis area.  Thank you for a fantastic dinner.

once or twice a year, Renown Health sponsors a Jewelry Sale.  This is really high end Jewelry, not the nickle and dime stuff.  I got my girlfriend a nice set of  Peridot and 14k Gold studs for $89.  They had things ranging from the $15-25 range all way way up to $740 Peridot/Diamond earrings.   This is a sale to go to next time it is in town
I love this pizza. The crust is light and thin and the cheese is quite tasty. The status uber friendly too

This rest stop deserves its great Yelp reputation!

First, it's cool-looking from the outside. This is rare for a rest stop.

Second, it's very clean-feeling inside.

Third, it has many, many things, including lots of great vegan options, such as:
    -yummy pasta and tomato sauce, which I got, at the Italian fast food area
   -Starbucks, which has soymilk available for all drinks, such as the coffee I got
   -bean burritos from Baja Fresh, which my friend got
   -Burger King, which is always awesome, b/c it has a veggie burger!

A very nice Tapas bar. Everything is delicious, just need to pick and choose, just be careful, it gets expensive at the end. 
The spicy potatoes and the lamb are great! 
Make reservations in advance (sometime you will need a few days ahead).

This place gets wild for sure but the staff is amazing - They are pleasant and address everyone's needs. I was here a few weeks ago with my two young boys and we had a few bumps in the road over the course of evening with the final one being the most dramatic for my sweet 5 year old. He'd captured a large bounce ball after spending 1500 points to get it out of the giant claw machine (all 10 people in front of us got one on their first try) but nonetheless he came away with a large green ball and was SO proud! Before we could make our exit, he put it down to play air hockey and in less than 20 seconds someone swiped it! I had turned my back for only a moment. Couldn't believe it. I talked to a few people while tears streamed down his cheeks and after a few minutes, a green ball was "found." The young gentlemen and a few of the ladies that helped us were so sweet to him. They turned our night back around fast. We're a few hours away, but we'll recommend to our friends and we'll be back! Treat the staff kindly please!

Food and service from start to finish was exceptional.  When we were added to the waitlist, an update was sent to our phone so we were notified of our status real time.  Our server Jamal was attentive, accommodating and ensured we were serviced promptly.  I've never seen a Manager so connected and engaged at every service point.  I didn't realize Jerry was the Manager until he came to verify our satisfaction with the service and food.  I saw a real servant leader who demonstrated excellent customer service. We traveled from Dallas and found this restaurant on Yelp.  One of the best choices for brunch to date!  Ask for Jerry and Jamal for a great customer service experience.  Oh and the food, was soooooo good even my 9 month old nephew wanted more.
My favorite place to get a cheesesteak in Montgomery County! The chicken cheesesteak is incredible and the service is always friendly.

You know what I really love about these guys? There's no pressure and no bs. They tell you what's wrong and how much it's going to cost and that's that. Their prices are fair and the customer service is top notch! 
And hey - if you're lucky you might get to hear the service guys rocking out the Katy Perry. 
I've been here twice and I'm definitely keeping them.

Located near the Books-A-Million in Embassy Crossing.

I make this the opening line because when I searched on my Waze app for nearby post offices, it directed me to a delivery location, not a retail outlet where one can make purchases and send mail.

Typical post office with long lines. But the people were friendly, and got my stuff shipped.

Same as other reviews SUCKERED in with coupon in and out after a almost $600 upcharge then he said oh i did not know you wanted coil cleaned  even after we went back and for for 15 minutes on prices, and  after calling someone a few times and still at stupid FEES , and NOW WANT'S and additional $ to do what he was supposed to in first place 129  it is just like the Chimney SCAMS UP NORTH had a tiny 6 to 8 ft whip how in heck is that supposed to clean a 20 ft dryer vent  or ANY LENGTH OF AC DUCT  , BS SHOW  with vacuum , more like a CIRCUS ACT then anything else
Just so so. Cold food and dry.  I had a number one.  There are too many great Mexican places in town to come back. But the location makes it popular.
Marlon was our DJ last night and had everybody up and dancing all night long! He made my daughter's wedding flow right on schedule while making sure everyone had fun!

This place is amazing! We went there for brunch and the corn grits and potatoes were so good! I also had the bottomless mimosas. Our server Angie was very attentive and made us feel like home. We met the manager Tasha who really made our experience in New Orleans one to remember! She provided the best customer service I have ever experienced in my life. Our host Angela and bartender Steve were also great! We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to New Orleans.

Had such a delicious breakfast this morning... Cant wait to come back!!!
Tried lots of new places on our visit to clearwater this trip and excited to make this place a regular visit when we are in town...
Yummo!

My experience was  good. I was asked if I wanted "medium" or "hard" - and of course I said "hard" because I had some areas in my back that needed unknotting. I was very relaxed afterwards. Next time, however I will say "Medium" - because I had one or two moments during my session- I had difficulty breathing from the pressure of her crawling on my back..well I did say "Hard" - I would go back for sure ... be well hydrated before you start..

The building says 'Lifetime Warranty' but don't count on it. Tint bubbled and started falling off after a year. Not only will they not honor the warranty, they want to charge extra to remove the bad tint they installed. Poor customer service from manager.

Five stars isn't enough for this team - Pete C and Billy F. I scheduled an appointment with ARS to replace my Air Conditioning System. They came on time, were very polite and professional, and talked to me about what they would be doing as the work progressed. Actually, I was amazed at what a great work ethic they both exhibited, and how much they liked working at ARS. That gave me more confidence in the product they were installing. They finished and cleaned up everything, packed up the trash, etc. and talked to me about what to expect. I was so comfortable with this experience--Thank Pete and Billie!!!

We stopped at Milk and Honey 7/8/19. The service was amazing they staff did a great job keeping everything moving despite how crowded the place was. Our waitress Laurie was extremely cordial and hospitable with great knowledgeable of the menu. She gave great recommendations on what to order.. the food came out fast and looked/ tasted amazing. Laurie was also nice enough to take time to write down places in Nashville my friend and I should check out. This restaurant had good service all around.. I will be returning!
Yummy breakfast all day menu and great lunch options for everyone meat eaters vegetarians and vegans alike. Great Pride menu specials as well
Good food, love that they have Vegan options. Cool atmosphere. Service and staff could be friendlier.

Maybe their food is great, but I'll never know. DO NOT USE DELIVERY. I ordered through their chosen app, Eat24. Apparently the restaurant never confirmed the order, so while I sat waiting for my order for over an hour, the restaurant never made the order. I was not contacted by either Eat24 (until well past the delivery time) or the restaurant (never contacted). So while I tried to figure out what was going on, the Eat24 people were impossible to get in touch with (sat on hold for 20+ minutes, messaged, texted, emailed, no response), the restaurant itself put me on hold and never got back to me. So, over an hour later, it's 9 PM and past the delivery times for most restaurants in the area. So much for an easy dinner.

Shopping can be exhausting. It's so convenient to have s NOLA favorite in the mall to stop for a cafe au lait to give you just enough energy fir the rest of your shopping extravaganza! It's also a great spot for tired dads to plant themselves so they have enough strength to tote the bounty back home. I'm sure, instead of following g you around holding all your bags he'd be just as content, perhaps thankful enough to throw some more dough your way! We all know that he can't sit at a bar and wait, who would drive?

Cute, clean cafe with a limited but well curated selection of sweets/snacks and drinks with good amount of seatings. 

Our table got a slice of orange olive oil poppy seed cake, chocolate pretzel, orange/pineapple juice, tangerine juice, and coffee. 

Staff who helped us was excellent! 

Everything we ordered was tasty but what really stole the show was the orange olive oil poppyseed cake: so moist and just sweet enough, generous portion. Lots of poppyseed. I only wish the olive oil taste was stronger but it was still very enjoyable. Get this!

I love this store! Everyone is extremely nice and helpful, but not too helpful where it's obnoxious. They don't always know where things are, but hey I get it. It's a big store and things are constantly moving around for different seasons and new trends. If you have ever worked in retail you'll understand. They are very helpful at the register and also fast and efficient. People don't give them enough credit. The majority of my wardrobe is from H&M and I have never had a problem with items fading or shrinking in the washer and dryer. The store is usually very clean, sometimes it gets a little messy on busy days, but they can't stop customers from throwing things on the ground and messing everything up. I feel like they are constantly cleaning up after the customers. Alot of the customers need to learn some manners and has some self respect. And they need to know how to treat things with care, ESPECIALLY if you DON'T OWN THEM. I LOVE this store. Definitely check them out!!

Got the Mac Daddy and the cheese bacon dish was to die for. They even take the bread from the center of the bread bowl and but garlic butter on it to have with the dish, must eat when in SB. They have really other good stuff like pizza bowls too
My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed a meal while overlooking the beautiful river. The service was excellent, the food was delicious and the atmosphere warm and inviting.

Loved this place. Found it on Yelp, stopped in for brunch. Sat right down. Waitress wasn't overly friendly, but was efficient and nice enough. The food was fresh and delicious. I had a breakfast croissant. Subbed bacon for ham- no problem at all. Had the breakfast potatoes. It was all really good. I know what you are thinking. "Sounds pretty basic, can't really mess that up" oh, but believe me, you can. People mess it up time and time again. There were some fresh greens and sliced tomatoes to add a little brightness too. Hubs ordered a grilled chicken sand which, cooked fresh to order- it looked really good. I heard no complaints. Coffee was good and refilled promptly. Honestly, this has been my best food experience in awhile!

I was looking through the YELP reviews trying to find something interesting to try.  I  stumbled onto "Chef Ron's Gumbo Stop".  I think my search was focused on corny names.  Anyhow, based on the good reviews, we stopped in on a Saturday evening.  Easily the best decision I made all week.

The food was awesome!

The "Stop"  is located in a strip mall just north of the I-10 Causeway cloverleaf.  There is a well lit sign on the east side of the cloverleaf.  If you are coming from I-10 you have a choice, You can make an illegal u-turn, dive into the right lane and pull up to the front of the restaurant.  The faint of heart can make a legal left turn, make the next two lefts and pull right up next to the strip mall .

This is a relatively small place.  Maybe 20 seats, a couple more at the bar. Decor stretches the boundaries of eclectic.....  We obviously missed the dinner rush, I think maybe 3 - 4 people were seated when we arrived.  We sat right next to the mermaid.  

Service was quick and friendly.  Someone I assume is Chef Ron was out a couple of times to check on us.  Nice, polite but not clingy - no war stories or life histories.  Interesting that he assumed we were from out of town (must be worldly demeanor and classic good looks).  When he found out we were from Destrehan, he commented that "he loved to get locals in".

Down to the food - nothing short of great.  All the reviews raving about the seafood gumbo is absolutely accurate. The turkey wrap was enormous and stuffed full of real turkey.  My real find was the potato salad.  This is the best potato salad I have had in New Orleans.   

$50 for 2 including drinks and tips.  I'm excited about going back and trying some of the other sides.

Who are you kidding?  In the world of Taquerias, Cuca's is as good as it gets.  And, let me tell you, it is the call of home when I have been abroad.  

Years ago I lived around the corner, back when the century started with 19--.  They opened and have steadily honed their craft.  There is nothing special about the old revamped Foster's Freeze building, and do not let the fresh meat grocery smell fool you.  You are going to love it!  Yes, the burritos are Gi-normous, and cheap, and you can get rocked by the Torta plate, but let me share two secrets with you.  Order the Nachos...cause they do not get any better, and snag one of those plastic squeeze bottles of Green Salsa before you sit and feast.  

Nachos, considered to be a holy grail food by my friend and I are the best you can find.  Crisp chips, cheese for days, quac, scream, and we say the most chicken you can imagined plied high.  Squired with the salsa verde, you will go away fat and sassy, wondering when you will be hungry enough to come back and do it all over again.  

Are you on a budget?  Cuca's is the place.  A burrito can be at least two meals.  One more mention, I know this was not the choice of the late great Julia Childs, but only because she was not aware of it yet.  If you like Mexican cuisine, try the rice.  Who ever came up with their recipe, your are a wizard!  I know I mentioned the Salsa Verde before, but let me tell you, it inspired me to go home and figure out how to make it myself...it is that good!  Kudos Cucas!  Stay the course.

This place gives me a boner. Jose Garces, I hope you're reading this. I got the tasting menu here and I almost died, not only because of the sheer volume of food I took in, but also because it was so mind-blowingly good.  I would recommend something specific to get, but I'd just as easily recommend everything.  If anyone ever comes to Philly and doesn't eat here, they are messing up, real bad.

A nice spot to get a refreshing drink whether you need to rehydrate from walking around the mall or escape from the summer heat or just need to get your boba drink fix. This place use all fresh fruits for their drink which I'm willing to pay a few quarters more instead of artificial powders like other places.  I recommend stopping by for their avocado smoothie with 20% sugar, since I'm trying to cut down on my sugar intake, but pretty much everything on their menu is good. Staffs are very friendly so that's a plus. The only downside is that there are no seats around this place since it's a mall kiosk spot but no big deal. Will be my go to place for smoothies and boba drinks in the mall area.

We stopped here for a casual drink one evening, and even though it was ridonculously HOT in the place (it was November), I really liked it.  The loungey-ness, the conversations with strangers in the bathroom, the uber-friendly - dare I say professional? - bartender, and the fizziest club soda this side of the Mississippi (er...which side was I on at this point...?)

The crowd was low-key, and if we hadn't been all up for craziness for the evening, I'd have stayed longer.  A good spot just to hang out.

Our large group of nine came in for dinner and they could not handle it. Three of our party opted for AYCE, and the rest of us ordered various rolls and bento boxes. While my rolls were arbitrarily one of the ones that came out fast, it seemed like most people's orders fell by the wayside and/or were forgotten in lieu of those of the AYCE-ers. Two bento boxes and a veggie roll took literally about an hour to come out, and only after walking up to the counter to inquire about the orders and multiple check-ins with our waiter. They clearly need to organize the ordering process better in general and/or reprioritize non-AYCE orders above AYCE orders; since naturally AYCE orders continue over a long period of time, it is a bad idea to wait for a lull in that in order to prepare food for others in the same group. The sushi was decent, but I am turned off from coming back again due to the inconsistent and slow service.
This place was great . Had the filet , and it was cooked perfect . Enjoyed every bite. The service was great, they were on top of everything and very friendly.

Had a great day. Beautiful weather and such a fun crew. It took about 30 minutes to get to the island, dropped off the passengers not snorkeling then continued on to the ruins. We snorkeled for about an hour then went back to the island and explored and swam some more. The crew was very helpful the entire time. Would definitely do this again.

If I could give 0 Stars I would we were told 40 min wait and we waited 1 hour n 40min we even called after n hour were told 10 more min people that got there after me and my lady were being seated before us and we called again and were told we were next and they didn't seat us so we chose to leave will not be going back to this place they close at 3 pm and we waited till 2:30pm we got there at around 12:10.
This location has to intentionally get orders wrong for fun. That's the only explanation as to how they can never ever ever get a single order right. Avoid this Wendy's.

Have come all the way from Oldsmar twice in past month, now, to enjoy the friendly service, really good tex Mex food, pleasant dog friendly patio, and terrific beers. Stephanie gave great service and even asked if our LABrador needed water or a dog bowl. 2 entree, chips & salsa, a flight, a pint, + tip was a reasonable $41.
This restaurant is in jeopardy of failing if locals and visitors don't support it. That would make us very sad, as it is a welcome addition to the static and (some) overpriced dining options of the past 4-5 years since we've been coming to Gulfport.

I really wanted to like this place. The bartender and the wait person were both terrific. The craft cocktails were delicious but it was all downhill after that. The wine list was quite limited and the food was uninspired. The wedge salads were fine but the rest of the food was uninteresting. Don't get the tempura vegetables. I ended up with soggy zucchini, breaded, fried and  cold. The whiskey shrimp were no more than cook shrimp on a piece of toast. All in all disappointing cuisine.

I liked the salon it was nice and clean. I didnt know you had to pay extra to have your hair styled! Usually where I get my haircut the blow dry is included into the cost. 
Haircut was okay $50 plus tip. Wouldn't go back for this price. I love my chinatown haircut better

THE BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!! Went in for a full set of acrylics just in time for valentine's day! Leah the manager did my nails so perfectly, I'm so in love with them. She accommodated to all my needs and was super sweet!  Pricing is super fair for the nails I got in the picture below I was only charged $45, super reasonable for the service I received. Love the atmosphere in there and super clean (felt super safe with all the covid regulations). This so my new salon for sure. Thank you

Good food, especially the nachos and brisket quesadilla! I had great drinks, for a reasonable price, a wonderful waitress, but I had a horrible experience with management. 

Unfortunately there was a grouchy female manager who walked in to the restroom and announced that she would be closing a tab for my myself, a friend, and my dad shortly after our meal began. My friend and I went to the bathroom on the second floor near our table. I have anxiety about touching public surfaces, especially since the start of COVID as I am immune compromised. My friend opens, closes, locks, and touches surfaces for me to help ease the anxiety when situations arise. As I began using the restroom, the manager knocked and informed myself and our guests that our tab would be closed. I said that is absolutely understandable and we would be happy to leave if it would make her more comfortable . She kept repeating that she would close the tab, which l told her was completely fine, as my guests and I just yearned for the experience of the restaurant since it opened only 3 days ago, and atmosphere more than anything, including the drinks. I really enjoyed this restaurant. The line was short for the bar, and we got in on a Saturday within 15 minutes. It was only a 30 minute wait for the restaurant, and they texted us when they were ready. I just wish management wouldn't have been so aggressive to us for using the same stall since other guests were occupying the other one, and been more understanding to mental health concerns, especially during this day in age. It seemed like it bothered her more that were using a restroom quickly one after the other than two full paying, tipping customers. Apparently for the bridal party that was ok, but not for us.

Other then that, I recommended going, just don't bother using a bathroom stall with a friend. Also--don't forget to stop on the way out to the gift shop for a cute tee!
Horrible experience. No cars ready but on top of that the person working the emerald counter ,Tyrone, was extremely uncooperative unless you were a female.

I woke up this morning thinking " I deserve to treat myself". I wanted to get a mani/pedi. Called a few places and couldn't even get them to answer the phone. I called A 7th Heaven Hair Salon, they were able to fit me into their schedule. Lisa did my pampering and she is fantastic! She is very friendly, gentle and has a great personality. I will definitely be going back to see her. Thank you Lisa for everything!

Like some others, I bought a groupon for oil change (with conventional or synthetic blend oil) and tire rotation.  My wife took my car to appointment.  When she arrived, worker #1 told her my car calls for full synthetic.  She called me to ask what I wanted.  I told her synthetic blend only because that's what the groupon allows for (without having to pay extra).  She told worker #1 blend only.  He said "ok, no problem."  After the work is done, she received the bill from worker #2 and instead of the oil change being free with a few dollars in tax, he charged her $50 plus tax.  Why?  Well it turns out they apparently don't have synthetic blend so they decided to do full synthetic without asking or confirming with her... especially after she explicitly told them blend only.  Worker #2 ended up making excuses about how worker #1 didn't know what he was talking about.  He said they've never had that type of blend oil.  No issue, but why not talk to the customer before and confirm what he/ she wants instead of "upselling" the persons without their knowledge?

What kind of auto shop does work or services without discussing with the client first?  Honestly she should have refused to pay the bill for something she did not authorize.

Went above and beyond the make sure they got the right windshield for my car. Came from out of town and had an interest in making sure I didn't come for nothing. Had me take pictures of windshield and varify it would work. Not much to do in the area while they do your windshield. Sit down have a coffee. Doesnt take long. Will take all future vehicles here for windshields

A frustrating situation made better by good customer service.

My car needed a new throttle module, so on October 29th I dropped it off at Blossom. Several hours after dropping off my car, I was called by a technician and told it my throttle module had to be sent to GM to be rebuilt and that there was a 3-5 week lead-time. Obviously not ideal, but something I understood - it is a 1997 Corvette and parts may have been discontinued. Five weeks later, I received a call that GM was waiting for part, and it would be up to two weeks longer until the work was done.

I was frustrated and I vented my frustration. I was contacted by the owner of Blossom Chevrolet and he walked me through the entire process of what had been done/what was being done to ensure my vehicle was repaired and I was informed. Unfortunately, some repairs require multiple moving parts/entities and those variables are sometimes impossible to account for - this was one of those rare cases. He apologized for my inconvenience, and understood my frustration.

While there may be hiccups in the process due to unforeseen circumstances, but there are good people at Blossom who will do their best to ensure customers are informed and satisfied. I found them to be reasonable, and I will use them again in the future.
The quest for the best nail salon is over! I finally found a nail salon that has excellent service. My nails look impeccable. They are so meticulous and attentive to the customer. Great job!

Food was fast and delicious. The Korean bbq wings were perfect flavor but could use more sauce. The honey buffalo was hot and wet. Zucchini planks for the starter was perfect. Angus sirloin sandwich was good. Not a lover of coleslaw but it works on the sandwich. Good location, easy to find.
Brock was fantastic! I could only wish he was on the grill whippin up the sandwiches.

5 stars for cleaning, 1 star for prices (and the process).

After researching dry cleaners on Yelp, none of the ones close to Chalfont were highly rated nor had many details written about them, so I took a chance with this cleaners who are located close to home. I took 5 dresses and a small jacket to get priced, and the lady handed me a paper quote well over $100. I was SHOCKED. I told her there is no way this is feasible, then she told me to hold on and discounted 15% to just under $100. What? When did dry cleaning become a negotiation service? Not professional. Even with the quote, it was way too high. So, I picked out my most expensive items to get cleaned, then the lady asked what I would like to pay for them. I told her there is no way they can match what I'm used to paying, told her my previous experiences, and she asked if $15 a dress was ok. Since they were expensive dresses, I said yes. Both dresses had jewels on them which were considered "special cleaning" so the rate was supposedly a bit higher. However, the other dresses I took home were basic black dresses and not special cleaning, but they still gave me the same rate for ALL dresses on paper, which makes the process even more shady.
