Here's the thing...I just moved from Dallas (Highland Park area, which is the most expensive zip code in the city, not to brag at all, but read my point), and I never paid such high prices. Most standard dry cleaners offered a flat $2-3 per piece rate. For special cleaning items, I occasionally paid up to $10 for a high-end brand at the most expensive place in Dallas, but usually $5-7 at the normal places, and they always turned out fine. The median income for Dallas/Highland Park is much higher than Chalfont, so it's difficult to believe that everyone around here pays close to $15 per piece of clothing.

While the cleaning turned out just fine, I would not go back unless I had an expensive piece of clothing to dry clean, and even then, I'm still not sure if I would go as I felt the back and forth negotiation and haggling of prices was completely absurd. The language barrier was also high throughout this process, so that also did not help.

I do not throw around the word PIONEER lightly. As a pioneer in the field of Pain Management, Dr. Medvedovsky is bold, passionate, collaborative and always at the forefront of pain treatment techniques innovation. Being a true subject matter expert allows Dr.  Medvedovsky to constantly push the boundaries of pain treatment. He also lectures frequently to physicians and medical students on current topics in Pain Management.
Frequently out of the items I need (often in the health & beauty and baby departments). Employees are not overly friendly. Just a drag to have to go here.

This is the first AMEX lounge I've visited. It was a quiet Wednesday early afternoon, so when I arrived to the lounge the front desk people were friendly.  The lounge is bright and modern. Certainly, geared towards the business traveler. There are not many couches or comfy chairs. 
The bar is fully stocked with creative cocktails and a diverse wine list. I didn't look at the beer list in detail, but did notice they carried local beers on draft. The food is buffet style and Mediterranean forward. If it's not your jam, you may want to eat before heading in. I love Mediterranean so I enjoyed  the majority of the options. They have a small salad area with spring mix, beets, roasted acorn squash, tomatoes, tabbouleh, beans, and some others. For hot food there was brisket with carrrots, roasted potatoes, rice, lamb meatballs, and a squash/tomato soup. It was good, not great. They also had an assortment of cookies and a passion fruit custard that was entirely too bitter and sour. 

I didn't have coffee or tea, but they had some great options there. Because it was close to the holidays Santa made a brief appearance. 
Note: you can only order one drink per person. So if you're with others they will need to get their own drink. Mild inconvenience, but again the bar was wonderfully stocked. 

f you bring children ensure they are well-behaved as this is geared towards the business person. There's not a lot of room for them to move around. It's fairly small. 

I spent a good four hours there due to a delay, enjoyed the drinks and left with a full tummy. The bartenders and people clearing tables were incredibly friendly and service was prompt. 

Overall, good lounge experience.

Absolutely love this place!!!!!
I order from here pretty regularly lately.  Roughly $12.00 for 3 chicken skewers with rice and greek salad.  Great deal and super fresh and tasty!!!   I have tried a few other items but this is my favorite so far.  Delivery is super quick.  Service is excellent.  Highly recommended.  AAA+++

I love getting my hair cuts here. It's never a hassle. The longest I've waited was maybe a minute after making an appointment. If you can, get Karina to cut yours! She's on point!! I've never left unsatisfied, perfect tapers and shape ups. I come in at least twice a month to make sure everything looks good. 10/10 shout out to Karina for being so good !!!

Not a big fan of their coffee but the folks who work here are very friendly and helpful..

Also a local artist displays her handcrafted greeting cards there. Her latest set includes Victorian homes throughout the city. Check them out if you get a chance. :)

I love Donald Links restaurants... This was a disaster.  

Service was terrible.  

The ceviche had way too much paprika on it.  I could not taste the wonderful gulf shrimp and tuna.  

The best part of my meal was the dirty rice. The duck was done well. 

The dessert was sub par.   

All in all I am in NOLA at a high end restaurant and I expect much better.  Very disappointed. 

The topper they did not even ask if we were ready for our check they just brought it like we were at Denny's.

Was lost in the area and found this 
Place thru Yelp. Food was pretty good nice portions. Had shrimp scampi. Prices very reasonable. Will come back whenever we're stopping at the Columbus farmers market.

This place's rating went up with the smoking ban.  Otherwise, this place was in a perpetual state of smoky.

The pho here is excellent and.... well... I've liked the pho that much I haven't tried anything else.  Every place's pho is juuuust a bit different so you're really just gonna have to try it all over to find your favorite.

*edit
To be honest I don't particularly think this place is THAT great, but my wife certainly does and they have by far her favorite pho.  When she somehow convinces me to come all the way down here it makes me dislike this place just a bit more -_-

Dough photographed my wedding and he is amazing!  He made our small wedding party feel totally at ease and captured some great moments. He was professional, easy to work with, and his prices were reasonable. We got our digital wedding pictures back in just 1 week with options to print or create an album.

I recommend Doug if you'll be getting married in the Santa Barbara area!

Pho was delicious. Jessica was great. 

She even waited late when I realized I'd forgotten my phone on the table. 

My friend and I will definitely recommend and visit again.

We have a family member that just wont give up on CDB's, so a year after our bad experience we booked another family dinner for 20 people. New management you say? We arrive on time and the host says that most of our party has already arrived, so we follow her lead. Turns out we were the first to arrive and they had given our section away to crashers, It was almost funny to see the hostess and servers disappear into hiding and leaving us standing there awkwardly looking over the people that had our table. Fair play to the female bartender that finally addressed us and offered to seat us at he bar. Since we had kids and a wheelchaired person, we left and walked into Gators to be seated instantly.

This hotel is quite well-situated at the northern edge of the French Quarter, not far from Bourbon Street or the RiverWalk.  The rooms are standard Courtyard by Marriott rooms, though with fewer amenities than I've seen at others - no hot tub, fewer freebies in the room, no coffee maker, and so forth.  The room itself was quite pleasant, I was happy with the bed...not too hard or too soft.

I did not have a chance to experience 5 Fifty 5, their onsite restaurant, but I heard from other convention attendees that it was good.  Likewise for the bar in the lobby...I heard positive reviews but did not try it myself.  I did try the lobby Starbucks (full-service, very nice) and the gift shop (almost no service, few items had actual prices on them).

The meeting facilities were fine.  Water was always available in the major rooms, although not in the smaller rooms.  If you find yourself needing to go to a "Balcony" room, be aware that the 4th floor is only accessible from the River Tower, not the Quarter Tower.  If you are on the 3rd floor on the Quarter side, you might happen upon the staircase leading to the 4th floor, but it's better to save time and go straight to the elevators of the River side.  Also, several bathrooms near the breakout rooms were broken, and we had to go from the 4th floor Balcony rooms to the 2nd floor Exhibit Hall just to use the bathroom.

A special word of caution about the elevators.  The system is called Miconic 10, and I've never seen it elsewhere.  It's designed to move people more efficiently, and I'm sure it does move people FASTER, but it's LESS user-friendly than a standard elevator.  My biggest word of advice is: ALWAYS press your desired floor before boarding.  If you want to run and catch an elevator before it leaves your floor, you'd do better to wait...I tried this once but nobody was going to the lobby and I ended up on the 19th floor instead!  Once you are inside the elevator, there is NO WAY to control where it goes.  Press your floor BEFORE entering and go to the elevator the panel tells you to.  Also, people with mobility issues should press the little handicapped symbol first.  It will make sure your elevator is less crowded, and the doors will remain open longer.  Miconic 10 is well-suited to office buildings, but NOT hotels, so be warned!

If the service was substandard and I give a tip according to the service, that's my prerogative. When the manager stops  me and my friend before we leave and harasses me about the tip that I gave AND accuses my friend of not leaving a tip, that's a problem! I'm appalled at this behavior. By the way, my friend gave a tip and so did I. Her name was Na, she said that she was the manager and she approached us initially soliciting feedback about why I gave a small tip. I told her the woman was inattentive. She went to say that the tip that I gave was not equivalent to the service that I received. Obviously, she didn't know what inattentive meant AND she was just harassing us about this tip that I gave. The young lady guided me to the chair for my pedicure and I got services that cost $100 and so did my friend. She treated me to the outing. So when I put my feet in the sink, the water was too hot. She proceeded to turn on the cooler water and me and my friend were chatting, excited about sharing this experience. I noticed that the sink was filling up, but I thought the woman was paying attention. Needless to say the sink overflowed with my feet still in the sink. (Inattentive) A lot of the workers ran over with towels to clean up the water which spilled on the floor. She didn't engage me in any conversation at all, maybe she didn't speak English. Not sure, but I've had better service elsewhere. I really didn't appreciate the harassment of the lady named NA who said that she was the manager. That's just not cool, at all!
Both the pizza and wings are good here. General Tso pizza was off the charts good. Hard to find good pizza in South Jersey but we finally found some!

I Used to love this place alot. So what did I do? I applied I worked with them for 6 months and then one day BOOM out of nowhere I get fired for some shit I didnt do. I was so mad because they said that when I was training a girl that i was cursing in front of kids in the dinning. Which is dumb cus I didnt like to curse much back then and I was in training which I knew they will ask the girl how the training went. So I basically had to be on my best behavior. I was upset that they would believe a new girl over me. That was back in 2013. I would have still worked there. Also they got mad at me and my friend for speaking Russian and when I told them that they always speak Spanish they got mad. Lmao oh well. Food is bomb though. But they go through employees like paper towels.

Literally so delicious. I got the blue crab au gratin to split as an appetizer with my boyfriend and it was absolutely to die for. Richie was helping us out most of the night and he has the best input for us. He was so incredibly helpful and we were happy to have him! The rest of the staff was extremely friendly as well, but we forgot to catch their names. The ambience was nice, you could show up dressed up fancy, but we also saw people dressed in jeans! Definitely recommend, delicious food, good vibes, and a friendly staff!

Too many rules and guidelines for ordering food. I ordered Fried Rice that contained shrimp and I was told how many shrimp would be in the box..... The prices were very high for casual fast food and the wait was extensive
Beignets were deliciously fresh and plump! Love this place. Very packed when the music gets a-goin'.
One of the most disgusting public bathrooms I've ever seen  this is really surprising for such a good store.

The menu here is great, it's diverse and has both warm and cold options (perfect for summer) food was pricey but tasted great! I had the gazpacho soup& the shrimp salad platter. The outdoor patio was nice & the service was great. I would go back!

If you like beer at all and are around the Philadelphia area, you really should do yourself a favor and take a trip to this brewery.  There are many interesting beers that I would actively seek out, and they come in a variety of sizes. I normally don't get excited about beer as wine or cocktails are my drinks of choice.  However, I felt differently after tasting the beers here.  I joined the UYE here last month, and I was impressed with everything about this place.  From the food, to the beer, to the service, it was a home run.

I stuck with the 4 and 8 oz pours.  The 4 is great if you just want to taste something and are unsure.  The 8 is perfect for me to satisfy a craving for a particular beer.  I tasted many things I liked but my favorite was the Lil' Lady.  So tart, tangy, lemony, and refreshing which is my favorite style of beer. I also enjoyed the one that was brewed with spelt and guava, and also the experimental one with sushi rice and yuzu (Japanese citrus). I love the interesting combos going on here.  I usually only like sours, but Tired Hands proved me wrong!  

Service was excellent!  We had a big group of over ten Yelpers and water glasses were kept full and servers made sure we were able to order more beer when our glasses were running low.  It was also crazy crowded in there as it was a busy Saturday which made the level of service even more impressive.  In addition, the server has no problem giving our large group separate checks.

The Fermentaria serves up some tasty bar far as well.  I had a veggie burger and honestly wasn't expecting much, but it was very flavorful and the guacamole added some nice texture.  The bun was soft and fluffy (potato roll maybe?) and the fries appeared to be fresh cut.  It was a good sized portion, but not too much to where you push yourself to eat it and feel gross.  Just right!  

I will most definitely return for the brews and the bites.  It looks like the draft choices are always changing, so I am excited to see what is available on my next visit!

Absolutely incredible!!! The hospitality is over the roof! They literally made us feel like we were over at their house for a visit. There was 5 of us & they brought out extra seating, gave us complimentary ice cream & water! They pies are from God's hands directly delivered to Earth via Papa C. Never had a better pie! Thank you Jesus for gracing us with these heavenly pies & angelic people!

This is a great restaurant around St. Pete beach. I wait more than 3 years to come back and I left last night with the same feeling of satisfaction  I tried its lunch and dinner menu , notnsire if it change but is fantastic. Last night was my sister 50's celebration and she enjoyed mussels in white wine souce as well as fish with a pistaccio crust... excellent both. I am
More " traditional" lobster bisque and herbs and citrus mahi...
The food value is according with its quality and you can decided according to your budget...
July/2018 update. We come
Back, this time with my husband.... we ordered Jimbo Shrimp and Calamari, with a glass of wine a Black Label Scoth. Food is very tasty

Decided to try this place out after not coming here in years. (hardly frequent the area) I was a little boggled to hear taxes are charged on everything except snowballs at a snowball stand I never heard of that before! I ordered nachos and a snowball. Snowball was good, $3.50 for nachos with tax it comes up to $3.85 with cheese only placed in the cup. (to me it's not enough) so I ordered extra and for extra cheese it's .75 and the cheese was just ok! I have had better. This place might be in a good location, with decent food, friendly staff, but the con is they are pricey to me.

One of favorite places to stop in for breakfast or bunch in Tucson. The food is delicious! My gripe with Prep & Pastry is inconsistency with their service. It can sometimes be fantastic and other times be unbearably bad. I understand that they get very busy, however, waiting after being seated for 45+ minutes on multiple occasions to give an order without being noticed is almost inexcusable. Additionally, after the food is brought to you, don't expect to see your server again until you're paying; only a handful of times have they actually come back to check on the food. Please fix the service!

The staff here is amazing!! They are incredibly friendly and helpful and try to anticipate every need. We actually forgot some of our clothes when we checked out. Called about 3 hours later and they sent security up to get our belongings and had them ready for us when we arrived to pick them up!

One word DELICIOUS 
I'll keep it short ......amazing fish spread and smoked salmon! A nice light meal but filling. Comes with a side of coleslaw and German potato salad ( it's warm with bacon )

Mark  Fore and Strike is a family owned gunshop that's been a Reno Institution for as long as I can remember.  Years ago I used to deliver products to them when I worked for a firearms distributor.  It's good to see them still kicking!

They are a full-service shop, so prices tend to be on the higher end, but they gave me a smoking deal on a 12 gauge over/under with an engraved receiver, fine wood and all the trimmings a while back.  If you're a fan of classic used guns, they are worth checking out.

Best restaurant on the Main Line. Super friendly staff, all of the servers here are very hospitable, especially Steve. Be sure to ask the bartender, Tommy, about the different kinds of beer that they have to offer. His knowledge is incredible! My kids and family love it here, we can't wait to come back.

This place was absolutely delicious!!! There was 4 of us and we all ordered different things. All of us had a great meal. The flavors were amazing. They brought us the steaks ordered before they were cooked and gave us a little overview of the marbling and where they came from etc. The atmosphere was very casual but the flavors were high end for sure. The appetizer we had was the oxtail poutine it was the best! We had salmon, ribeyes and a sirloin. Sides were Brussels sprouts and mushrooms. All of it was great!!

If you like a "traditional" breakfast this is not the place. Check out the menu before going here. I'm sure there are those that love this place but it's not for me. On the menu, it clearly states no substitutes. Therefore, "you get what you get so don't throw a fit."

As a side note, I don't need to see all the political comments in a restaurant. I come to eat not read signs on the wall what they support politically or not.

I love everything about this establishment. I really admire what Denise is doing for the LGBTQ+ community by opening another bar. I also had a wonderful time at the 2017/18 New Years party. It was an affordable affair, Denise's cooking was delicious, and the music was on point. All of the staff was friendly and the drinks were strong but not too strong. I saw someone previously commented there was no coat check - if there wasn't one, there certainly is now. What I love most is the vibe. It is small and intimate downstairs with a neon theme and beer pong at the rear bar. And if you feel the need to stretch your legs, upstairs is another bar and a perfectly sized dance floor. I've been here a few times and I certainly intend on coming back.

They treat my Aspie with the utmost attention and carefulness. She is incredibly picky with her food. Everything is treated as a pleasure to serve her not a headache.

The pasta is delicious and I would recommend eating here for sure.

Cool little store in the now-awesome downtown Reno area. The theme appears to focus on the fact that Lake Tahoe is at least 1/3 in the state of Nevada. Arguably, the better half, but it depends on who you ask :) Personally I love both sides of the Lake, the way you can love visiting other countries as well as touring your own. I adore the minimalist look of TahoeNVLove apparel and accessories! I hope they make things for my puppy and for the beach, soon. The clothing, etc. is ethically sourced and the shirts are super soft, love it. Can't wait to see what they create next. I'm a huge fan. Also, for the non-local, the Nevada side of Tahoe is usually the coastline you see in photos, like Sand Harbor. Emerald Bay is in California. Both sides have great ski resorts and stunningly beautiful destinations, beaches, hikes, and views.

Was told the wait would be 20-25 minutes.  Ok, put our name down. 1 hour later we were finally seated. Ordered a pint beer at the bar during the "wait" , but told at the table that it didn't come in tthat size???
This isn't the first time we have had a issue at this restaurant with it taking FOREVER!

This place was recommended by many and i have to say it was delicious. We went on a sunday around 7:30 and it was not busy at all, only 2 other tables. We were greeted by the most friendly waitress ever. She told us the specials and gave us a few moments to decide on what to order. After looking at the menu and trying to make a decision sonce everything looked so good I decided to get a ceasar salad and chicken napalitano. My boyfriend got the mussels in white sauce and veal parm. 

Our appitiZers were out in no time. The aroma fron the mussels was mouthwatering. There must have been more then 3 dozen mussles in the pot and there was enough sauce leftover to dip the crunchy seeded bread in. My ceasar salad was good, usual ceasar salad with crunchy crutons, not to much dressing.  

The chicken napalitano was amazing.  It was the most tender chicken breast with so much flavor. The mozzarella was so creamy and there was a piece of prosciutto between the chicken and cheese which gave the chicken a great flavor. There was this light tomato wine like sauce and the taste was to die for.  There tomatos were so plump and the artichokes were perfect.  The flavors all went so well together. 

I tasted the veal parm and that was also delicious. The red saice was so flavorful, the veal so tender and breaded perfectly.  

Of course I had to get dessert. There is a book to look through with about 10 pictures. I wanted to choose a little piece of everything but I decided to get the chocolate chip cannoli. The waitress said her husband makes the filling and it is not to sweet and the perfect flavor. She was right. The cannoli shell had the perfect crisp and taste. The filling was the best i have had. It came bursting out of the shell and the cannolinis big enough for 2, although i ate all of it lol. After eating all the cannoli i wanted to get another one to bring it home. Perfect cannoli i have to say. 

I highly recommend this little resturant for great italian cuisine.  The staff is friendly, feels like you are eating at a relatives house. One downfall is cash only.

They deserve more than 5 stars. 
We were so worried because my daughter's passport expired and we're going on a cruise in 7 days. 
They over night the passport to us in 2 days. 
The lady was really really nice. 
Thank you !!!!!!!
Came here for happy hour on cinco de mayo with friends. Workers honestly seemed annoyed at us and rude. We asked them multiple times if they were mad at us. Don't know if I would return.

I go into Saboro at least once a week for a cafe con leche and am greeted by the friendliest manager that knows exactly how I like my coffee. The food is authentically Cuban and priced just right. The ropa vieja with white rice and yuca will hit the spot for any carnivores Latin food craving. Oh! Don't forget an order of sweet plantains, too. You will not be disappointed.
Great prices at happy hour!  2 for 1 beers.  Free chips and salsa...The best salsa on State Street!  Staff is very nice w/ no attitude!

My work has Fooda and Pita Chip was the restaurant they brought in for the day.  I ordered a salad bowl with falafel and chicken shawarma and it was amazing!  All of the food was so fresh. Their hot sauce and tahina are so damn good too. The hot sauce definitely had a kick to it but I love spicy stuff so I didn't mind. People more sensitive to heat may not like it.  I hope Fooda brings Pita Chip back to my work but I'm lucky it's not too far from my apartment.  I will definitely order again.

A friend of our recommended this restaurant.  We went around 8pm on Saturday.  The street the restaurant sits on is charming and quiet.  The dining area is not very quiet.  It seems to have an echo due to the concrete floors and high ceiling.  We ordered the Antipasto Misto for starters. It was ok.  My husband had Farfalle Alla Milanese, he seemed to like it.  I thought it was nasty!! It had an overwhelming odor of pancetta (bacon.) It was weighed down with fatty heavy sauce.  Almost like they rendered out the fat from the pancetta and the sausage and used every drop to make the sauce. YUK!  I had the Pollo Alla Gino-Vese, it was pretty good.  Slightly over cooked and salty but over all it was good.  Mine also came with a side of spaghetti (which I did not eat.  It tasted canned.) Our server was super sweet! lol She even commented on my husband's dish.  She said that she hates serving it because the smell gags her.  We had a nice time there.  We did not leave hungry and our bill was $68 and we had drinks.  Not horrible but not amazing! PS... bring a sweater because it is down right COLD in there!!

Best "hole in the wall" eatery I've eaten at.
We had the Maque Chous. It was great. Last time we had the jambalaya and it was awesome

The portobello burger is the biggest freaking joke. Expensive with NOTHING ON IT. Like, come on guys... 
The Mac and cheese is Walmart buffet quality. Actually, I had 4 sides. All belonged at the Walmart deli.
Extremely tough ribs.
Thin BBQ sauce.
Very large chicken wings, made of rubber.
They charged me for all the the sides I ordered, even though my meals came with side 2 sides each. They could not figure out how to fix it, so they gave some french fries...... The kind you used to get at your elementary school cafeteria......
I wish they were open on Sundays. I enjoying eating here. My food was good. My shake was great. I mostly come for the snappers! But the food is excellent too.

On New years eve I got charged $73 for a ride that should have cost approximately $12 when I contacted uber they said it's in the terms and conditions that I agreed to it.   This is ridiculous I will never use uber again

Technicians arrived on time as planned.  They were respectful and easy to work with.  The costs for my A/C repairs was lower than I anticipated.  Overall happy with Lee Company - would use them for other services in the future.

From the moment we walked in, it was an amazing evening at the inn. We were greeted immediately and warmly welcomed by a lovely hostess. We were given a table by the fire and welcomed again by our waiter. It was restaurant week, so we selected our options that were paired with a special wine. We each had something different and each was delicious, especially the gnocchi for the first course. The second and third courses were even better: flat iron steak, pork chops or salmon, followed by desserts. Altogether, excellent food served by outstanding, attentive staff! The manager, Maggie, gave us a tour afterwards and told us the history of the inn. Just a wonderful experience! We'll be back!

Every time I come , the price changes 10 different times by the time u get to the corner. They need to have a set price not just whatever feel at the time. A full set and a fill in is never the same price. No matter " how long the nail is". They talk shit the entire time ur there and change nail techs during ur service. A fill in gel polish should never be $45. This is the first time I've been plain when gettin my nails done and it's clumpy , uneven and they put on 10 coats; which I'd unnecessary. Extremely dissatisfied

I'm loving Northwest Coffee even more now since they started serving eggs several days ago.

Plain eggs, eggs with cheese, eggs in a tortilla, eggs on a bagel, eggs on an English muffin... you get the picture.

They actually steam their eggs under one of their espresso machines! So, they come out extra light and fluffy, and the water expands them nicely. No butter or oils necessary! 

And, their eggs are locally-sourced from the River Hills Poultry Alliance. They're 'happy eggs', as they come from free-range chickens that are free of antibiotics and humanely raised. And yes, you CAN taste the difference.

They still make the meanest latte ever here, too! Try 'em.

Can't say enough great things about this place. Several times a year, my fellow Marines come to this place and have a great time. The "Black Sheep" of our particular units, we come together and enjoy some beverages and way better than expected food. Over the past few years, we've made some great memories here and I can honestly say that this place has the best burger I've tasted in a long time. The staff is always above average and takes care of us extremely well. We didn't get to meet the manager, but he also treated us much better than most establishments in the area. I'm not talking about a few guys either. We've shown up with a party of over 20 and they still were extremely accommodating and kept the premier service going. Almost didn't want to write this review because we like keeping it as our "hidden gem" of the area. I hope they make some more merchandise so we can represent when we're out of town!
Food is good but be aware it will take 30 mins for a simple take out order.  only one person taking orders during LUNCH!

Arrived at 5:15! Restaurant was empty, was seated right away. The food came out so quickly, and was so beautifully presented!!!! The sushi itself was delicious and well made! Really good quality food, and for a REALLY good price !!!! For my party of 3, our bill was only $70. We have paid and are leaving now at 5:45. Super fast service (30 mins).
I just can't understand how a steak restaurant does not have a baked potato option for a side.

It's like stepping back in time when customer service actually meant something.  The staff were super friendly and helpful.  All the food is homemade including all the breads.  I had the reuben and it was fantastic.
There's also grand piano in the dining room and they have someone playing which is cool.
Gumbeaux did not have any flavor. There was more rice than gumbeaux in my bowl. My salad was delicious.

I've stayed at Prince Conti twice while visiting NOLA on business and you get what you pay for. No, this is not a five star hotel. It is not new. But it is in the French Quarter, close to the action. Walking distance to Jackson Square, the antiques on Royal street, and one of the touristy cemeteries. Of course, it is also close to Bourbon, and, with a couple stops for hurricanes and souvenirs, a little longer walk to Cafe du Monde and Frenchman Street.

You pay for parking and your car is valeted. 

It could use some remodelling and service could be a touch friendlier. But this is New Orleans! This hotel has its spooky parts (ask for the rooms out back above the parking lot or across from the lobby) but it is charming like NOLA itself.

There's nothing like eating seafood on a pier on a gorgeous weekend!

My cousin raves about the spider crab here and I finally got the chance to go to SB (my first time) to try it! The line for the restaurant was insane during Saturday lunch! We put our name on the list and it would have been over an hour wait! We decided to order at the outdoor window instead and eat outside on the picnic tables which 1.had a shorter wait 2.had the same items 3. didn't have to tip which makes me sound cheap but you will thank me when you're paying for a 5 lb spider crab!

We got some meal deal that came with 2 clam chowders, 2 salads and we chose a 5 lb spider crab to share among 2 of us. I also ordered fries to get some carbs in there. And here's the verdict:

Fries: Could have passed. I feel like I could have bought some at the frozen aisle of the grocery store and had the same.

Clam Chowder: It was pretty good. Not the best I've had, but will definitely satisfy a clam chowder craving. Had a decent amount of clams.

Salad: Nothing special - just a normal leafy green

And the infamous Spider Crab: I felt like it was good, but not amazing. First, I thought they were gonna give ONE who giant 5lb crab but they give you 5lbs OF crab. The body comes on one plate and the rest of the legs that makes up the rest of the weight comes in another plate. The shell is really thick so I definitely recommend one of those shell cracker things. The crab meat tasted fresh and it was cooked well, but the meat was too dense for me. It wasn't marinated with any flavor so if you wanted some, you had to rely on the tiny cup of melted butter or the 2 slice of lemon they give you for the whole crab. 

Overall, it was okay. It's a lot of work, but you do get a lot of meat. I would recommend it if you want a seafood meal on the pier. At $9/lb, it's actually not that bad of a price, but each lb does add up.

If I could I wouldn't give them a star at all. Don't waste your time. Incompetent in all departments. Spend 6 months trying to get a new machine when mine broke and finally had to go elsewhere. Nightmare!!!!

Getting waxed with Mrs Ken is the absolute BEST wax experience I have ever had!!!!! 

My eyebrows have honestly never looked better-- she worked magic on them! She is incredibly careful and precise and created the perfect shape for my face. 

It was also the best Brazilian wax I've ever gotten. I have never had such a pain free and thorough wax. Also no new ingrown hairs!! Exceptional. 

Not to mention the student prices are awesome, and Mrs Ken is wonderful. She is delightful and professional, and easy to book with. I wish I had discovered her sooner. Simply the best of the best!!!

This is NOT a DIET restaurant. :-)  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I waited too long to check it out.  Their pizza is awesome!  It's just like a Blaze or a Pie Five in "style" but with better ingredients. The dough and sauce are made in house.  You can make your pizza as healthy (or yummy) as you want it.    If you don't want the dough, then make up a salad.  And don't forget the breadsticks.   :-).  They are fresh baked, not just warmed up.  
One difference with the other made-to-order pizza places is that you pay per-topping.  But the base price is $5.  So, for a 4-topping pizza with a half order of breadsticks (3), and extra dipping sauce and a small drink (free refills) was $12.69.   Since I had left overs, that's a pretty good price for two meals!  
There is ample seating inside, with a mix of high and low top tables.
Obsessed with this place. The food was amazing. We didn't get anything special, burgers and fries, and they were perfection. Quick made to order.
Finger licking good BBQ. This is a must have when visiting the city of St. Louis. The pulled pork sandwich is a great plate for anytime of the day.

This is my new favorite place to order from. Healthy options and delicious food that fills you up. They over a chopped with dressing option which is a must for me! The modern greek is my favorite. It has crunch and flavor. I tell everyone about this place!

We have been waiting (hoping) someone would open a great raw bar in SB for quite some time now. The Big Eye Raw Bar is Outstanding. Fresh fish. Delicious flavors. We had the spicy salmon and traditional poke bowls. Highly recommended.

Stay was for a small group of 25 year olds during the peak of Mardi Gras 2014 (no kids). We got into NOLA much later planned and ended up in traffic due to a parade on Canal street (plan ahead if you're driving in).  I gave the front desk a call and even though they were slammed, the staff was very sweet and took her time explaining how to get out of the traffic and get to the hotel. 

When we arrived, valet took care of unloading the car and getting the luggage up to the room after our super fast check-in.  For Mardi gras Marriott issues wrist bands, we were able to get an extra just incase. 

During our week stay, the hotel staff was top notch. The beds were super comfy and the location was perfect for Mardi Gras. We could see all the parades from our window.  I will definitely book here again for Mardi Gras!

Our dog had an emergency and we were able to get an appointment for the same day. It was our first visit there and didn't really know what to expect. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our dog doesn't really get along with men not to mention men who are largely built. They took that under consideration and arranged a vet who wouldn't intimidate him - Dr. Baggett was very helpful and proficient!

It's weird: Much of what's going on with my life is a complete surprise to even myself.  I wasn't supposed to be in New Orleans or be staying with my friend whom I hit up last minute, but somehow we ended up here when I was already pretty shithoused, running with our umbrellas trying to beat the impending storm that never came.  The outside area upstairs is cool with a view of the Mississippi River (always makes me think of Tom Sawyer or one of those books).  However, there is only one dingy table outside AND, it's the target blasting area of some sort of restaurant ventilation so if you look cute, keep in mind that you will leave smelling like greasy french fries which makes you less cute.  

Drinks are like $10 each.  EXPENSIVE!  And small sized like but I was drunk already so no harm no foul.  Mojitos are better than margaritas.  It's a huge space inside but not many people upstairs.

This is by far my favorite snoball stand. no, they don't have any super fancy signature flavors, but that's okay because it allows them to perfect the classics. i get their groom's cake (chocolate and wedding cake) usually, or i just get wedding cake creme with condensed milk. either way, the flavor is perfection. they have the best ice, which is shaved about as thin as possible. the prices are actually average to low, and that's considering they just raised each cup price about 25 cents. they have a nice variety of sugar free options. they have 2 locations, which is bonus. they stay open at least an hour later than many snoball stands. 

the employees are all really great, but there's one girl in particular, whose name i can't seem to remember at the moment. she's been at the papworth location for at least 3 summers, and she's very sweet. i wish i could remember her name, so i could give her some props for doing a great job, especially because she's trained many (if not most/all) of the other employees. 

i highly recommend lou-lou's! i truly believe that many people over pay for some fancy snoball from some famous place that's been on the food network too many times (like plum st. snoballs). lou-lou's has the friendliness, the flavors, the ice, the prices, the hours, and the two central locations.. it's everything all rolled into one awesome snoball stand!

enjoy!

I have been to other Texas de Brazil locations and they vary in selection and overall experience so I was a little hesitant to make a reservation here to celebrate my parents' birthday (yeah both, they are 4 days apart, lucky me!) but this restaurant is one of the best Brazilian steakhouse experiences I have ever had. Aside from the regular standards; great quality food on the amazing salad bar, large selection of tempting meats served, etc. this establishment sets itself apart from all the rest with the star quality waitstaff they have. Their employees, from the hostess to the gauchos were outstanding from the moment we walked in the door to the time they rolled us out of there (with dessert!) We arrived early for our reservation so we patiently waited in the comfortable and convenient patio area, had a couple drinks which were conveniently added to our bill, which we appreciated versus paying multiple times. We were seated and explained the procedure of the restaurant and then the fun began. Besides the delectable meal, all the friendly gauchos and our accommodating waitstaff really enhanced the whole experience as they tended to our every need and made us feel welcome and special. It was definitely a busy night and we could understand getting lost in the mix, but there was hardly a misstep throughout the night. A manager and the executive chef also came out to ensure everything was satisfactory. Awesome experience, I will definitely recommend to my friends and return again for our next celebration!
my new fave sushi place! worth driving 25 mins for!

A sandwich for all time.

I'd charged my bro with the task of taking me to get a awesome italian hoagie.  Not a hoagie that was overloaded with salami and bologna but, a real italian hoagie with mortadella and proscuitto... He hit the mark!

It's a small establishment but, they make up for it in spirit, customer service and good food.  

The owner or manager was slicing fresh corned beef and was giving out palm size samples with the a qtr sliced pickle...heaven on sunday.

You need to check this spot out!

This is my third meal from J&D and the first where we ate at the shop. 

Most of the time my wife and I just split one of the 1/2 pounders ( which is plenty for us) but today we each got our own.  I had my usual 1/2 pound burger (not stuffed) with all the trimmings plus jalapinos.  My wife had the 1/3 pounder.  We split one very generous serving of sweet potatoe fries.

First of all, I'm not sure how they give you so much meat at their prices ( 4.99 for the regular 1/2 pounder and 3.99 for the 1/3 pound) with beef prices through the roof.  Anyway, the burgers are cooked exactly as ordered ( medium for me and well for my wife).  The fries looked a little over done but we're not at all.  Must just be that sweet potatoe fries come out darker than I expect.

The owner usually checks on satisfaction with the customer but I cannot 
imagine anyone having much of a beef ( no pun intended).

Overall, a really great place for a burger.  I will never eat any of the fast food burgers again as long as J&D is open when I'm hungry for a "cheeseburger in Paradise" ( apologies to Jimmy Buffett)
Worst food too much salt .ate there 1 time nothing special .I ordered from the American side of the menu.too bad for me.

Do not go here! I went in just to get my teeth cleaned and they said that my insurance doesn't cover my cleaning, which I found out after that they do. So they said that I had to pay around $200 when all I wanted was to get my teeth cleaned so then they said it would only be $92. So after finding out that my insurance does cover my cleaning I went back there so they could resolve this problem, but apparently I sign up to get all these things done when all I said was "I just want to get my teeth cleaned." They said that I said it was ok to do all those things. They will find anyway to charge you for no reason.

Moved down here from Chicago, was searching for a decent taco spot. The food at this place is fire. The food tastes delicious, the portions are great, and the customer service is on point. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for authentic Mexican Food.

Great Vegan good! You won't be disappointed. Good customer service.

Ordered :
Carrot Asdado Salad which was on point and so delicious. 5stars 
Langos - 4stars 
Peri peri tofu - 4 stars

The store is very old style it's well kept but clearly not up to date with the rest of the other stores. The cashier was quick to serve us and really nice. The chicken popcorn and poutine was hot and fresh and the gravy didn't taste like crap. The 20 piece wings were crunchy and very fresh. Highly recommend this location!

Waited for 30 minutes to be seated, 15 more before our server stopped by to take our drink order and then she disappeared for 20 or so before taking our food orders, which took forever. All-in, over two hours before we had something to eat and it was basically fast food quality cuisine. It was almost comical how many things were wrong with our order when it finally arrived. In summary, mediocre  fast food without the speed and poor service.

 Additionally, bathrooms were disgusting. First and last trip to Buffalo Wild Wings.
A gem tucked away in Storke Plaza across from the Marketplace. Fabulous breakfast and wonderful service. I'm not a big fan of Cajun and was thrilled w the variety of dishes available. Enjoy!!

Five stars for this location easily! Not sure why it took me so long to contribute to the reviews of this place, but better late than never. Everyone at this location is friendly and it's always sincere. Aside from having customer service that would shame some high end Philadelphia restaurants the food here is great. It is delivered efficiently, hot, and cooked properly. I personally am addicted to the spicy chicken sandwich and love to dip my fires in the Chick-fil-A Sauce. I also like that this location has family friendly nights: my favorite is taking my daughter to the annual father daughter date night around Valentine's. My little girl and I look forward to it - probably me more than her she is five and has no sense of time. I also really like their milk shakes and breakfast sandwich selections. Keep up the good work team Chick-fil-A, it isn't going unnoticed or unappreciated!

Don't understand why it has so many stars. Came on a Sunday night like around 8 and didn't get my food til 10. Waitress only came by twice. First timer to Nola and wanted to try food they specialize in...alligator, gumbo, crawfish, etc. Had the fried alligator bites and crawfish but couldn't tell which ones were which. Po'boys were alright, nothing special for their high prices.
Only positive thing at this place was the live jazz. Loved the music.
btw they had 3 stalls in the ladies room but 2 of them were completely trashed and flooded.

Dirty as hell no one here except my self and three other people . Staff seems to think standing around talking is more important then a clean restaurant . I would suggest if you like the food try a cleaner location . Lazy staff dirty store health board should take walk through ! Wait I understand they where waiting for a young lady to show up because as soon as sh got here she was sent to clean lobby area ! How is that fare when those three boys where standing around doing fuck all talk about lazy

I was impressed with the flavor of the food, really good. We ordered some wings, that I have to said that for me are the best in the area. Also we ordered turkey, brisket and ribs, juicy and with a nice smoked flavor. I recommend this place, give it a try. You will not regret it.

This place was *mostly* great. Our room was spacious, clean, and better than expected. (This is by no means a luxury hotel, and that's fine, because I certainly didn't feel like paying for one.) The room had a king bed, a sofa bed, and plenty of room for two rollaway beds - which was perfect since we were cramming four adult men in there. I liked that there were two TVs and a fridge. Every staff member we interacted with was super helpful and friendly. It's located within walking distance of everything we wanted to do and see downtown. Our main attraction for the trip was a concert at the Bridgestone arena and having the ability to WALK there was a real plus. Overall, this hotel offers great bang for the buck.

That all said, I did have two gripes - both of which relate to security. First, even though there is a big sign at the front desk that says "room keys will only be given to registered guests", one of my friends who arrived late convinced someone at the front to give him a key to my room by providing only my last name and the room number. Certainly, in this particular situation, my friend getting a room key was fine, but I can easily imagine situations where giving out a room key based on name and room number alone would be a serious violation of security. What if my friend and I had just gotten into a fight and he was seeking revenge by stealing my things? Anyway, I feel strongly that the staff should never give out room keys without proper authorization.

My second gripe was that the hotel's wifi is unencrypted. In today's world, where people get hacked left and right, this is just unacceptable and neither I nor any of my friends used the wifi during our stay. No wifi at all is better than unencrypted connections which leaves guests vulnerable to hackers.
Great spot to visit on a lazy Saturday or sunday. Great brunch and atmosphere. They have a DJ I believe Sunday's and menu has lots to choose from. We'll be back

I was excited to try this place because it's a Stephen Starr restaurant but I was disappointed. I got the Jones Nachos and the Chicken Ciabatta sandwich and both were average. Service was okay. The interior was really nice, it had a retro diner feel to it. Won't be going back but am looking forward to trying other Starr restaurants.

Everything about this place leaves something to be desired. The service was lackluster (took north of 20 minutes just to get our order taken in a nearly empty restaurant), the prices were quite expensive, and the food was just okay. If I'm paying that much for a full chicken with sides, I want it to be a good deal better than fast food chicken.
Long hours, good views and decent setup. Best in the area.

It's time to update my review since I wrote it back in 2017 (when they first opened). It's still 5 stars. Wish I could give it more after multiple visits and takeout orders. This is my favorite Thai restaurant. I love that they have a separate vegan menu with way more choices than any other restaurant. I'm not vegan, but I like the option and have found many wonderful items such as the eggplant basil stir fry, veggie spring rolls, and vegetable noodle soup. Everything they make is homemade including the sauces. There are no store bought sauces with added preservatives. They cook healthy and with lots of fresh veggies even in the regular menu items. They also don't skimp on the heat level. If you ask for it, you'll get it at whatever level you want. My husband won't go anywhere else but this place for Thai food. He's a Texan who loves spicy food. He gets his beef basil stir fry in Thai hot and absolutely loves it. He was actually the first person to recommend this restaurant to me. He happened to go there during one of my hospital visits. He said Preeda warned him of the spice level, and apparently was even impressed that he ate it all with no complaints. I asked him if it was Thai Boat. The previous restaurant that occupied that space (which was also good).  He corrected me and said that it's under new ownership and called Thai Legacy. We've been going ever since that time along with my mother.

We've been to all the other Thai restaurants in the area. They are all unique in their own way. I just like this one the best because of the variety. I've come to appreciate it even more after my recent visit to the Thai temple. I was drawn to the noodle soup and the flower teas at their Sunday market. I was craving that soup during the week so I pulled up the Thai Legacy menu and noticed that they have many variations of this soup on their menu. So far, I've had the pork noodle soup and the veggie one with tofu. The pork noodle soup has 4 different noodle options (small rice noodles, large rice noodles, yellow egg noodles, or clear bean noodles) and the veggie one has 3 types (no egg noodles). I got the clear bean noodles and asked for the spice tray on the side so that I could add my own heat. The takeout soup orders come with chili pepper spice, paste, and pickled jalapenos. It's a huge portion that can definitely be 2 meals or split between 2 people. It was so good, and reminded me of my morning at the Sunday market. It so comforting and I'm so happy that I can get it Tuesday thru Sunday when needed. I was also happy to see that they are now serving exotic iced teas such as Roselle Hibiscus, Butterfly Pea Flower, and Lemongrass tea. I've had the first 2 teas and they are refreshing. It's unlimited refills during lunch.

This restaurant gets better and better each time. It's a wonderful and hard-working family that owns it. They cook with love and health in mind. The service is always friendly and welcoming. They remember us every time we come in (especially my mother). We'll continue to return often.
All good tonight. Great food and service!!  Excellent follow up from restaurant staff. Thank you!

Went to  that office and the dr misdiagnosed me and prescribed wrong medicine. Told me I had a sty , I didn't think it was , even went back later to ask him where it was. He mumbled something, whatever....Next day went to another dr and got correct diagnosis and meds. What a waste of $200..awful!!!!!! Would give negative stars if I could.

This is great if you value quantity over quality.  There's nothing good here to eat.  It's all below mediocre even for a buffet.  The wings they hype up right now aren't even that good.  The place is cramped and there's no good set traffic flow.  Patrons spill food all over the place, serves are constantly running around trying to do too much it seems, and the bathrooms smell like hell.  This place exists for people who only care about eating a lot rather than eating something that tastes good.

Little gem is right! I travel to Boise 4x per year and always stop here for Thai food! I've had the salmon entree, pad Thai and the panang curry and have loved them all! Panang curry is probably my favorite as it has the perfect amount of spice and aromatics! Bonus-it's next to my hotel off of 84!

Super friendly and helpful!!

After my initial visit for a service, ended up going back with niggling issues (old bike). Every time I have gone in they are friendly, helpful, and sort out my issue on the spot, for free.

They're also very helpful with answering questions, teaching me how to fix things myself, and they've even given me free lights in the past!!

Love this place, highly recommend for service / repairs.

We had a very pleasant meeting in their extra room, the service was wonderful and the facility was perfect!  I have eaten in the Carson City Store several times and this one was much better!  Hats Off Guys ... A Great Job!  Thanks!

Food was fair, ribeye was cut wrong, service SUCKED! But Debbie was a help to make things right.  The waiter was not around much, when one in our party asked for desert, waiter said "we are out of most things" and walked away, he did not like to stay on the area, we were outside on patio. I will visit again, but will ask for Debbie, and will give her a proper tip. Also, this is another one of those restaurants that wants to push local beers, but craft brews rarely make lagers because they are harder to brew, so they have ales and IPA's but there are still a few of us who like lagers on draft, but I guess we are just SOL!

I enlisted the help of Devin & Pam to sell my ranch home outside the city. The Reese team performed excellent marketing and personal follow-up, they found the right buyer timely. Devin even helped me give the home a fresh exterior coat of paint! An example of going the extra mile for their clients. With their knowledge and resources, they were able to get a road maintenance agreement put together overnight so we could satisfy the lender's requirements again showing how they go above and beyond for their clients. I would recommend anyone looking to buy or sell in the Reno area to the Reese Realty Team.
Well priced. Family atmosphere. Won't knock your socks off, but a decent casual dinner.

Love this place. The Lunch buffet is such good value for money ($8.95 plus tax and tip) and they are constantly refilling with fresh food. Start with salad options then move to Indian choices then onto dessert with chocolate mousse and rice pudding then they bring you out a small dish of ice cream.

I want to give it a 4 but can't as Inconsistent.  Have been several times over past 3 years and has varied from really good to ok to bad.  Luckily I had been twice before bad or would not have gone back.  The night it was bad I happened to take 2 people who have never been I felt horrible for raving how good it was as they won't be back.  I ordered the same item I had 2 weeks prior and it was awful.  Most likely the inconsistency is in whoever is the chef that day?  Overall I would say it is good but I do agree with the other reviews that it is not as good as when it first opened and it is a weak wine pour. Great Atmosphere and outdoor tables.  The service is good and staff friendly.  Their French Onion soup may be one of best ever had and a great bloody mary.  My lunches have been better then dinners.  Worth a try.  
Large groups - go elsewhere they do discourage groups especially at lunch. Place is to small and not set up to accommodate anything other than a prefix menu for a party over 6.
Rad spot.  Super cool place, staff is a lot of fun, and great coffee!  Meridian has needed a place like this for a long time.

My family adopted a dog from the Media location 2 weeks ago. After they took our $800 for the puppy they told us they have no crates (which was part of the price evidently) and they would be in the next day. We waited 8 days (calling everyday and being told they would be in the next day) for a crate that was too small for the puppy. We used our free voucher they gave us for a vet visit and it ended up costing us $106 out of pocket  after finding out our puppy had kennel cough. I called the store and was told that's why they give you pet insurance and they were not going to reimburse us for the shots. When asking more they told me they could talk to the owner but they aren't responsible....seriously?! This place is a joke!!!!

We made it to the shellfish company for the second time on our visit to SB and it was even more delicious!

We started with the shrimp cocktail and then had a seafood pasta and the ciopino. The food was amazing. The ciopino came in a bread bowl and was messy but really good. The seafood was fresh and the atmosphere was great. We sat at the bar and got to watch the chefs cook. 

Note: we had about a 10 min wait to get in. This May be more or less depending on how flexible you are with the seating. Don't forget to put your name on the list! Highly recommended!

The worst hair cut ever given by the rudest stylist-owner ever.  Expensive too.  

That said i was referred by someone who is happy with stylist i saw.

Went to Medusa's to fix the holes this guy chopped into my hair and was most satisfied with both cut and person, even though it will take a few months for the holes Bouffant dude created to grow back in.

Great view, great service and great food (at a great price)!! Their grouper sandwich is amazing. Also tried the Hogzilla and it was killer. Get a rum runner while you are there, they are addicting. We go here EVERY time we are in the area. Right on the intercoastal and you can watch boats go by. Just a great place.
Wonderful homemade food. Great wait staff. Very enjoyable experience. And the market attached allows you to enjoy those homemade goodies at home. Went back 2 days in a row I was so impressed!

I like the vibe this place is going for and they have a great looking menu! We ordered our lunches to go, but I liked the setting and there is tons of seating both inside and outside.  

Albacore Sandwich - pretty good, a little salty. I think they could've used better bread like pretzel wheat so it wouldn't get soggy to fast.  It started falling apart halfway through 

Arugula Salad - nice and refreshing.  It's a pretty simple salad so the dressing made the salad what it was.  I wish the portions were bigger since it was pretty expensive for something I could easily make at home.

The service wasn't my favorite part of the restaurant.  There wasn't a long line, but the cashiers seemed to rush us.  They didn't welcome us or say 'thank you' at all.  I don't know about you, but that leaves a pretty big impression on me especially when the food wasn't amazing.

I would go back to try their baked desserts though!!

I love this place! It's a great hang out spot! You can bring your own food and drink and the instructors are the BEST! This place is also great for corporate events, birthday parties, bachelor and bachelorette parties! 

Also great location and pro tip you can get food delivered here and they bring it to your lane!

Cactus is a the perfect place for a low key night out with friends. Great prices for Main St, especially during the week with all of their specials. The food is super filling and the service is nice and efficient. You can tell how they all work as a team. Also I've been here a few times and the servers and bartenders really make an effort to remember your name. Very friendly! Great beer selection too!

They did a great job on the keratin treatment for my hair. One thing is that they claimed there was no formaldehyde used in the treatment, but when I started reading about the products used online I'm starting to doubt this. Can someone respond here on Yelp? What product do you use at Studio Green? 

http://www.ewg.org/hair-straighteners/our-report/hair-straighteners-that-hide-formaldehyde/

I loved the atmosphere the most. Our serve was awesome and very accommodating. My favorite things was the turtle latte and the herb dip that comes with the popovers. Both exploded with flavor. And I'm all about flavor, which can be hard to do with breakfast type foods. The popovers were huge! I definitely recommend this place for brunch with friends.

Small little coffee shop located centrally in the Hyde Park Village. Buddy Brew has great coffee with average prices. The staff is quick and pleasant. I got the cold brew with oat milk. I was a little disappointed that there wasn't any Sugar-Free options for syrups but I made do.

Pizza was delicious!! We got the pollo prosciutto and it was fantastic!! We asked for the balsamic on the side and they followed my requests and also called when they arrived. We will definitely be ordering again!! They were fast, courteous and food was wonderful!!!

The food was excellent. The service and atmosphere were great. If we lived in Nashville we would eat here often. Very reasonably priced.  I am a picky Italian food eater and refuse to pay a fortune for pasta.  This place had great tasting sauce and the pricing was perfect.

Just plain rude ass customer service. Oh and way too expensive and not worth stopping here. Walked in the door talk to the hostess two of them and I ended up turning right around and walked right out. Hope you have a better experience I will never returned

Lovely oasis near Carpinteria beach. Very pleasant to stroll the gardens. Beautiful lotus pond. Variety of trees. Feels like a mini Arboretum. Very easy to social distance while wearing a mask. Recommend it for a rejuvenating getaway. And the nursery looks nice too!

Ate there a couple weeks ago. My daughter had shrimp tacos and I had a shrimp boil.  Mine was ok, seemed overcooked and had absolutely no seasoning on it.  My wife had a very blank shrimp scampi, but they comp that meal and she got a friend scrimp basket to go.....so we paid for that instead of the scampi, unfortunately that was $20 for a total of ten scrimp.  2 dollars for cocktail size shrimp.  But at list the joint had a great view of the water!

New to the area during COVID 
The restaurant is dated but the food was delish!
Service was great and they practiced their cleanliness routine by wiping down menus and S& P
My husband and I were have a cheat day and shared the SOS and Texano Hash with 2 poached eggs.

My new go-to Chinese restaurant.  I was ordering from another location until I ordered their bourbon chicken.  I finally received bourbon chicken like I always got back home.  They delivered hot food, very quickly and with friendly service.
Grabs bottle of wine and any sandwich and head to the back patio! Everything is amazing! Oatmeal raisin cookie was something I can't forget.

Disappointed, from the very beginning the hostess was rude. Our waiter Carlos seemed rushed and not attentive at all, my sons food was last to come out and and it took forever and asking twice to get our check. The food was okay nothing spectacular. For the price you'd expect better food and service.

i've been telling my girlfriend about Devon for the last two years. Couldnt wait to take her based on my positive experiences from about 10 years ago.   I couldnt wait to treat her to oysters and Martini's.  I was extremely disappointed.  The oysters arrived NOT set on top of a bed of ice, but mushed into the melted ice.  The server put them there and watched as i held the oysters in place while i drained the water.  When the martini's arrived there was too much room at the top of the glass.  Too much cash for too little 'tini.  The Cioppino was average at best.  Oh well, at least the biscuits were phenomenal as was the chocolate lava cake with coffee.  Definitely won't be back.

The good old dog was recommended to me... if you like blue cheese then this is your go to. There is a wide selection of beers, but I guess like anywhere else in Philly it's pricey for beer. I also went with a dessert that was dark chocolate, caramel, and sea salt... WOW that thing was good! It's a small portion, but worth the $6 in my opinion.
Love this place. Dylan the new owner, is an incredibly talented bartender. His experience doesn't stop with the carefully crafted drinks, but his personality and service are above and beyond.

Delicious and all around fantastic experience!

Convenient location and easy parking, which is sometimes difficult in the area.

BYOB- I love bringing my own favorite reds and whites!

You can tell from the second the food is presented and with every bite that care & time was taken with every step. This place really gives you the feeling of comfy/cozy meal with family /friends, but with top-notch service... like having your own personal chef in your house. Mark (chef/owner) is great. The dishes are original enough that they are interesting, but stay true to the cuisine that the restaurant is based upon. 

Prepare to sit, relax and enjoy a fantastic dinner. I think my favorite aspect of this restaurant is the service. I never feel rushed. It drives me crazy when a server is delivering the next course when I'm not done the one before. Never the case here. I want to enjoy my company as much as I want to enjoy my dinner, which is the norm at Da Soli. 

Suggestions...

Apps: Grilled calamari, House-made sausage

Pasta: Gnudi Alla Genovese

Entrees: Short ribs! My husband LOVED the veal

Dessert: rissoto/rice pudding and home made ice creams
They have been really slacking on the amount of brownie they are putting in their thick N chunkies. 3/4 of the cup is just ice cream. Step it up guys!
Amazing food. Every. Single. Visit. Grab a Cuban sandwich and head over to Green Bench for a beer!

I was not feeling this sandwich at all. Next time I will get a sub from Publix, at least they can toast and press it. How can a sub place only serve one kind of cheese? Honestly I don't know what the hype is about their place. Even my server seemed she didn't want me to get the meal.

Love it!   Has the salmon for lunch and came back for dknner!   Great Scotch eggs, Irish tea and mixed drinks too. If you want to great live music..Make reservations!   The other side of the restaurant has unique decor.

Yes, really good NY style pizza. Thin crust, nice sauce lots of varieties to choose from. They have a really good breakfast pizza, but they often are not open early enough as my flights are often the 0600 flights. They are proud of their product (meaning their prices are a bit high), but it's a tastier treat than Burger Thing, next door.

We had the wings and they were OK. Sauce very oily and a little bland.  The salsa was full of cumin and bland.  The drinks were OK.  The Caesar dressing was watery and full of lemon.  Again fair but could be a little better.

First time to the new location in Carrollwood. Excellent customer service and they were very willing to accommodate our food changes. Very nice atmosphere with comfortable seating. The staff is very engaging and checked back frequently to make sure we had what we needed! We will definitely be back!

I'm sorry like your manager was sorry and I won't be returning to your car washes any longer. This day and age it's sad that you have chosen not give great customer service and dry out my mirrors like usual because your car wash does not dry my entire car. Now I have spots all over my mirrors and sides of my car. There are plenty of less expensive choices out there!
Food is really good. Selection of beers is above average. The vibe inside and out is really good and the place is usually very busy.

Presentation of the Place: The Bathrooms are nice. It reminds you of  an overpriced hotel that you can feel fancy in while taking a dump. The inside of the place reminds me of an amalgamation of the sets of Cheers, Sex in the City, and some French Noir.

The Food: 

Starter:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs

So, this is the first of many dishes were the common complaint is the lack of salt in the food. From the egg, filling, and crab itself, everything was void of salt or seasoning except for what was a little paprika. The textures are boring and 1 dimensional. For 8 dollars, you are getting 3 deviled eggs at the lowest effort of innovation and care. It is something with less flavor and passion than the ones you are partaking in during Thanksgiving at your grandmas.

Brussels Sprouts with Garlic Aioli and Grated Parmesan.

The Brussels sprouts are cooked exceptional well, which is rare. This is ruined, by the lack of salt and seasoning again. I assume this is due to the amount of Parmesan shaved on top of the dish. This gives the dish an overwhelming umami flavor, and it forces you to reach for the garlic aioli to counter it. After about 10 bites, you begin to realize how white you are because you are essentially eating cheese and mayo. 


Entrees:

Ratatouille with filet

No salt on the filet on top. No salt in the dish itself. What is on the Filet is a lot of balsamic vinegar, which is overpowering. The tomato paste hasn't been stewed long enough, so the dish is really acidic especially with the amount of balsamic vinegar being used.  

Quail and Boudin

This dish is weird. If you ever had a fever dream and was wondering man I wish I could eat that, this is what it taste like. The portion of boudin and quail you get is actual small for the price. Guess what the quail doesn't have on it? The fry on the quail isn't good and the breading breaks offs. The chicken gumbo taste so strange like they almost put soy sauce in it and also has notes of sour. The boudin is really good and is the oasis in this odd dish. 


Drinks:

1 Bottle of the Smith and Hook. Your standard Cabernet nothing flashy.
 
Service: 

I usually don't critique service. I understand that we all take breaks at work, but man no water refills, the restaurant isn't busy, and people from the pass are having to bring our food. This is happening while you and your bartender friend are talking the entire time. Not a good look hombre.  

Verdict: A Salty No

If you want to have a glass of wine with the girls or boys, while you look out at Poydras St. I guess this is the place for you. In my opinion, there are far better options location and culinary wise for you to go to.

Wait times are god awful. Waited over an hour to be seated at the bar with 3 people. Would tell you about the food if I could taste anything but disappointment right now.

Update: got seated, got a chipped water glass. Not goin well so far

Update 2: Food was pretty good, reasonably priced.
So happy they were open! Always a treat when I come to the beach. I had the egg, bacon and cheese on a croissant and a latte. Everything was fantastic and the service was top notch. Thanks ladies!

Exceptional service from Daniella!! We went to sockeye for a birthday dinner. We arrived an hour early for happy hour and enjoyed the seasonal flight plus beef nachos with fresh jalapeos. We enjoyed Daniellas personalized service, food, and beer. The entrees were fantastic I had the house salad plus skewers of tiger shrimp the dressing (ranch and basil vinaigrette) was off the hook!! My guy had had the French dip with garlic fries (recommended by Daniella) she said it was the "best seller" and ya we know why! It was AWESOME!! The garlic fries are a must have!! Don't get the rice pilaf it was chewy sockeye is legit!! We are very happy with our visit here. Their Covid 19 is also in alignment with governors orders we had to wear masks when not at our table and the space was super clean. We will be back

I started going to Premier a few months ago for my back pain. It's still early in the process, so I am not at the point where I know the outcome of my treatment yet.

The staff their is super friendly. I rarely wait much at all before I can check in.

The nurse who typically takes me back is about the sweetest person their is. She has a very upbeat personality, and takes in interested in you as a person. She is also good at her job.

The doctor I see is Dr. Kelly Scollon-Grieve. She has a great bedside manner. She is both knowledgeable and friendly. She also cuts to the chase, something I really like in a doctor. This combination allows her to be on time. I am almost always in on time and out within a very reasonable time.

Great Ortho Office, I highly recommend it.

I was looking forward to trying Blake's, so I stopped in with my parents for lunch. It wasn't prime time, but there was no one there, so that wasn't a great sign. I ordered a green chile lotaburger and onion rings.

I was really disappointed in the burger. I got a single patty and maybe I should've gotten a double. The patty was thin and dry, not much meat on the burger at all. The bun was huge, way too much bread. They were generous with the toppings, but a burger should feature the meat. The green chiles had a nice kick. And the onion rings were decent. Three burgers, two drinks, and two orders of rings was just over $20. Maybe a tad pricey considering the drinks and rings were size small, and my mom got the little (itsa) burger.

No issues with the service. It was okay, not especially friendly. No real response from the cashier when we mentioned it was our first time either. If I come back, I may try the breakfast burritos and hope they're better than the burger.

VERY Expensive. Sometimes you will see a specialist ($240) and sometimes you will see a regular vet ($40). They do not tell you until after the appointment who you saw.  Then they overcharge the other services.  In addition, you have to wait for the students so the entire process takes about 3 hours.  They recommended that my dog have a tooth extracted ($2500) that eventually fell out on its own.  They will suggest procedures that are unethical, unnecessary and expensive. This is a DANGEROUS facility and they do unnecessary work at a very high price. DO NOT go here. Vet officials need to check this place out. Furthermore, the only positive reviews on here likely come from the vets that work at the hospital

First off they have an awesome collection of indo fusion recipes - will be trying that next. The first trip was for regular indian food and it hit the spot! Absolutely delicious yummylicious excellent soul food! The chef is from Mumbai and his creations will make you nostalgic if you are from the city! Portion size is just right!
If i were here longer this would be my go to Indian place!
Workers are extremely friendly I go there every Wednesday after church.My coffee collata is always perfect I recommend this dunkin donuts if you are nearby
Charged 1.95 to deliver beyond a tip.  Cheesy bread sticks were a hit.
Service is impeccable. It's the loveliest restaurant in Conshohocken. The owner knows how to take care of his guests.

Whiskey selection is great.  Nice selection of craft beers.  Food is not bad. I've been here for dinner and it was packed. Service was kind of slow, I guess that's expected.  Also been here late night for drinks, bartender was knowledgeable and attentive. 

Back again for lunch. Seated right away even though place looked pretty full.  Food was hot and taste great. Can't say anything particularly stood out besides the whiskey selection.  I'd come back for lunch before dinner.

Pork sandwich was tasty but a little dry. Flavor was very unique. Prices are expected for this area. Our server Kaillie was awesome. The gal bringing out the food acted like she didn't want to be there. Everyone seemed to be fine.

Fire Finch, a cute little store just off Broadway. It is a very small store, but they manage to pack it with a lot of merchandise. The upper level is clothing while the first floor is accessories, gifts, bags, ect. They carry Hobo brand handbags and wallets which is one of my favorite lines for leather goods. Some of the jewelry I found to be a bit on the expensive side. After sampling, I ended up buying a lotion by Library of Flowers...I am such a sucker for anything American made, small-batch blah blah blah. It does smell nice and the feel is luxurious so I thought it was a good buy. The girl working sat behind the counter the whole time tagging merchandise. I am not sure if she spoke at all. I wasn't sure If I was expected to do a hand signal to check out or not. I think she muttered a thank you at the end, but its questionable.
An hour to get our order of Chicken fingers and fries and Sliders with fries and when it came the food was cold.

OUTSTANDING....Service is great, drinks are top notch and the food tastes amazing and they give you enough food for each dish to feed 3 small families.  
The decore of the resturant is inviting and yet classy.  We have sat in the resturant several times for dinner and lunch and had drinks and watched a game at the bar before.  Great tap list.

Try the fries they are really good.

Nice atmosphere.  The layout of the place hasn't changed much since it was Spence, but the bar is bigger and there is a small stage.

I ordered the Chipotle BBQ Wings.  Very good wings, went down smooth with a happy hour special Red Stripe.  This place is definitely worth checking out.

If you're visiting NOLA for the first time, get out of the city and visit this place. Located next to the New Orleans Museum of Arts. 

This place is HUGE. So many plants to see and explore. 

I would recommend about 2 hours at this place to fully explore everything here. There is an admission fee. 

My favorite part is the green room in the large building in the middle of the garden!

Ordered the Plantsgiving meal and it was delicious. Every part of the meal was done well. The pumpkin tamale for dessert was super yummy. I really appreciated that they made a entire plant based meal. Even though they are across town from me, I will be ordering from them again. Their staff is very friendly as well.
We been coming here for a while now the snowballs are delicious. The man who usually there so friendly! Love to see it
