Giving it a 3 because i could barely read the menu it got so dark. Anytime i have to pull out the cell phone is a problem.

the waitress was good enough.  nothing spectacular there, but she was friendly.  the food was good.  had the lemon rosemary chicken.  Very juicy and very flavorful.  the potatoes were a little undercooked though.  And possibly the chicken too. the next morning lets say i was not feeling to well.  I would have checked the chicken for doneness if, oh i don't know, if i could SEE!!  

The photos form the early 1900's of U.City were an awesome touch.  Loved those.  

All in all, i will try again.

Was a little disappointing because it was so small. About 1/2 the size of Johnny Cash's down stairs. Being a fan it was amazing to see her clothes and see the real history.  My favorite was her wedding albums and family pics.  If you love her go. But I don't think it was worth the price.

For a restaurant that I've walked out of once because of poor service, you may be surprised to hear that I like Champps a lot and go there regularly. Honestly I think it's more than just sports bar food as some have stated.  I actually like the nachos a lot whereas some seemed critical.  Some of the regular dinner dishes are very good too. Wings are very good.  Excellent beer selection.  A couple of the longer-term wait staff are really very good, friendly and engaging.  I agree that the host/hostess staff can be inattentive at times. There's also one particular female server there that is so disorganized that I can't have her serve us anymore.  Overall it's worth the chance of the infrequent mishap.

We are so torn on our experiences at Tayst.  

First the Main Tayst (main course) are amazing!!!  It is really the reason we keep coming back.  The sturgeon is AMAZING!  Really, the best I have ever had.  All the meats have full flavor but still stay true to the natural flavor of the meat. Proteins are cooked exactly how they are ordered. 

The Pumpkin soup is delicious.

The atmosphere is great.  Decor is comfortable.  Music is right on. 

But here are the downsides...
~ We made reservations, but still had to wait for over 30 minutes for our    
   table.
~ We are pretty convinced they water-down some their booze.  I know that seems ridiculous, but there have been a number of times that we have ordered different things that we are very familiar with outside of the restaurant and they tasted diluted.  At first I thought we were crazy, but there was something not right.  On the upside, the staff is very nice and (although they thought we were crazy) exchanged it for something else.
~ Service is very, very slow.  We usually enjoy taking our time and eating at a slow pace...enjoying our food and wine.  But they are very slow to take initial drink orders and to get courses out.  

We love that the establishment is Green and very local for ingredients!  The chef is very friendly and makes his way out to the dining room and greets guest, which is a nice touch.

Overall, if you want great food and aren't picky about the rest go on in... you will not be disappointed!

Awesome spot! The tour was fun and informative and the drinks were great. Very cool to see the behind the scenes and immediately be able to try their liquors after the tour. They have a wealth of knowledge about distilling and I'd highly recommend if you're looking for something fun, different, and exciting to do with 2 or 10 people.
Super friendly staff and good drinks why go to star bucks when you can support the local community 1 block down the road

This is not my regular Schnucks. However, whenever I am heading home from Costco and cutting down Loughborough to Hampton, I stop by for items I just cannot buy in bulk at the warehouse store for a single man. 

In my original review, which is now several years old, I complained about the produce department. Wow, things have really changed. I will now say this is one of the better produce departments in STL. It's always fresh, organized and well stocked.

I've also gotten use to the lay-out and can shop the aisles with ease. Another area that is pretty good, is the butcher counter. Give me those pork steaks for that backyard grilling. 

The staff has done a full Three-Sixty on their attitudes. Even during this pandemic when everyone seems to be on the edge, they were upbeat and positive.

While shopping during the COVID pandemic, I felt safe with all the safety precautions this store had in place. 

Will I return? - For, sure. 

When: June 4, 2020
Why: Grocery items I cannot buy in bulk.

The Peppermill is by all standards as good as it gets for Reno casino's. It's Vegas-like, but with a Reno vibe. Bright and clean, lots of neon and rotating nature scenes on huge screens from various arts of the world. They've got everything you would expect from a large property. Sports book, restaurants, plenty of gaming and convention space as well as various themed bars throughout. What can I say? Peppermill is by far the jewel of reno casino's.

Hands down the best spot in all of Philly! I'm actually partial toward their ice cream more than the water ice but always opt for the gelati where you can do two flavors of water ice with ice cream in between. The water ice is so fresh and not too sweet since they make it with real fruit. The ice cream is my favorite (the raspberry chocolate chip is to die for) in all of the city! Nothing beats a cup of water ice and ice cream in the summer! A must get if you are in the area and so affordable compared to other dessert spots! I wish I had pictures to share but I'm always too focused on eating and enjoying it :)
Reservationists not well informed.  Planned a whole day at their spa based on misinformation provided and then had to cancel.

I took our daughter's car there to get her catalytic converter replaced.  She had taken it to Nissan where she was told it had to be replaced.  They told her the new one would only have a 1 year 12,000 mile warranty.  We found that Quick Muffler gave a 5 year warranty and the price was better.  More important was the person we dealt with.  He had a great personality assuring me her car would be taken care of properly.  He was right.  We will be back now for oil changes and any other work that may be needed on her car as well as our cars.

Wish I could give this more stars! Heard of this place from a friend and was excited to try since the owner, Nina Compton, competed on Top Chef.

Everything here looks good but we decided on the coconut french toast, chicken hash (special) and the truffle and poached eggs. So good. 

Decor is super cute too. They open at 10am and weren't quite ready to seat people / lack of communication but other than that a fantastic experience.

Cozy & dark hideaway feel. A mix of music videos play throughout the lounge. Beautiful water-fire pit. Bartenders are great. I like this place to relax, gamble & enjoy their wide variety of mixed drinks. Pleasant little nooks to unwind throughout the lounge.

Delicious- reasonably priced- unique- and staff is extremely friendly!! A great place to bring visitors, family, or even a "imma treat myself" spot- I've never had shaved ice like this but after having Hawaiian shaved ice I feel spoiled and don't think I can go back to regular shaved ice ever again! This place is a must and I highly recommend adding the ice cream and the mochi to your order!

Doc Brien rocks! He made me feel welcomed the moment I walked in the door and the place was packed. I later brought my son in and it was the same experience. He has the place decorated in relaxing colors and has great reading material. His adjustments work and he is great at what he does.

The first time I went to big brand tires I came in saying that I needed all new tires and they convinced me otherwise. Since I have been back when I thought I heard a strange sound and a technician went for a drive with me to listen. I was just back today for my free tire rotation and their customer service is still great. I definitely trust these guys and have a great experience every time I go. Special shoutout to Ivan and his team!
Montrel"s is closed! The resto was cited over 75 times for health violations and failed to pay its bills! Shame and sad story!!

As awesome as the fig and prosciutto flatbread sounded, it turned out to be a huge disappointment.  Wished I've tried one of the other food truck vendors at a recent event in Downtown Tampa instead!  However, this one sounded fresh, healthy and so gourmet.  Huge mistake!  And, at the price point of $12, I really couldn't have been more disappointed.  Literally ate two small pieces and trashed the rest away.

menu not so impressive but food is fresh and delicious.  Items on the "side item" list are a little silly but doesn't bother me. Service is great. We were able to change our order to take out and there were no problems-we changed only because we were short on time. 
Nice quaint little joint! can't wait to go back!
Very nice hotel. It was clean and comfortable. Nothing was at all wrong with the hotel and I enjoyed my stay.

I came here several times for social events and can't find anything good from this place.
It takes a while for the server to get me menu or even a glass of water.
The food is mediocre, nothing special. Meh quality...

The food here is mostly good. On the occasion that they get my order wrong the manager usually offers something up in return (which I usually decline; but appreciate the gesture). My biggest complaint would have to be the fact that every time I go in, a solid 5-6 minutes passes before I'm ever acknowledged. Sometimes I have to initiate the conversation all together which kind of bugs me. I know my standards are higher having worked in customer service forever, but this should definitly be changed. Just FYI: People don't like being ignored when they are spending money.
Older place. Needs updating and a good cleaning. Breakfast mediocre, the juice was warm and the OJ was a juice drink. Was ok for an overnight.
This place is amazing. There is a wide assortment of pastries including incredible almond croissants and macarons. I can't wait to come back!

Great place!! Atmosphere is lively. Nice bar. Great service! Had the Mardi Rita, grilled oysters 2 ways, crab cakes and fried alligator. Everything is so good. Can't wait to do breakfast/brunch! Love this place

The food was ok,  nothing to rave about. I went in on a Saturday evening with a group of several ladies. We arrived around 8:00pm and ordered at 8:20pm. I ordered a Caesar salad and the cauliflower steak. The salad came about 30 minutes later and the cauliflower steak came out an hour later. The service was lacking.
Tina was an amazing waitress, she took such good care of us. Food was good too.

This place was really good and it was a lot bigger than I thought it was.  We had reservations and were seated in the back right next to the kitchen as we watched them cook all the food.  The restaurant was busy and crowded and the service was nice and attentive.  One thing that we didn't enjoy too much (nothing against the restaurant itself) was this party of women across the room from us, and I swear one of the women had a laugh similar to a witch's cackle.  It was hard to enjoy our dinner when she was going off every 5 minutes.  No hard feelings for people enjoying their own dinners and having a good time but I wish they were more mindful of being inside around others.

We had the crispy Brussels sprouts to begin and they were roasted to perfection.  We shared the slow cooked oxtail ragout with a side of the baked jalapeno cheesy grits.  All of the food was so good.  The oxtail was tender and the grits were also so tasty.  I would come here again to try other items off of the menu for sure.

Nails by yen is the best nail salon in Tucson. The staff is so kind and nice. Their atmosphere is amazing. When I say this I really do mean it, I recommend nails by yen to absolutely all of my friends. I went to another nail salon in the area and it was plain horrible. I would like to say that David did my nails and they came out perfect. I had black almond acrylics done and they came out so good! Right I walked in I was greeted and they told me to pick out a color. They have so many colors and you can find anything you want. The prices are perfect, actually with all the experience and how good my nails came out, you get a great deal. The nail technicians are so experienced and I can happily say I will be coming back in the future!

Excellent food, great customer service, nice location.
Hidden gem with authentic Cuban cuisine

Worst 3-star+ hotel experience of my life.  My company was there Tues-Fri for a conference, I paid fir 7 rooms for my team.  1 room had barely been cleaned, with trash still in the room & pubes on toilet.  1st nite our 2000 person conference had a welcome party at Falls Bar.  2 bartenders. The bar manager stood around doing nothing, while lines stacked up.  After waiting 45 minutes for a drink with no progress we, like hundreds of others, left.  The rest of the bars/restaurants were either closed or closed early (at 10ish) leaving everyone to go off site to extend any client entertainment.  You can only blame Covid for so long-pay damn bartenders $100/hr and you still make money (a lot!). During the day, you basically had the pizza restaurant (decent and guy from Egypt forget name was nice & wonderful), the convenience store (long lines) or the Cascade restaurant buffet, WAY overpriced & mediocre at best.  The Steakhouse was the only fining highlight--good value on wine list-but when you pay $1200 (8 of us) it better be good.  At $100/nt it would be average-at $200+ simply unacceptable (and over $10k for my team). I called the Spa on Tues to ask if they had a steam room and they said yes, but failed to tell me it was 'Closed due to Covid' WTF! And only open 9am-430p (during our conference???) so no way to steam anyway when I wanted to at 7a or 5p.  Upon arrival we were talking about coming back for our Spring conference-by end of week we decided Motel 6 would be a better option in Nashville.  Again, tired of the 'Covid Excuse'. Completely unacceptable
The Naan was super dry. The chicken masala was mediocre. Definitely not recommended given the high rating it currently has. The delivery service was ok.

I decided to give this place a try because they have the SNS nail dip power. The decor is beautiful but the staff is not professional or upscale. The nail techs are loud and share each others emery boards and electric nail drills without cleaning them between clients. I had to ask my nail tech to clean the electric nail drill prior to drilling/shaping my nails. I saw none of the five nail techs clean any of their equipment. My nails are okay. But I'll not be returning. The nail stations should be cleaner and the music was too loud as if it was a night club.

This is by far the worst CVS that I've ever been to the lady that's always working is awful she's probably one of the worst employees I've ever seen. She's so rude and not helpful at all. I drive out of my way to go to a different cvs just so I don't have to deal with her. Amanda is her name and she acts like it's the end of the world when she needs to help someone. Their self check out system isn't very good and requires an employee every time and she literally throws a fit every time.

Honestly I gave this restaurant 3 tries and it's a no for me. First I tried a a salmon wrap the salmon literally taste like sand like they just heated it up and served it to me. Second I tried a salmon Cesar salad again the salmon just taste like pure sand dry and sad. Third I tried a beyond burger and it just taste like charcoal. It's like they'll blackened it for the effect to look good but forget the taste is what really matters I'm starting to wonder if they have any seasoning in their kitchen or at this point fire the cook!

If you're looking for a great charcuterie board look no further. My friend and I went on a Saturday afternoon for an early happy hour and charcuterie board. We came to The C House because they had parking and were not too busy. We also liked their patio for open air seating. They are enforcing physical distancing and mask requirements as well. I got a delicious cocktail and my friend and I split the 5 option charcuterie board. We were able to choose 5 options of a list of cheese and meats. The board also came with a healthy portion of grapes, champagne onions, honey, mustard, pickled green beans, and of course bread! It was delicious and a great snack that was basically a meal with how large the portions were!
The person who answered my phone call was knowledgeable and gave me very good advice.

Delicious hand made pasta.  Decent sized portions.  Smaller place so definitely make an appointment if you're going on peak hours/weekends.  Wait staff is hit or miss--i feel like they get busy and forget to check back for drinks,  bills, etc and we frequently have to flag them down.

We found this little place for breakfast. We had traditional New Orleans fare including grits and mimosas. 

Portions were generous and everything was delicious. The place is small and can get crowded, but the wait staff is super friendly and attentive. I wasn't able to get exactly what I wanted as they were out but the waitress suggest something else that was wonderful. .

J's is combination of two stands nestled in the French Market with outdoor seating. It has two sections - a stand with cooked food and then an oyster bar.

I was really looking forward to their crab claws, which they were out of, so my friends and I ordered the crawfish beignets, crawfish pie, and the fried crawfish tails. Everything we had was just okay, and nothing stood out besides the charisma of the employees.

I wanted to give a 4 stars but due to broken displays, lack of items for kids. For example the top floor has a nice water display. Kids were using ping pong balls to watch the flow. Which was great but 10 kids fighting over 4 balls was not fun. Second floor had broken touchscreen, the outside deck had a train pull display that clearly had missing part. There is going to be a lot of wear and tear with a place like this. Having spares would be a good idea for quick fix.
Love this place! I've been coming here for years for waxing. Natalie is the best! Great service! They make you feel very relaxed and welcome.
Bad customer service and employees very rude and not seem to be familiar with there schedule got the at 8pm and online said it was closed at 9 and told us we were to late.

This is always a pleasure. The atmosphere is fantastic. Our waitress was a bit confused and we didn't all get the things we ordered, but she was so sweet and called everybody "lovey", that nobody even got upset about the orders being mixed up a bit. 
The bacon here is absolutely the best. Nice and crisp without being burned beyond recognition. The coffee is great and the omelettes rock. 
The biscuit and gravy are another story though. It's more like a slice of bread and the gravy was just odd. The whole thing did neither look nor taste like biscuits and gravy. So if that is a favorite dish of yours, don't order it.

The quality of the food is exceptional always consistent...especially the rice/beans.
The salsa bar is on point especially the Pico de Gallo.

The only drawback is the parking or the lack of it!

This Dental Group was proffesional & caring.They are organized & excellent. Dr.Charles Wu was great & so kind.He knows what his doing & always ready &willing to answer your questions.Staff are nice& friendly.Price is reasonable.Clean environment.Xray&Cleaning was amazing!.Highly Recommended!!!

overpriced.
zero customer service.
place needs a renovation of the building and overhaul of mgmt.
1 star for view.

My friend who goes to Boston University told me that, on my next visit, we had to go to Legal Sea Foods. Unbeknownst to me, I was destined to visit Legal way before my next trip to Boston. (forgive my theatrical and suspenseful tone... I just finished Harry Potter)

This Sunday, I had the pure joy to dine at the new location in KOP mall. I really didn't know what to expect so I will take you through my journey.

The atmosphere itself was very confusing. Legal's began as a family owned fish market that branched into the restaurant business in the early mid 1900's. The atmosphere was a weird jumble between high class dining, a homey feel and funky. It was weird. The wood tables, fixtures and decor, gave it the more expensive look. But the paper place mats and the people who worked there detracted from that classy feel. 

The way the servers interacted reminded me of Fridays or a restaurant of that nature, not of a place who's cheapest entree was low $20's. Not saying that they were not very nice but they way they talked and kidded with each other while on the floor, the way that some servers had nose rings and cornrows was a bit out of place for a restaurant that was obviously attempting to go for the more high-class, expensive atmosphere.

Also, the blue and white rectangular light fixtures on the ceiling confused the atmosphere even more, giving it more of a funky, Stephen Starr look.

Needless to say, I was wary before ordering the food. I decided upon the calamari appetizer, Kung Pow Shrimp Wok and the Bananas Foster. The calamari was delicious but a tad oily from the sauce. The entree and dessert were two of the best decisions that I have made in my life. Te Wok was deliciously spicy, with pineapples and peanuts. And they were not stingy with the shrimp. It was served in a mini wok and DELICIOUS. The bananas foster was.... wow. Heaven to my mouth, a delight to my taste buds, it was AMAZING.

Also, the bathrooms were pretty cool. :)

I definitely recommend Legals to anyone who is more concerned with the taste of the food, rather than the mish-mosh atmosphere.
Outstanding food & service !  My wife was impressed.  Ravioli & salad were very good. Small, intimate setting.  Friendly servers.  Fun place.

One of my top 5 places in Tucson! Located on the edge of 4th and University (street is currently under construction 5-5-12) it is a fantastic breakfast/lunch/dinner/late night choice for food and drinks.  Free Wi-Fi and a "hipster," vibe makes this a hotspot for students and others.  Prices are fair and the menu is extensive.  A new after midnight menu Thursday-Saturday is my favorite newest addition.

I'm a foodie and this place is paradise. Zuzu's kitchen is a hidden takeout spot in Fairmont that is an absolute gem. I've tried almost everything from their mouth watering Zuzu's burger to their delicious pizzas and their already famous Zuzu's Chicken sandwich. All I can say is..I have never once been disappointed. Whether you are picking up or getting delivery I highly recommend trying Zuzu's kitchen for its freshness, quality, balance and innovative twists to traditional quick eats.
I have ordered from Wing Hing's for years. I have tried other places but no one holds a candle to Wing Hing's food. It is so fresh and good.

The SPR is good if you want to have a beer, but the few times I have gone to eat dinner, the food has been inconsistent. The desserts almost always hit the mark, but the entrees can be only so so. I have also had pretty poor service and am consistently annoyed by one particular waitress. I think they put more emphasis on beverage service than anything else, and in that area they are pretty great, always an interesting beer selection.

We had 25+ pies delivered for lunch, that arrived exactly on time and very hot. This is the local favorite of our office. 

The pizza and the customer service is much better than the other, more popular places in Pennington. We will definitely be ordering our pizza from here in the future.

An OG diner with awesome food. My only problem was I couldn't decide what to order so our table looked like a buffet and we walked out with a ton of leftovers. Our server (I think Mary) was as sweet as could be. Owner was a great guy too. You can't go wrong for breakfast, lunch or dinner at Mama's!!

If you cannot find something on the menu that you like, then you must be a very, very picky eater.  When shopping at the outlet mall, I always stop here for lunch.  The diverse, ever changing menu is wonderful.

There are many beers and wines by the glass and the prices cannot be beat.  The menu is cutting edge for a nationwide chain, with many healthy choices.

I have to add the staff at the bar are seriously well trained and/or motivated...they never stop and they remain friendly.  Specifically Julie and Ashton.  They are amazing!

They have a mobile app and Rewards program which adds to the overall positive experience.

What a fun community event this was.  Had I not been a Yelp judge, I may not have even bothered to go.  Sometimes we just don't take advantage of the things that are right in our own backyard (figure of speech.. this was just a few blocks away).

After the disappointment of having an hours' delay in judging... the actual judging was fun.  Of course, it was pretty fast-paced eating.  15 wings in roughly 45 minutes is some serious heartburn waiting to happen... no matter how good the wings were.  While I enjoyed many of the flavors offered during our 4 PM tasting, I;m sad to say nothing jumped out to say "you gotta get some of this."  Maybe that was in the earlier or later tastings.  I should say, that nothing was awful... they were all good, except the last two options...14 was HOT, 15 was SUPER HOT.. took one bite and put it down.  Although I did hear about a maple/bacon flavored wing (I didn't get this one).  Would I do it again.... absolutely.  A shaded place to sit under a tent, nice an comfortable, plenty of wings, water, and a couple of drink coupons to boot.  How can you go wrong.

During the delay... what could you do.. go home or go into the casino... really what was the option.  Thanks for the delay.. I'm $300 richer (thanks Eldorado).

So get out there fellow Reno"ites"... live music, good eating, and the being part of the community.  Downtown Reno is no longer the scary place it used to be 10  years ago.  Once this event is over and in between the many events held during the summer... come on down, the river is flowing and there are pool areas for swimming, check our our new bridge, check out the shops in The Underground (old Post Office), and check out all the new local restaurants, and there are quite a few top notch restaurants in the Eldorado, Silver Legacy (host of the Wing Fest) and even Circus Circus.

I never write a review but I felt compelled to write this. Bar was not stocked. We waited over 20 minutes for our drinks. When drinks came they were not made correctly. Bathroom was filthy. Food was delicious.

It's nice to have a shower and a free bar but the breakfast food is SHIT here. 
Staff is friendly. Decor is pleasing. Coffee machine is good WHEN IT ACTUALLY WORKS...

Sunday morning, after a Saturday in Nashville, we want FOOD! Showed up around the 12 and got a booth immediately. Awesome. Food was sooo good, what we had. Bloody Mary was great. My friend had some raspberry champagne and it was very bubbly, but great if you love that stuff! I'd come back and recommend it. We even went to the shop on the next floor! Do it. And make your way to the rooftop bar. You won't be disappointed around the fire pits.

This is my favorite restaurant in town. The service is wonderful and the chefs are very enthusiastic. I recommend getting the shrimp and steak combo for dinner before 7 pm! Would definitely come back when visiting Santa Barbara.

Really good Seafood stop.  Love any of their soups.  And all seafood, blackened or fried.   Grouper is great either way!
The workers are always very nice even during the 'round noon busy time!!!!  A few of us....cohorts....go 2 or 3 Fridays a month and Maderas never fails!
AND once in a while we get rewarded with a freeby of something good....a nice bonus.
Their muscles was not that good.  But the lobster ravioli was incredible. And the waiter and other help was very good. Would definitely go back

Fantastic modern take on traditional Sonoran food.

Absolutely try the bone marrow, sooooo good!

Tortillas are amazing, they are clearly homemade.

We really, REALLY want to love this place but after two visits the odds are not in its favor. Since it's owned by the folks who brought us 1111 Mississippi and Vin de Set, we had high expectations but this place falls down on the little things--which many of the reviewers have noted. After the first (meh!) visit we thought it was a fluke. But 0 for 2?; shame on me if I make it 3. I think it shows how hard it is to consistently deliver a quality pie and we should appreciate even more those (few!) places in The Lou that do so.

First the good: the interior is (mostly) awesome. Exposed brick, open kitchen, halfway between warehouse and loft space. Folks from Boston will love it! The sausage: house made fennel sausage! Awesome. The red sauce: exquisite! Just the right balance of sweet and hot (arrabiata). Loved it! The thin crust is crispy with nice bubbling, not sweet. A total absence of provel makes this a love it or hate it kinda place--depending on how you like your pie.

The bad: the lighting! This requires a serious overhaul. Can lights placed where they do no good; halogen spots shine in your eyes. Good luck reading a menu, spotting your waiter, or enjoying the sights. Go during the day if you can! The A/C will blow you out of the place. I realize this is to balance the heat put out by the gas ovens in the open kitchen but yeesh! Bring a sweater or hoodie. You'll need one!

First time, we ordered The Wolf. Very greasy to the point of soggy. Second time, half Hawaii Five-O; half sausage, onion, mushrooms. They added the mushrooms after the pizza was cooked. They were still cold! Ordered iced tea but had to ask for sweeteners (none on table). Iced tea was off tasting and sent it back for a pear cider.

My recommendations: retool the interior with an eye toward better, user-friendly lighting and overhaul the menu in favor of a simple, quality product. The pretentions to be a gourmet pizza restaurant just aren't carried through in the uneven service and iffy food. 

If I'm halfway between a Dewey's and PW's guess which direction I'll be headed?

I was a bit skeptical of this place from the moment it opened. One: the location seems odd to me but maybe it's because I rarely make my way to Marathon Motor village during the day time. Two: the theme. Many Nashville restaurants take advantage of garage-style doors and even have similar themes. The difference? They do it well. Garage coffee company felt more like I was there to get my oil changed than to get a solid cup of coffee. It felt like it was trying to cater a crowd that's non-existent in the Nashville coffee scene. 

I often tell people that I have two criteria for liking a coffee shop and it only needs to meet one of them. A) Have a great environment or B) serve a really good product. Garage does neither. Their coffee is  equivalent to a cup you may get at Starbucks, possibly even worse. Sorry, folks.

This restaurant review is really only about the Happy Hour.  Lately, that has been my MO.  In the summer I don't like to eat huge meals so Happy Hours work great.  It's really hard to judge a restaurant correctly this way.  So guys, just remember this was a Happy Hour review and doesn't reflect their true menu.  Went there Friday night with our friends.  It was the four of us all looking to share some delectables.  Unfortunately, it didn't quite make it for us.  We shared the Calamari which was fried but came dry without a sauce, no lemon.  It was tasty but I believe could have been better.  Also the smash burger.  I couldn't understand why they called it that.  Except that is a new term for a trend in burgers these days.  Since one is opening up in town with just that name (Smash Burger) on Grant and Swan.The burger was very plain and tasteless.  Also ordered the Mahi tacos which just got a so so for us.  The highlight was the fish and chips.  Actually, the fish was made to perfection.  Crispy, dry on the outside with a beautiful white fish inside.  I'd highly recommend that.  The fries were very plain and ordinary to say the least.  Ordered the salad on the happy hour and it was totally bland. I would come back just for the fish and disregard the chips. The service was fine.  We had a lovely, cheery server.  The place is trendy and quite lovely with the views of the mountains.  By the time we left the place was hopping mostly at the bar.  It is definitely worthwhile going to.  I love to see Restaurants do well here in Tucson. I will be back.  I'm not trying to bad mouth this place but  because I am an honest reviewer I might be coming off a little harsh.   I will be back and get the fish and try some other interesting dishes.  They do have an extensive selection of Happy Hour dishes.  Even more than other restaurants.  So certainly it is worth coming here and enjoying this trendy spot.
Very change resistant feel bland food the waiter telling each other the fuck off make for a wonderful atmosphere  one and done well not go back

chargrilled oysters---GET THEM NOW!! 

I am dreaming of them as I sit here clear across the country from Drago's
Very good food, fast and friendly service. One of the few decent breakfast places in the French Quarter. Great coffee as well! Worth the walk from anywhere in the area. You won't be disappointed!

Born and raised in Louisiana-best shrimp poboy I've ever had!! Newly remodeled, clean and pleasant. Counter lady was really nice and helped me decide between a large and small. Small was huge and I could only finish half. Bread was perfect and shrimp were nice sized and not greasy. Even the fries were light and delicious. 

Will definitely be back!!

This place just makes me irritated.  These people realize this is a zero quality fast food place, right?  Their "food products" are somewhere below generic lunch counter, and somewhere above school cafeteria food.

When this is the case, the LEAST they can do is be prompt, and they just aren't.  They're slow as heck when I ordered just one blizzard.

Basically, they've got a very mediocre product, one which I considered overpriced, and since it's too darn slow, what's the darn point?
The service was terrible. The food was cold and late. It's not the waiters' fault- it's the kitchens disorganization.

Don't go here if you are dairy sensitive. While their website lists several options of dairy free sorbets they only have one and will insist a cone is the wrong choice so your friends will eat ice cream and you will watch.

The concept of Subway-style Mexican fast food has been around for well over a decade now, but I do remember that Qdoba was an early pioneer in that format.  

The Qdoba at Clay Terrace is situated toward the middle of the outdoor mall, near the Corner Bakery.  I've always found the service to be decent, and the food quality is on par with other quick-serve Mexican fast food restaurants of its kind.  Qdoba has made an effort in recent years to change their menu and have it keep pace with changing customer tastes and dining habits.  I usually stick with the tried & true menu items, like the Queso burrito.  It's not exactly calorie-friendly, but it's a crowd pleaser.
Did not eat here, but had a few drinks. It's a good bar to catch a game and feel a good sports bar vibe. Darts are always fun to if you know how to keep track of your own score.

Visited this place last weekend. I ordered Strawberry Cheesecake and was told, they can't make it cause they're out of cheesecake bits. So I opted for the Taro and was told that they don't have it either. I went to the mall to try this place and left disappointed with their service.

By far one of my favorite places to grab sushi/hibachi in the city. Super inexpensive. Kind of a hole in the wall-- not a place you'd necessarily go unless you know about it. But honestly, I go here 2-3 times a week and it never gets old. It's pretty hard to find a place that has sushi AND hibachi that doesn't cost a fortune per person.. 

Anyways, I always get the same thing: crunchy roll + miso and my boyfriend gets hibachi steak & shrimp (which comes with fried rice, hibachi veggies, and miso).. The grand total generally comes out to be about $25. **if it's during their lunch special (which lasts until 4:00 on weekdays, it's about $19)... ENOUGH SAID.

I honestly have nothing bad to say about this place, they never ever disappoint. I highly recommend it!!

My review is based on sampling the other ramen, but mainly ordering the terakawa ramen. Usually, when trying a new restaurant out, i tend to order the house special. If  it's named after the restaurant, it should probably be their best dish and in this case, it was. 

I've been there twice and ordered the Terakawa bowl both times. I've sampled friends' dishes that went with the standard ramen, shoya and such, but they were vastly inferior. I would not recommend ordering those at all. As far as the standard ones go, the noodles are different

Different but delicious. Cannot go wrong with pho or bun bo hue.

If you are tired of pho then order canh chua and ca kho to. 

Great customer service too.
Very good, lots of unique dishes; would recommend the burger on pao de queijo with yucca fries, and the coxinha chicken-filled pastry
First time back here 20 years. It was delicious. Clams, muscles, pork tacos and chip and salsa of course. Delicious and spicy.
Great food great service!!  One of my favorite places to eat. Love going on Tuesdays bite and then going to the movies.

Some of the best Thai food I ever ate. We have been here dozens of times and it is always very very good!  It is our family go-to place.  Consistently good and always fresh. Always has plenty of business because people know good food! :)
My husband and I had a great time with this company. Our tour guide, Joel, was knowledgeable and very personable and obviously enjoys conducting the tours. Informative and a great way to spend a day.

Definitely in between Minado and the typical Chinese buffet. Quality is slightly less than Minado but slightly better than the latter. The rolls are slightly oversauced but plentiful in type. There is not green tea or red bean ice cream machine, but they do have vanilla and a dessert bar. The other difference I noticed is that there are more Korean food items, and also a Soondubu bar for the enthusiast. I did not try this, so I can't comment on the taste.

I do recommend the Shabu-Shabu- you tell your server and he/she brings a pot of clams (soup base) to your table. You can pick your choice of meat, seafood and veggies and bring it to your table to cook. Their shabu shabu sauce is tasty. 

3 stars is just about right if you choose wisely.

My sister brought me to Katie's
For my last meal in NOLA. 
I was craving something local. 
Like a PoBoy and a cola!

Like many places around town 
There's a plaque showing the water line. 
But one big, nasty hurricane 
Won't squash peoples desire to dine!

From pics, I knew I wanted to try
The yummy crawfish beignet. 
The dough was flaky, the seafood fresh,
The cheese sauce spicy like Kimye!

But what I really came here for
Was an authentic NOLA PoBoy. 
Sadly, I was disappointed. 
It was more like a So-So Boy. 

The breading didn't have much flavor
Most of the shrimp still had veins. 
But I just asked for remoulade and ate it. 
I'm usually not one who complains. 

My sis really liked her crab cakes. 
Garnished with more lump meat on top. 
Overall, I enjoyed my experience,
I was happy to have Katie's as our last stop.
Food was okay. Staff was friendly. Owner blew up at me on google for staying the food was "plain". There are so many other choices to dine that I could really not care less.

Everytime, I'm in NOLA I feel compelled to stop at Surrey's, one of my top 5 Pick best restaurants in Nola. Surrey's makes the list each time. The service is great, always greeted by a friendly host with a smile. The food can stand alone in any contest! My all time favorite is the shrimp and grits and I'm from the great city of New Orleans,  ya heard me, 7th Ward. Kudos to Chef and staff. 
If anyone wants to have a shrimp and grits cook off, I'll be happy to be one of the judges.
Thank you!
Mrs.Reed
Went just last week, they had a really efficient process for social distancing and my food came out quickly. Plus my sandwich was delicious as always!

I wasn't really expecting to love Hablo Taco based on the mixed Yelp reviews, but I actually really liked it!

Upon arrival, I noted a very touristy vibe in here (daiquiri machines on the walls, over the top decor, etc).  I was a bit nervous about the food due to this, but the food was actually very very good.

I started with a sangria rita (2 of my favorite things mixed together).  It was a very large drink and for the size, I don't think that the $9 price tag was too bad.  We started with the sriracha guacamole (YUM) and the loaded queso (it had bacon in it) and both were very tasty.  For my meal I had the grilled avocado (filled with fresh ahi tuna and crema sauce) and the Mexican street corn.  The ahi tuna was SO incredibly fresh and the avocado was just perfect - highly recommend this dish.  The Mexican street corn was also very well done and quite scrumptious!  Everyone at my table was happy with their meals from tacos to salads.

Our server was very sweet and was prompt on refilling our chips and getting us anything we requested.   Honestly, I had a very good experience here and I look forward to coming back in the future.

Recently moved to the area and we have tried almost every pizza joint near by. THIS PLACE ROCKS! Wallet friendly, and the toppings were amazing. Not stingy at all. Perfect crust baked just right. We can't wait to eat again. Woman on the phone was very polite!! Thanks

Swamp Tour! Great driver that picked us up on-time from our hotel. Then drove us around to some parts of NOLA since we were all on time, so had some extra time. She showed us some parts of New Orleans destroyed by Hurricane Katrina. Gave us her perspective of what life was like before and after the disaster. Learned a lot from here.

The tour was great. Our swamp boat driver was great. Saw many alligators, and he got them to come really close too, enough for one to jump and ram its body into the side of our boat to reach the sausage/chicken he was feeding them. He was also interacting with the people on the boat, trying to get to know us, too!

Driver back was good, too,

Definitely a great tour. I highly recommend!

This is my favorite deli in the world. So much so that they now know my name, regular order, and my voice when I call in. I'm not joking. And it's awesome.

I always get the house salad and the chicken parmigiano sandwich. The dressing on the house salad is RIDICULOUS. I try to use only half of it so that I can save it to eat the next day on a homemade salad. And their sauce on the chicken parmigiano totally makes the sandwich. That and the yummy, toasty bread.

It's very close to where I work, so I probably go once a week. It's addictive.

My gel polish did not last. The other nail salons I have been to my gel last atleast 2 weeks before needs to be redone. Within days my gel was peeling.

Staff seemed to be so focused on tasks and not providing friendly service.

Would only return if I was desperate.

As if the appeal that Drake and Beyonc stay here when they are in town wasn't enough, The Hutton Hotel in Tennessee captures the essence of luxury and excellent customer service. Upon entering I was greeted with an amazing staff and a free glass of wine. My concierge and staff was accessible by a text message and they were more than accommodating to my every need. The Hutton is also very environmentally friendly, all electricity in your room is accessed through your key card. The room is amazing overlooking the beautiful Tennessee streets, The Hutton is placed perfectly on Broadway, and is not too far away from the bars and restaurants. The ambiance of the room is stellar and creates an environment that makes you feel comfortable and at home. I never wanted to leave and at 21 years I'm considering saving up enough money just to stay here one more night. By far one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had, I wish I was able to give more than 5 stars.

went here for a late dinner. food and drinks were both great. it can get cramped in there but most popular places in rittenhouse can get that way I guess. we found a small piece of plastic in our food (which we finished anyway bc it was delicious) and they handled it so well. after we let our server know, a manager came out and apologized profusely then sent us complimentary crab cakes which were very tasty. my fav were done & dusted, potato croquettes, polenta dish. we also had ricotta, mushroom toast thing, charred caesar and bucatini which were all also prepared well.

The staff was very friendly as you walk in, the atmosphere is very inviting. Food was very delicious,  I had the Morning Meditation and the chickichanga with side of artisian toast. It was all extremely tasty! Will definitely be back when we visit Tucson again. How I wish we had a FW back home.

Friendly neighborhood bar located just south of Forest Park across I-64. Hadn't been in a while, but went recently for their Improv Comedy Night. I watched one act before heading downstairs to watch the Jets-Pats game. This place is a great little dive where the servers make you feel right at home. 

They've got cheap drinks and any and all St. Louis sports to watch. When it comes to food I'd highly recommend the fried chicken. Had it a while back and it was some of the best! If you're looking for a place to grab a decent bite to eat, not feel overwhelmed with crowds or noise and to just watch a game this is a great place to go.

We live a few miles from the toasted monkey. Have been there multiple times and have never been disappointed. The food has always been awesome.  breakfast is our favorite. And service has always been pleasant at the back and front of restaurant. I am really surprised with some of the review. Bathrooms on back can use some help.

Went to Taco Bell on Pyramid Hwy across from Savemart in Spanish Springs tonight. Placed our order at 7:25pm. At about 7:35pm I asked to speak with the manager. I was informed she was busy by the guy up front. He refused to go back and let her know I wanted to speak with her. After watching several other people get there food some with extra food for the delayed service and some with just getting what they ordered our order finally came up at 7:52pm. That is a 27 minute wait for fast food. I asked again to speak to the manager. She told the gentleman who brought our food up she couldn't talk and to handle it. He informed me he was a shift leader and how could he help. I said I want to speak with the manager. When he told her she said I'd have to wait. I said there was no waiting and she could speak with me then. I started to speak and she interrupted. I told her to let me finish. My question was why was no one told in the dining room for eat in or carry out told of a long wait time and how would this be corrected? Brie  (the manager) informed me she could refund me my money. I told her I was not looking for a refund but an explanation as to why no one was told of an extended wait. She said corporate never said they had too and that there were large orders being placed inside and through the drive thru. I said that is ridiculous and that all customers should matter. The rudeness I recieved from the moment we walked in to the moment we left has left such a disgusted taste in my mouth that WE WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN!!! Corporate you need to change your management team and team members and  be there to show them what CUSTOMER SERVICE IS!!!!!

I know people generally use yelp to gush / whine about restaurants depending on their experience, but this TJ Maxx has become one of my favorite shopping places in Boise. 

First off, it's not JUST a furniture store; this is like a normal TJ Maxx with clothing, shoes, handbags plus an extensive "beyond" section of home goods.

Secondly the store is hands down the cleanest and most organized TJ Maxxes I've ever visited. The employees are courteous and efficient (with the possible exception of the jewelry counter). The aisles are wide so you don't need to brush awkwardly past people engaged in their own treasure hunt.

In terms of prices, I feel it's very comparable to the consignment shops in the area or better. And keep in mind you are getting new clothes and a much larger selection. Of course, shopping here may be a hit or miss. Just walking through, I saw Tahari towels, hand-poured perfume candles, a few Armani / skagen watches, juicy couture jewelry, a Ralph Lauren bathing suit, some Jessica Simpson and Steve Madden bags.   

Best Advice for this store: 
A. Know how to sort through junk, 
(For example, know which shirt brands are crap being sold at $1 less than a nicer mall quality. Not all $10 t-shirts are created equal)
B. don't be afraid to explore other areas beyond your normal shopping comfort zone. For example, even though I frequent the juniors / petites section, I always glance though the men's section for ipod speakers, skull candy headphones, and other gadgets. The kids section had backpacks, colorful nail polishes, lip glosses, and juicy couture socks (too small for me, obviously, but potentially a great baby shower present).

What I made off with:
Michael Kors sunglasses: $20
Set of 6 Crystal Wine Glasses: $7 (Retails for $25) 
Large Laura Ashley scented candle $3 (Retails for about 15)
Nike goggles about $7

What I agonized over, but ultimately walked away from:
Tahari nude patent pumps $40 
A Keurig coffee maker
A BCBG watch

Other Impressive Collections
An aisle devoted to pet goods (beds, collars, other accessories), mirrors
Display of Betsy Johnson earring
Really cute wall adhesives
A large collection of area rugs

The Tacky
Ceramic roosters, paper mache zebras statues

Who the heck gives this places less than 5 stars?!  This is about whether this place has the best crawfish in town period. Who the heck looks for ambience when they are going to go pig out on a bunch of awesome crawfish?! Oh Joes chicken wings are the bomb also!!

The burgers aren't bad. The meat is quite flavourful, but seemed to seriously lack salt/pepper. The onion rings and fries were both so-so, nothing special. They didn't have dijon or brown mustard, which I found odd for a gourmet burger place. I'm also not so sure why they're using chopped iceburg lettuce on the burger since chopped lettuce creates a serious bun slippage problem. Overall, it's a good burger, but it could be so much better with a few changes. My wife did like the fact that the "Snack Burger" is perfect in size for her rather small appetite, and it's only $4 so that's a plus.
they put tomatoes on my sandwich, after i told them no tomatoes twice. and then she threw the oil bottle in the olives. they were whispering to eachother, i feel extremely judged.

Best vegan food!  I am obsessed with their gyros!  So amazing and I love the coleslaw and French fries, and although I try to limit my fries (it is hard to do because they are the best!), I still get them.

Service is great too.
they started taking my order at 10:20 and said that they were already on lunch. even though all the breakfast menus were still out...
Didn't flinch. Not once. Obvious where everyone was at or would pop out of, most of the "attractions" are fake.

If it were in Virginia, it'd be VA-Chinatown. And I'd come here even more. So to speak.

One thing I am certain of, is that it's more exciting that the largest city in Saskatchewan. Without doubt, you're better off in Chinatown than Reginatown.

Philadelphia has a beautiful Chinatown with little alleys and a crisscross of roads that reminds me a little bit of a slightly larger Boston Chinatown, and it's significantly better than the one in DC, but what isn't.

It's a traditional Chinatown with a big gate right in the heart of the city, which makes for a great tourist attraction. There is some really great Boba around here too, as well as some not-so-good Boba.

But I would say some of the best Boba in the Philly area is within 4 blocks of this gate, and there's plenty of amazing food located right here in Chinatown, which makes it a real destination for us, and we like it. Parking is an issue though, like at your mother's place.

For Boba try Mr Wish, KFT, Mr Camp, Tsaocaa, Tea Do (open later), and more.

My old review said:

A lot of people think of NYC and San Francisco as the Chinatowns of the USA. But cities like Boston, DC, Houston and Philadelphia have wonderful Chinatowns of their own, complete with the "gate" and all.

The Philly Chinatown is much smaller and less-frequented than the one in NYC, but it's absolutely wonderful. It's mainly just 1 street, although technically it's several square blocks. The one street is like being in China itself, but in a Philly terraced row-houses neighbourhood setting. There's a little of everything, and if you like Chinese food and goods, you'll never get tired. There are some nice dessert and bubble tea shops along here too.

Perhaps the best part is that Chinatown Philly is close to everything. It's about 10 minutes walk from the Liberty Bell and 5 minutes walk from Reading Terminal Market, which has much of the best food in town. It's one of the most notable and enjoyable little Chinese neighborhoods in North America.

So if you feel saddened or down
I know just what will erase your frown
We'll both strip down naked
Steal a car, and take it
Out joyriding in Chinatown.

If you want something from this Starbucks you need to go through the drive-through. The wait times are extremely long. You go inside hoping to get your drink and as you watch them serve every car in the drive-through before they get to your order it is frustrating. I've given this place about six tries now but it has consistent customer service. I think I'll take a pass.

Absolutely a perfect meal.  Wife ordered the Lobster Crab Cake and I had the Ahi and Shrimp and they were fantastic.  The service was great and the manager always makes us feel welcome and appreciated.  Could not have been any better and we'll be back soon.
Lives up to the hype. Thank you. I do wish the portions were a little more "shareable" on some of the small plates.

So happy we decided to take a tour with Ernie. His knowledge, love and enthusiasm about the city makes his tour a must see.   While learning about the city he also made it fun.  I walked away reciting fun facts to friends.  Highly recommended.

My husband's family has shopped here for 15+ years. My husband and I recently moved into the area and would rather give a family owned store our business. I have called twice (out of respect) to order their meat special. I called both times early in the morning and said I'd like to come pick up later in the day when it is ready. Whoever answers the phone, (seems like the same lady) makes me feel like it is a burden to order from them. She states their so busy they probably won't be able to get to it today. I understand your busy making food for businesses but then don't sell to the public. The lack of costumer service is disgraceful. I was only trying to help a business out but I see my business is not wanted nor needed. I will not return.

Two people can eat for $20, if they don't order drinks. I love the veggie burger. The fries and onion rings are great, too. It's a nice outdoor setting, if the weather is fine. 101 Freeway is right there, so that can be a bit noisy.

The kids behind the counter are fast, efficient and helpful. Lots of smiles.

My only gripe is that some people allow their kids to run around, with noticeably little to no supervision. We were having a really nice lunch, until a little girl (definitely old enough to know better) wouldn't let up on chasing birds. Around and around she went, terrorizing the birds.  Mommy didn't even look up. 

The sandbox is a nice feature, and I noticed kids making new friends, which was sweet.

The ribeye is delicious and so are the sides that came with it.

It was cooked perfectly and service was excellent.

I recommend coming here. Although pricey, I would still come back.

The staff was so kind when I went the other morning. The food is also very delicious. Only problem was that I was surprised that the cinnamon roll wasn't as fresh as I expected for the early hour that I was there.

Of all the lunch places that I frequented during my time working downtown, Blues City deli is the place that I miss the most.

The Italian Beef with sweet and hot peppers is by far my favorite sandwich here, but the overkill of green olive tapanade on the muffeletta is a close 2nd.  Also, given how generous they are with toppings with the Blues City dog, I'd choose this place over plenty other hot dog spots.

Either way, when deciding to come here, always plan for a spot to eat at once you get your food.  I think I've only eaten on location once.  Every other time was either at some picnic table elsewhere, back at the office, or just in the car, Sonic style.

I think I'm going to find random excuses to grab lunch with people just to eat here.

We came during a busy weekend of Essence Festival. There as no hostess to greet the many people waiting at the entrance. The manager was very rude to the customers who tried to explain who was next in line. The waiting list was not updated and several guest left. The food was good but the experience was less tasty

I have to agree: the clam chowder is to die for and the salad is fresh but so is everything else!

Oysters on Half Shell! My favorite was the Morroy bay, however the blue point ones were also delicious. 

We ordered their dinner specials and they hit the spot for craving seafood:

~1/2 Maine lobster, served with onion rings and a salad - wished we ordered the full 1 & 1/2 lbs instead.

~1 steamed rock crab, served with calm chowder and salad - everything about this plate is amazing. 

Keep in mind, this place is tiny and not a typical restaurant with fancy tables. There are counters that run along the front and back of the restaurant. We ate at the counter facing the wharf. The view was nice and relaxing even when we can see the people eating outside. 


 I give this place 4 stars for the food, service, and ambiance =] good find!

Hostess was unenthused about her job. With plenty of open tables our party of 5 was seated at a "pew style" corner booth meant for 4. Our additional person sat on the end of the table. Drinks took 10 mins after we sat down and a basket of bread was offered 1/2 way through the meal... thanks but no thanks! Tiramisu Martini without the Lady Finger left the drink "undressed" and disappointing. The waitress took our food order but didn't deliver to the table the items she wrote down. Service was slow and unattentative. No meatball with my tortellini... and no apology for it. Chicken and Pesto special was greasy with oil floating on top. Chicken Marsala is fried and very untasty. Italian restaurant without Tiramisu as a dessert.... should've been a sign the experience would be poor. Before departing a lack luster lunch, we visited the ladies room. Passing 4 employees hanging around chatting no surprise to find 2 out of 4 stalls without paper and stuff on the floor. Skip this location unless you like your spaghetti without balls!

We've been there several times now, and the employees are absolutely wonderful.  My child is a huge fan of chicken, and can name who has the best and who doesn't... which is dry, which is greasy, and which one is perfect.  This is  now her favorite.  The employees make it a great place to go... always friendly and respectful.

Who other to receive my very FIRST Yelp review than my neighborhood meadery? Very few cities in the Midwest have any establishments that brew and bottle ciders and mead, and we have a business that does it incredibly well right in our backyard.  New Day grants customers the option to sample six different cidars/meads for a very reasonable price and there are typically more than ten to choose from.  While you are sipping, check the menu and shelves to find some fresh meats and cheeses, cupcakes and other pallet pleasers (from other local vendors).  Beyond tastings, full glasses and growler fills are available and the owners and servers put their creative juices together to form one-of-a-kind cocktails-- Blue Velvet and Mamacita Caliente are two of my favs. 

This place has become our Cheers.  It is not uncommon for regulars to be known by name, occupation, and goings-ons in their life by the owners and servers.  Whenever we have friends or family in town we take them here and they undoubtedly want to come back when they return to Indy (or have us get them a growler fill when traveling to them). Do not miss this gem of an establishment! Be ready for a clean and chill atmosphere with high probability that you will discover new tastes and new friends that you will wish you found sooner.
I'm strictly reviewing this place for their BBQ Shrimp since it's my first visit and this is what I had,,,, Awesome!

Close this review right now and start driving to The Shoppes at New Tampa.  Leave regret in your rearview mirror and don't EVER question your decision to drive the extra 17 minutes to Asian Buffet. 

Sure it's going to cost $1 more, but that's what it takes to avoid the deep sadness I'm feeling right now.  The differences between a $7.99 and $8.99 experience are astounding:

For starters, eating in a poorly planned cafeteria setting with power cords all over the walls and very misleading food images posted in the windows as you enter VS a modest exterior and an immediate eyeful of a buffet that punches you in the face with possibilities before you're brought to one of three separate dining areas.

Secondly, taking a first plate that already feels like you've settled for disappointment and shouda, woulda, coulda's VS a first plate that hasn't even scratched the surface of what looked delicious.

Third, did I mention how sad I am right now??

Fourth, 2 servers, 1 hibachi/sushi chef and 1 buffet attendant VS more staff than you can shake a stick at.  Don't get me wrong, this place has really nice servers but something has to make up for the stingy buffet tables they can't afford to even keep half full...

...and that's where I'll finish this up.  Compared to Asian Buffet, this place is a food desert and I had to fight through a scattered mess of fried or cheese covered insanity to find anything remotely Asian and/or healthy.  The move by places like this to cheapen their culinary culture to feed a bunch of fat Americans more calories than Asians will consume in a week is disgusting on so many levels.  I guess if you throw enough gawdy neon lights in a place and slap up a fish tank I'm supposed to be impressed by your exotic oriental heritage???

I'm over it.  The only thing Imperial here is the amount of failure they managed to pack into a single hour of my life!

Ted Drewes is synonymous with Saint Louis and I absolutely get it. I have never been disappointed by the amazing custard here. They have many recipes you can order from or create your own. My favorite is the Christy, an iced brownie with a scoop of vanilla custard covered in hot fudge and caramel. It is unbelievable! Don't let the line worry you, especially in the summer it can look crazy, but they open up so many windows for ordering it always moves quickly and is definitely worth the wait!

Well we gave the Wing House another try and the wings were fabulous! A shot out to Olivia our server who I am sure made it happen. Thank you to Matthew the mgr. who stood there while I tried them to make sure they were good.

I love Vietnamese food and when I have a craving for it, Asian Pho is my go to although it's the furthest from my home. For those who don't know me I don't mind traveling anywhere for great food. Please Note: **The five stars is strictly for the food.** I have always had good service, but I come with my half Vietnamese friends so I'm not sure if that's why. Based on other reviews, service here is hit or miss.
I generally visit on Saturdays or Sundays so I can order their special the Bahn Xeo  since they are only offered those two days and I always have to have a bowl of their delicious pho. There is something about their broth that keeps me coming back. For those who don't really like pho, they also offer combo plates with rice with generous portions of meat and rice. Once you overlook this restaurant is located in a gas station you'll be happy you gave it a shot.

Out of the main bridges in Philly this one is y favorite.The shade of blue really captures the character of the city, simple, beautiful, and candid. It is a splendid way to return home after traveling. Love this bridge, except when driving east...

The food here is good, but I had a bad experience.  There's very little parking out in front of this place and a sign directs patrons to the back parking lot.  What the sign doesn't mention is that the back lot - shared with an auto repair shop - is closed with a big gate and locked at 9 PM.

I had dinner here on a Saturday night, then ran an errand with a friend.  Came back about 10 to find my car behind a padlock and razor wire, in an area with a high fence (also razor-wired).  Messages left on the voice mail, Facebook posts, even a note taped to the front door went unreturned and I wound up being without my car for over 36 hours (the restaurant isn't open Sunday and doesn't open Monday until 11 AM.)  To make matters worse, I had parked near a dumpster and now the smell of spoiled food is pretty bad inside the car.  Hopefully it'll wear off soon.

If you eat here, keep both eyes on your vehicle!  I thought the Pad Thai was excellent, but based on my experience I won't be back soon.  Nobody even apologized, which I thought was the least they could do.

Pizza good, but the place looks a bit dreadful inside. Kind of a weird little place to order pizza from, their cakes are over priced for what you get and if u let the pizza cool the cheese gets pretty hard to chew, but all n all for the price not too bad
I love vegetables so the best item is Hunan Shrimp. Just normal fast food. You cant expect gourmet food ata fast food place. And they are fast! Never cold in fact i have to wait for it to cool down.

I've heard horror stories about other reality companies in the area.  Solo reality was very easy to work with and they were very flexible.  Also, they would sent maintenance right away, even on weekends or the next morning.  They even installed an AC unit I ordered for free!  The property manager, Sean Rapp, was very flexible and easy to work with in particular.

I used All three's for over two weeks when staying in the area. The drivers were all friendly and on time. I mainly used the sedan car service. The bigger cars were all clean but the regular taxis were dirty and a bit beat up so I'd recommend the sedan car service. The price was fair. The phone staff except for one lady was the worst. Terrible phone manners. I found out they have an app I could use and that way I was able to avoid the calls. The app works just like uber. I gave this 4 stars because of the great drivers I encountered and I will use them again for that reason. This would have been a five star review if it were not for the poor phone customer service.
